description:
It doesn't seem like a spot you'd want to head into for Italian, but do it! It was July 4th and my sister was in town, we were hoping to see the fireworks atop the boyfriend's place just a bit further north of North Beach so we dropped by the area hoping to hit up one of the popular spots. Nope. All was full with stupid lines. But, the reviews seemed ok here and the wait was shorter than the other spots, so here we were.

I probably got the Bolognese and we likely got some cheesey appetizer, too, but all of our dishes (likely 5 total plus dessert for 3 people because I over order) were great! This review is to remind myself to come back (despite its decor). I'll be back again now that I've remembered to put this review in.
author: starrynight c.

description:
Decent. Prices were pretty standard relative to SF italian restaurants I've been to. The wait for a table can be pretty rough though during the evening so make reservations, or call ahead so you're not doing what my friends and I did by trying to walk up and find a place. In our defense, we were drinking so ummmm...

Anyway, after a while we were seated at a small table for the three of us. Water came by sparingly, and food took quite a while longer. There was definitely a breeze going through the place as it was somewhat chilly where we were at so the wait was noticeable. The dishes can be pretty large so if you're ordering a lot, space can become an issue. Just to clarify, the dishes themselves are large. 

I had ordered the zucchine al' vapore, ravioli di mozzarella e pomodorini, and a side of sauteed spinach. The flavors were pretty good, I liked the lemon sauce that the zucchini was in. Sauteed spinach was what you would expect. The ravioli were hearty but I wanted more from the sauce.
author: David C.

description:
"Eclectic" is definitely the way to describe the interior here. Every corner is crammed full if details, from hand painted tiles to aged wooden knickknacks and glass bobbles. Very cozy space with some private dining areas that are good for groups like our party of six.

I ordered the spinach ravioli which was a good portion size for one. It tasted pretty fresh, though the no-nonsense arrangement could've been a little more intentional.

Our cups were never empty and overall service was pretty quick. The bread brought to the table before our entrees was the only thing I found lacking. It was pretty default and could've been crustier and chewier, with some hint of being baked in-house that morning or sourced from a local bakery and equally as exciting.
author: Julianne V.

description:
Food: Wasn't crazy about the pastas to be honest. Had several between a big group of us but I just found them too rich & saucy. Not for me

Ambiance: the interior of the restaurant is really cool and eclectic. Actually reminds me of a place back home in Colombia.
author: Laura D.

description:
Caffe Sport has become one of my favorite go-to joints in North Beach for  Italian food. Great authentic food, friendly service and an unparalleled interior decoration design.

Once you walk into Caffe Sport, there is so much to see everywhere. There's art on the dining tables. Lights, paintings and other various colorful objects are hanging in all directions of the restaurant. You can immense yourself in a mini-art show here while eating here. 

The service staff is friendly here. We were told that all the pasta is made in-house here. We decided to share the spaghetti & meatballs, cheesy garlic bread and minestrone soup. Each of the dishes we had ordered is shareable between two persons. The spaghetti & meatballs were easily my favorite dish here; arguable the best 'spaghetti  & meatball' in North Beach. Noodles were cooked perfectly and I loved loved the meatballs. The minestrone soup tasted fresh and had many cut vegetables in the broth. This was a big bowl of soup. The cheesy garlic bread was a bit disappointing for me. It was definitely cheesy, but lacked any other seasoning or flavor. 

I am starting to make my rounds around North Beach and try all the Italian restaurants. Caffe Sport is definitely a place where I will pay a second visit to.
author: Philip M.

description: Enchanting little restaurant with kitschy decor, smiley waitstaff, and amazing food! Came here on a recommendation from my best friend who lived in SF for awhile and loves her Italian food. She said "try the eggplant pasta!" Well, we ended up being distracted from that detail and instead went with the waiters suggestion. Spinach gnocchi with pesto (DREAMY! The color, taste, texture! Try it!!!!) and the chicken Parmesan. It was enough food to feed three of us family style (so that we had a little room left-barely-for the tiramisu) thanks for the memorable dinner
author: Liz M.

description:
Cute restaurant. Great service. Good food. 
It has its own style that I've never seen before. Cool vibes. The staff was very nice and on it.
author: Christine C.

description:
Decor was definitely very interesting.  Very tourist oriented vide. Food was okay, not much impressed where I feel I can't make at home. Considering how long the establishment has been there, I expected more flavorful, if not more authentic Italian taste considering it's located in North Beach/Little Italy. The mushroom risotto would have been great if they didn't leave whole pieces of bay leaves in the dish; didn't notice them until they made it into my mouth, twice.  
Waiter was attentive, considering how bus they were.  Host/manager was terrible. If he was a true professional, he would not be rushing my table. He said the table they gave us was reserved & the party has arrived. He claimed we were there for 2 hours, when we were actually there for 1 hour; this included the time from when we got seated, placed our order, time food cooked/came to table, & finished eating.  He never mentioned the reservation when we were seated. A true professional would have given the customers this information ahead of time, so we can decide if we'd wait for another table or go elsewhere.  
Prior to the interaction w/the manager, our experience there was very positive and I had considered bringing friends/family visiting SF.  Now I have changed my mind.  There's plenty of Italian restaurants in SF, so I definitely will not be returning.
author: Yolie K C.

description: Amazing authentic Sicilian food. Order dishes to share. We shared four dishes in our group of four and could not stop talking about the fresh taste of everything. Have cocktails at nearby North Beach Restaurant because Caffe Sport only serves beer and wine. For dessert cross the street and check out Stella Pastry Cafe. A perfect trifecta of dining in one small street.
author: Patrick M.

description: great, great food. Been here a couple of times. The portions are big which is awesome for the price. The service is really good, all the staff are super attentive. The environment of the restaurant is super quirky and eccentric, which some might find odd, but my boyfriend and I thought it was really cool and interesting. Would definitely recommend and will continue to come back to this place!
author: Natalia C.

description:
Got a reservation for dinner and decided to get three main dishes(a salad, penne dish, and carbonara.) all 3 were pretty good, portions for salad could be bigger but it had a nice tasty dressing with yummy toppings. The food was pretty mediocre and could've been warmer tbh. The crew working were fun and nice. Service was pretty good. 

Nice area. Fun place to visit. Tons of options around here
author: Rachrelle R.

description: Came here for my birthday June 9th. A kitschy small place that takes you back to Italy. Shared a  w Burrata salad, I ordered the porcini ravioli with a glass of Chianti and it was delicious! Ended with their Tiramisu. Parking is tough, I recommend taking Uber or get here at least 1/2 hr and scout for a parking!
author: Corinne S.

description: At first glance it doesn't seem like a great place for Italian, but I was pleasantly surprised!!! Busy but super attentive. The food was out in a timely manner considering how busy hey were. Scampi al Antonio was phenomenal. I could put that sauce on anything and it would be bomb.
author: Mabel J.

description: By far my favorite Italian restaurant in North Beach. All of the food is delicious, service is great, charming atmosphere.
author: Kristina P.

description:
Food was great. Pastas we tried were al dente and flavorful. Cioppino Bianco was cooked just right. Small portion but just enough for one person but we shared it among two of us. Garlic lovers try their specialty shrimp dish. Fried calamari was light and generous in portion size. Late lunch for 10. 

Still the funky decor. 

They do take credit cards and reservations.
author: Debbie C.

description:
I lived in North Beach for the early part of my life. Always passing by this place and wondering why there are so many people outside. Now I know. I got the privilege to come here for a birthday dinner. Though the prices area bit high for my taste, the portion size definitely made up for it.

Caffe Sport is pretty cramped. One road to walk in and you have to crab walk past people. The waiters and waitresses were ok. It took them 20 minutes to bring out a cake though. Uncut and unopened box. No utensils to help out either. No singing (This I don't care too much about but if you were going to take 20 minutes, this is what I expected). Terrible.

Below are my thoughts for all the dishes ordered:
+Risotto a Fungi $22: This was a tasty dish, though the rice was a bit hard/undercooked. Also a small portion.
+Cioppino Rosso $30: Much more flavor than the Bianco. I would get this over Bianco.
++Crab Insalatta $40: This was DELICIOUS. Must get. Huge plate of crab. Sauce is yumm.
-Cioppino Bianco $30: Kind of tasted like boiled seafood. Would skip if you don't want bland
+Vongole All' Vapore $21: I like the clams, good flavor. Not much sand either which is always a plus.
+Scampi All' Antonio $25: I like the white sauce on the shrimp. Looks like a weird dish tho lol
+Rustico All' Antonio $25: Sauce was good but the pasta felt undercooked.
-Chicken Parmiginiana $20: Kind of small dish. The chicken was a bit dry. Can skip.

I'd definitely come back as a group lunch/dinner. Huge shareable portions for a reasonable price.
author: Benita M.

description: The wait staff is great. The appetizers were good, but $25 main course not edible. I hope you have better luck here than we did.
author: Melanie H.

description:
It pains my soul to write this review... My family and I have been coming to this restaurant for 25+ years and has been a staple for any friends and family who wanted good, authentic Italian food. This places has held many fond memories and I would gloat about how AMAZING this place was. Unfortunately, after my experience this past weekend, I found out they have NEW OWNERS. The menu and decor are the same, but the flavor and taste profile does not resemble the previous ownership. 

First off, the ORANGE dipping sauce and bread was a staple of this place. I would get eat an entire loaf of bread with the sauce, that is how good it was. Now, the sauce has completely changed. It tastes more like a jarred vodka pasta sauce, lacking in flavor. ITS NOT EVEN CLOSE TO THE ORIGINAL. 

Secondly, whenever I frequent here, I order the same thing every time, Pasta Meat and Mushrooms and Shrimp Al' Antonio. I've been ordering this for 20+ years. When I went in this past weekend, it was a noticeable difference. The pasta itself changed, and the sauce for both dishes did not resemble the original way. Take a look at the picture I posted of the shrimp, and compare it to past pictures, you'll see the difference for yourself. The shrimp used to be big gulf shrimp, with a thick sauce that was so rich and flavorful. Now, that is not the case. 

I had the pleasure of sitting across from an elderly couple who had frequented the restaurant for longer than my family. When they took one look at the orange sauce and the Shrimp Al' Antonio, they grabbed their things and left the restaurant. That's how noticeable the difference was. 

When I asked the server about the food, I expressed my concern over the flavor and how bland the food was, there was little to no remorse. Didn't even offer to compensate for food we did not want to eat. 

I'm writing this review because I want the new owners to see this and know that the regulars who have patronized this establishment for years can tell the difference. The quality and flavor profiles are not even close to what it used to be. My worry is that the place that I have had such fond memories is heading in a bad direction. I'm willing to give this place another shot and rewrite this review if things change back to truly authentic Italian food. #bringAntonioBack
author: Paolo B.

description:
Very unassuming from the street but in the heart of San Francisco's little Italy district.  Excellent service, very attentive.  

Food was outstanding.  We could have over done it.  We had a prawn dish in a white sauce.  I say white sauce because it didn't taste like an Alfredo but it was to die for.  Lobster stuffed ravioli with a house red sauce.  Sooo good.  

We had red wine, espresso, and finished off dinner with a great desert.  

Highly recommend!!
author: Chris N.

description: My wife and I were on Green St. at North Beach looking for a restaurant right around 9:50PM and several places were close at 10.  Fortunately, we bumped into Caffe Sport.  They sat us quickly, took our order and had our food ready in a timely manner.  We were a bit hesitant to go in, but we are sure glad we did.  Their pesto pasta with shrimp and my wife tried the mushroom ravioli.  Delicious!
author: Salvador L.

description: This place has one of the best minestrone soups I've tasted. The decor inside the restaurant gives it lots of character, the service is excellent and the complimentary bread and dip they give you to start is sublime!
author: Nadya C.

description:
Had lunch and was disappointed., with all the great Italian restaurants in this area, this location fails to impress.
The bartender and waitress were both friendly and polite. 
We asked for fettuccini noodles in a dish as a substitute noodle (because they claimed fettuccini was made in House). We could hear the chef fighting with server making the request, then the request was refused. The meal came, Pesto Penne Pasta, it was undercooked and lacked flavor. The chef actually dropped the second plate off at the table a couple minutes after the first arrived. No smile, no enjoy your meal, and no personality to make you feel like a valued guest. 
I won't be giving this location any future business.
author: Douglas F.

description:
We tried the Della Casa salad and pasta alla panna. We were surprised by the dip they served with the bread - some paste of Jalapeño, garlic, basil, cheese, anchovies  - it was awesome.

Ingredients for salad were individually amazing and very harmonious. Perfect meal all round.
author: Zhong Hong T.

description:
Very good food. Ordered a pasta with shrimps and Alfredo sauce and a garlic bread.
Since it was lunch time, it was not good for two, but the server told us that on dinner time it's usually family style.
author: Marina S.

description: Had the Ciopinno Bianco for lunch. It was fantastic! The portion of seafood was very generous for a $20 plate, tons of crab. If the food is like this consistently I will be ordering once a week. Hats off
author: Braden A.

description:
Okay, so I'm clearly a sucker for restos with character. Check out the restaurant page photos and I think you'll agree that this is the cutest little hole-in-the-wall you've ever seen. Beyond the charm, however, the food is on point. They serve a creamy tomato dipping sauce along with the house bread rather than butter -- and it was deliciously velvety. We also had the spaghetti with pesto, ravioli with marinara, and the spinach gnocchi with meat sauce. All were delicious, but the stand out dish was definitely the gnocchi. Such fluffy pillows of potatoey-spinachy goodness!

Caffe Sport was definitely a win for date night. Go here. On a date. Or don't. Maybe go here if you're craving good Italian food. The end.
author: Vi T.

description: This restaurant is amazing! I have been dreaming about coming back since I left a few weeks ago! Portion sizes are nice, drinks are good...Sangria is amazing and the best damn Alfredo sauce in the world! Staff is great and head chef came out and talked to us too!
author: Erin C.

description:
Disappointed-- friendly, helpful service but my food was not hot. A very quaint and interesting decore. Honestly, I wanted to like it but of the four in our party we were all disappointed by our meals. The petrale sole was a small portion smothered in white sauce. Linguini and clams was weak-- not much flavor. My penne all'Antonio was said to be a house specialty but was disappointing. It was definitely cheesy and the shrimp were tasty but the scallops were dinky. 

Sorry to say this but we were all disappointed.
author: Dennis O.

description:
A must try for pasta aficionados if you happen to be in SF. It seems impossible to get a table without a reservation thou. Service is fast once you get in and food tastes really fresh. 

I'm vegetarian and they have heaps of options to give. Had their alfredo and spinach ravioli and it was yum! 

I must add that I was here about four years ago visiting from overseas and the quality of their food is still the same.
author: Jordan K.

description: The food was amazing and the food was spectacular. Hospitality was amazing our glass was never empty. We will definitely come again.
author: Erika A.

description: I have been going to Caffe Sport for 40+ years and make a point of coming when we are in the bay area which is several times a year.  I have to say the last trip was really disappointing for our whole group, including our kids who grew up eating their food for 30+ years.  The Carni  e Funghi was not special as it used to be.  The Penne pesto was good but not nearly as tasty as it was and nowhere near as creamy.  The Rustica all' Antonio should not even be called by that name because it is nothing like its namesake - no creamy sauce just a slightly lemony juice that seems like it came from the cooked zuchini and shrimp.  It seems they have lost Jewel who was trained to cook the family receipes from the  original owners and whoever is cooking now just doesn't cut it.  For new people it will be ok but for us long time customers it was really a disappointment.  I don't think we will go back.
author: W D.

description:
I started coming to cafe sport in the 2001. It was an experience, not a meal. I came almost every weekend! Our go to's were the cioppino Bianco and the pasta rústica. 

I had dinner here after about a year or more. The service (waiter/server) deserves 5+ stars. 

The food we ordered was way different than what I remembered. After a lovely meal, great company and all the cool memorabilia.... we made a quick bathroom pit stop before leaving and as I was walking out I asked a server if the chef changed? He said yes. I asked what happened to Marcello (the old cook) and I was told he retired. I shared how sad I was about this as he had made us delicious dishes over and over again!... shortly after another gentleman interjected our conversation and began to mention that Marcello's food was terrible blah blah blah. 

This other gentleman asked if I liked the food, and I shrugged and said "well it wasn't what I was expecting, so no". You could physically tell that this man got upset by what I had said. He then proceeded to say "then you don't know anything about food!"

I am STILL IN SHOCK. Apparently the restaurant was sold...and this was the new owner? I think. Regardless, if you ask for my opinion, and you don't like what I had to say, maybe you shouldn't ask for opinions?!

Caffe Sport was my family's spot to celebrate birthday parties, engagements, work accomplishments, academic accomplishments, etc. They even catered my sisters college graduation party!!! The buck stops here, as they say. 

The food I ate wasn't terrible. The quality of the seafood went down by a lot, it just didn't feel fresh, especially the scallops and shrimp. The plate sizes were different too, smaller. Service was very pleasant and fast besides that. 

Will I be coming back soon? no.
Will I recommend this restaurant as my ALL TIME FAVORITE ITALIAN PLACE? No.
author: Jackie Z.

description:
Went here recently for the first time and we are glad we did.

It's a relatively small space, think long and narrow, with very unique decorations on the walls and ceiling. Definitely not the usual Italian restaurant decor.

We had the Salmone Piccata and the Parmigiana di Melanzane. They were both excellent. Fresh and nicely seasoned.

If you like gelato they had several good choices for dessert.

The service was great. As best I could tell it's a team approach. We probably had 5 different servers throughout the meal and they were all helpful.

We'll be back when we're in the neighborhood.
author: Joe G.

description:
This place is amazing.  Adorable decor and true authentic feel.  Excellent service and the food is AMAZING!

They were able to take care of my gluten intolerance with a fabulous salmon and vegetable dish.  The salad with what I think was burrata cheese was delightful.

A must do.  Loved it!!!
author: Carrie B.

description: I ordered Risotto di Mare (seafood risotto).  Tons of seafood: clams, mussels, calamari, shrimps, scallops.  There are more seafoods than rice!  Taste GREAT!!!
author: Jack C.

description: Cool spot right in the middle of North Beach. Had a couple picky eaters with us so we selected Italian and were not disappointed with the selection. Friendly staff accommodated our large group and the food came quickly. Ample portions allowed for comfortable family-style dining. ALL the dishes we had were very good.
author: Eric W.

description: Came with a group of 7 and had a great time. Everyone ordered something different and shared. The risotto di mare was excellent and so was the sangria. Took a while to order and get food but it was worth the wait.
author: Lorene W.

description:
There is a flaw with Yelp ( not that they care). 

There should be a weighting in the age of the reviews...newer reviews getting slightly more weight than say a 10 year old review...as businesses change and evolve.

Caffe Sport is a case in point. When Tony was alive (20 years ago) this place was amazing. I spent many a Friday here celebrating birthdays, engagements, etc. Tony was the pasta Nazi....you did not order...he told you what you were going to have.....and you were glad he did. The food was magnificent.

Gone are those days replaced by an affable group of Latino men ( very nice guys)...but the food really sucks. 

Okay the salads were okay but that was evoo, lettuce, olives, tomatoes, and mozzarella....hard to mess up.

The pastas were really mediocre. The ravioli lacked flavor, were over salted, and served with a mediocre sauce.

The white sauce on the scampi was gloppy funky nonsense...not a light delicate sauce.

Pesto was okay but the penne was too aldente.

What really was bad was the Hersey syrup served on the tiramisu and the cannoli. I mean they just poured that crap on. Needless to say it ruined the desserts!

On the bright side the dipping sauce served with the bread was great.

I would suggest tourists and residents alike not relive the glory days here...as they are far gone and probably not coming back
author: David G.

description:
Wow, used to be my favorite Italian restaurant in the Bay Area. Went there for lunch last weekend, and an Asian woman served us. The service was awful. Had to go ask for bread, and even though she wasn't busy, still took 10 minutes. The food now (almost double) than a few years ago, ($10 now-$17/$21) with a revised menu, was not nearly as good as before, wife's chicken parm was burnt, my calamari was just ok. 

This place used to have charm/character/great waiters/great food, and was my go to place. I admit it's been a few years since I've gone, and they stopped being open for lunch for awhile, but it's totally gone downhill. 

Won't be back.
author: G L.

description: The owner and staff were very friendly and attentive!  The food and drink was what our party of 12 needed to fully enjoy our evening!
author: Brian B.

description:
I'm sad to write this review. We've been eating here a few times a year and tonight will more than likely be the last time we eat here. There's a new owner/chef who added more items on the menu (more choices is always good) but the food was bland. 

The sauce that we loved was the reason that kept bringing us back to this restaurant is no longer the same. When I asked the server what happened, he was kind of confused. He said it was the same recipe with less spice. He tried to bring the sauce back by asking the chef to remake the old one but it didn't taste the same. I'm sad. 

Food presentation doesn't make up for flavorless meal. 

We'll try Sotto Mare next door.
author: Ruby B.

description:
Waitress was pleasant but not overly friendly I ordered  the chipino and asked her to add noodles and it was like I was speaking foreign to her . 
She went to the chief and asked and he said he would do the dinner dish.$49 but couldn't add noodles to his chipino I said I'll just take a chipino in red sauce and a side of noodles.... look at the pic... Delish! For 22$ and 4$ great deal and great meal! Wife had the ravioli but as usual when you order raviolis they bring you like 4 she said the where very tasty but had to eat on others plate to get full. My son had the pesto penne, he devoured it.. the appetizers we below average, the bread which we had to pay extra for go figure was enough taste one slice, waitress should have said something, and she could have brought the bread out with our main course....timing wasn't great...I made it a four star by , as my brother said false advertising ...see my food picture....or it would have just been a three star ....
Go across the street to the live music.....
author: Dan M.

description:
The food is good although heavy. The service decent. The price appropriate for Italian food. I don't think this place stands out at all above any Italian restaurant but it's OK. Can't say it's amazing though.
I was perplexed though when my company offered a Visa gift card to pay for the meal and my credit card to pay the remainder. They split the bill instead. It didn't make sense but we dealt with it.
Would I come back? Meh. But it was worth trying.
author: Jenn T.

description:
If you asked me 2 years ago I would've given this place 5 stars! It was top notch and a place my family and I went every time they visited me in San Francisco. I moved away and came back this week and just like all the times before and I can't believe how much this place has changed and not in a good way. 

Everything from prices, portions and staff it just did not feel like the welcoming place I once frequented. The prices have gone waaay up, the portions (while still delicious) have become half the size. This place was always about sharing and family style and the portions are so small its hard to do that. 

This place really need to go back to the welcoming homey place it once was... I was very disappointed.
author: Rhilee L.

description: This food was amazing! Zucchini in lemon and butter sauce... perfect. Gnocchi in cream sauce... perfect. Risotto with mushrooms- on point! I have never had such delicious Italian food!!!! I will recommend this place to everyone I know!!
author: Sheree K.

description:
Service was good. However food was low quality and overpriced. Four of us had different dishes--clams pasta, shrimp dish, pesto pasta, and ravioli meal. All were low quality and lacked taste. 
In addition, the bread and sauce were cheap and tasteless
Don't waste your money.
author: Susan J.

description: I'm so heartbroken that this place is no longer what it use to be. This use to be my favorite restaurant! My family has been coming here for yeaaarrssss. The bread dipping sauce is different and fishy, dishes are no longer family style (prices still the same though), pasta sauces seem pre made and generic, pasta isn't fresh, and everything is just SAD. I can get Italian this basic for half the price at any chain restaurant on the peninsula. Sad to say I'm done with Caffe Sport
author: Trish M.

description: We had a lovely family dinner at Caffe Sport. The owner was extremely accommodating and helped us create a family style menu for our party of 22 last minute. We ordered the burrata salad, garlic bread, salmon piccata, gnocchi with pesto, penne pasta with meat balls, and spinach ravioli and everything was tasty and reasonably priced for SF. We also loved the complimentary bread and dip they provided. Highly recommend for a large group.
author: Keren S.

description: This place has the kookiest decor.  It almost turned me off to eating here, but it is so good.  Been twice - once to satisfy a chicken parm craving (delicious) and ordered takeout a second time, getting their seafood penne pasta.  Om nom!!
author: Allie G.

description: The server was very dilligent to my requests. I can thank him  for the bottom of my heart for such an unforgettable evening.
author: Antonella B.

description:
This is the last day of business for Latona
family . They've sold the business.
Pesto pasta, meat and mushroom pasta
was as good as it gets. Hopefully nothing 
will change.
    We've been back since change of owners.
They still have great Sicilian dishes
author: Gayle G.

description: This place has such flavorful plates! Definitely worth trying and JOSE is simply the best very kind and attentive.
author: Tania G.

description: This is one of my favorite restaurants in the city! Such good food at reasonable prices in a non-pretentious setting. We always order the cioppino bianco (sp?), which is a seafood platter with a garlicky sauce, and it's amazing. Everything else I've tried here is amazing too! Highly recommend!
author: Ana M.

description: Still and Will always be one of my favorite restaurants. Great service and always friendly and welcoming. The food is incredible and fresh.
author: Diego S.

description:
I'm genuinely puzzled at all the gushing reviews here, so much so that I'd have to guess that many of them must be paid reviews. Caffe Sport is a touristy, old-school Italian-American restaurant where the experience begins when you walk in the door and notice all the kitschy artwork and other objects lining the walls and ceilings. Although service is fast and friendly, the food disappoints. The shrimp antonio, for example, came doused with so much white garlic sauce that you'd think a nuclear winter had set in. The garlicky aftertaste lingered cloyingly long afterwards, and I'd have to presume that all that sauce is used to mask a lack of flavor and/or freshness.

The 4-star Yelp average is indefensible when there are many Italian-themed restaurants in town that are in tune with modern trends and offer better quality for the price. That having been said, maybe it's a good thing that places like these lure all the tourists in, because it leaves room at seriously good places for locals to enjoy.
author: Vincent L.

description: This is probably going to become my favorite italian restaurant. The place is warm and welcoming, the servers and all personnel are extremely helpful  and kind. Last, but not least, the food is outstanding! From the carpaccio to your main entree all os delicious. We ended the night with an outstanding Porto. Definitively will come back and highly recommend!
author: Charles Q.

description: sadly...this place isnt what it use to be  the portions use to be big like family style! now its made not to share unless u really want to?! especially for the price i would expect more. i guess only cause ive been here before and know whay they use to offer versus now, the portions have shrunk and thats a little disappointing!!! waaamp. oh well i guess thats what happens when things change...i miss the old caffe sport!
author: Dipset S.

description: Restaurant was pretty empty around noon but the pasta and wine were both great. Decor is heavy and eclectic for sure. Restaurant def has come things to look around at. The sauce they serve with the bread was pretty delicious and unique!
author: Megan E.

description: $24 for a bowl of spaghetti and meatballs where the portion is barely enough for one. I am not going back.
author: Eric G.

description: Very disappointed after so miles driving to get there from Orange County, the salad was old the food was tribble, we had dinner several time in last 10 years and we just paid them and leave and we never going back to this place
author: Moe K.

description: Jose absolutely made our experience here, thanks so much for being great with our large party. He was friendly, attentive and funny and a great server. I had the porcini mushroom ravioli which was homemade along with their other noodles. The decor was really fun and unique. Great price point for such amazing food too. Huge 5 star!!! We will definitely be back.
author: Angelica S.

description:
Back in the late 70s, 80s and 90s, I went to Caffe Sport a multiple times each year.  Wonderful Sicilian style food, with heavy garlic and olive oil.  There were lines here every night--sometimes over an hour wait.  The service was almost rude.  The waiters asked about your preferences and told you what to order.   I can still picture the head waiter who was from Italy.  Since I was a regular, I never had a long wait for a table.  The worst thing was they did not accept credit cards.

Fast forward to 2016 and there was no wait for a table at 6:30 on a Friday night.  The streets were filled, but Caffe Sport was not.  We noticed a sign in the window indicating a liquor license ownership change.

We ordered the green salad, penne pizziola, penne pesto, filet of sole and cioppino bianco.  The green salad was good and the cioppino was very good.  DH enjoyed his Italian beer and said it was a very reasonable price.  We thought all of the dishes were priced reasonably since the servings were generous.

Either the food is not as good as we remember or our taste buds have matured.  I do think it's the later.  We won't be rushing back here.
author: Joanna S.

description:
The decor is cute. Lots of random stuff. The staff was friendly too.
 The food is supposed to be served family style but it was more like a standard serving at any other restaurant.  I feel like in the past, the servings were larger to truly share with the whole table.  That's why I deducted a star.  Seems like the prices went up as well though half the portions...What the heck is that? Minus one more star.  
We had the spaghetti with pesto, gnocchi with meat sauce, and fettuccini alfredo. The food was good but we decided as a group that we prefer a creamy pesto.  No fault of the restaurant, just wasn't as good as the other items.  
I wish this place was as I remember when I lived here and used to come.  I'd probably come again but won't seek it out any more.  Bummer...
author: Elizabeth M.

description: From good to bad: The dipping sauce for the bread is superb.  The risotto is very good.  The portions are generous.  The dishes tend to be a bit over-sauced, and overpriced for the quality of food.  Avoid the eggplant, it verges on inedible.
author: John S.

description: If you're looking for great Sicilian food in San Francisco look no further than cafe sport! From fried eggplant appetizers to pesto penne pasta, mushroom risotto and they have great wine as well. The environment is very intimate and everyone is treated like family. Service was amazing.
author: Christopher M.

description:
Very good food
No problem.....
But as a customer of 20 years, very different.
Just FYI 
Good food, but different chef,
If you are going to have cafe sport, expect different.
author: S P.

description:
Went to this restaurant without a reservation and we asked for a table of 5 and the hostess told us that it would be ready in 2 minutes. Simultaneously, we also used Yelp Reservations to book a table for the time we were there and the reservation was accepted. 

The hostess informed us that there was no longer a table due to a party ahead of us even though she was setting the table for us and we had made a reservation through Yelp Reservations. 

I am sad to leave a bad review because I have been here before and the pesto pasta is amazing but the experience this time left a sour taste in my mouth and I won't be going back !
author: Larry G.

description: Caffe Sport was simply a marvelous experience.  The service was exceptional, and portions and flavors were fabulous. All four of us had different dishes and each one was perfection.  I am often disappointed when I order Cioppino but Caffe Sport's Cioppino fish stew dish was the best I've ever had. We were all very impressed.  Jose, the new owner of Caffe Sport, has clearly mastered and refined great dining with excellent prices and service.  We will surely be back!
author: Michelle L.

description: Looking at this place from the outside you would never think it was anything special. Decor is amazing folk-arty - place is very small. Got the caprese salad and penne pesto- best pesto I have ever had. We had a large group and had made reservations beforehand / they did a great job with us. Definitely will come back.
author: Sylvia I.

description:
+ No wait! Brilliant! 
+ Spacious seating, great for groups or just an intimate date for 2
+ Excellent attentive service
+ Cioppino is different but just as good as the restaurant next door! 

Can't get a table at Sotto Mare? Walk down the street to Caffe Sport. It seems like Caffe Sport is just overshadowed by its more popular and better marketed/publicized kin up the street - though I can't see why. When Sotto Mare told us our wait would be 45+ minutes, Caffe Sport seated us in just minutes and cleared a lovely large table for just the two of us who were looking to get a nice hot bowl of cioppino in our bellies. Honestly this may be my go-to cioppino spot in North Beach from now on because I'd rather be sitting with room to breathe on comfortable wooden benches at a lovely colorful tiled table than to wait for a mini two-top or bar spot next door.

The INSALATA BURRATA was in all seriousness the most heavenly burrata I've ever had in my life - it had the perfect amount of high quality balsamic vinegar over aptly lemony tart arrugula paired with the creamiest silkiest burrata cheese. The flavors just melted together and I dream about it to this day. The HOUSE MARINATED OLIVES are flavored with garlic, thyme, and rosemary, and were also delicious as an appetizer. 

We decided upon both of their versions of cioppino so we could try them both - the CIOPPINO ROSSO (house marinara sauce) and the CIOPPINO BIANCO (lemon garlic white sauce). The cioppino here isn't soupy - it's more saucy though still slurpable with a spoon, best devoured dipped with bread. The two styles nicely contrasted and are both worth trying. The seafood in both was fresh and generously portioned.

Our server was very helpful and attentive, and he helped us through the menu and made helpful suggestions and kept our wine glasses full.
author: Megan L.

description:
I've been making gnocchi for 40 years and I have to finally admit, that I've not only met my match...they exceeded it. It was better than mine and that's nearly impossible to do. Damn. 
The food here is truly 5 stars!!
author: Corine H.

description: I admit I was hesitant to try this place based on the negative reviews. However, my family of four really enjoyed our dining experience at Caffe Sport. We went for Thanksgiving and my daughter's 13th birthday. The restaurant is totally unique, charming, and cozy. The food was delicious, and the service was friendly. I'd definitely go back, and I recommend Caffe Sport.
author: Lisa W.

description:
The service was poor and the portions were small. 
The waiter argued with us on the order and didn't try to correct the error. We were a party of 10 probably won't return.
author: Laura D.

description: AMAZING food, inviting and charming atmosphere, good service. Unique. We tried the Rústica all Antonio: very well prepared and flavorful and the Linguine o Calamari: al dente, light and flavorful. At this point I will just become repetitive as the place is really good and a must try!
author: Rachel I.

description: Enjoyed a fun family dinner ad a delicious meal - took me so long to decide what to order
author: Robyn P.

description: Glad we found it! Cute little family style Sicilian place. Dipping sauce for the bread mmm. Don't miss it!
author: Dan W.

description:
Food was amazing. Best. Just simply, delicious. Had the caprese salad, penne pesto, and garlic bread. All of it was amazing, complex, flavorful, and delicious. (I'm bleeding garlic and couldn't be happier)
The ambiance was beautiful. Enough has been said. It's small, but quaint.  Lots of old world charm. 
The service was very good. Our waitress smiled and was accommodating. 

But the food? Amazing. That's why you come here. Best Sicilian around.
author: Mr. G.

description: I must agree w the previous patron, the sauce on the Scampi Al Antonio was unimpeachable and the zucchini was a great touch, my son who is a parm conneussiur. .loved the chicken parmesan..new owner was pleasant and doing a great job
author: Carlos E.

description: I just had the best experience in here, the staff are wonderful, the ambiance is so cool and the food was amazing!
author: Melanie H.

description: Came here with a group & we ordered "different" pastas.  Well, the only difference is what kind of meat/seafood/mushrooms came with the pastas. The same sauce was used on every dish!!! Except one had added cream, another had clam juice, and the rest were meh! Oh & the pasta, which I like al-dente was almost raw! I think of all the dishes we had, the Frito-mixto was the only thing  edible! Heck ant frozen pasta dish from a grocery store would've have. Filled the billl tonight. NOT THE SAME AS BEFORE!
author: Edwin V.

description:
I've been going here for many years after my friend brought me to this restaurant. 

Bread and sauce is amazing. If I didn't have to watch my belly. I would be devouring rolls and rolls of bread and sauce

I haven't been disappointed with anything on the menu. 

Something we always order is the meat and mushroom pasta. 

The decor is out of this world.
author: Lyman C.

description:
This place was recommended to us by a guy on our boat tour earlier yesterday. We went last night and were not disappointed! We had a blast! The kitschy decor, small hole in the wall Italian environment, and extremely friendly staff all add 5 stars for us! The bread was very good with the pepper-y sauce. We had two bottles of wine and ordered the stuffed eggplant, a pepper dish, and charcuterie board for apps. Everything was delicious! My friend and I split the spinach gnocchi with pesto and the spinach and cheese stuffed ravioli on a marinara cream sauce. Everything was very tasty and fresh. We absolutely loved Jose! He was amazing and made us feel at home. He even brought us limoncello shots for the 5 of us! 

The friendliness of the staff, the warmth, all make this place a mist visit!!!
author: Stefanie D.

description:
I brought mum here. it's great. really lively and full of life. the food was great, and so was the wine.

we thoroughly enjoyed ourselves. the staff are quick at finding you a table even if they are busy. I recommend to book as this place is popular in the weekend.
author: Alla B.

description: Fresh seafood in the cioppino. Generous amount of crab (6 legs). A good rendition. Clams in linguini were fresh as well. Calamari was good. Tasty dip for the bread. Refilled the bread 3 times. Overall a good meal.
author: Calvin L.

description: It's my first experience with a big city and my girlfriend and I got the recommendation for this restaurant from my uncle. First off the atmosphere was so much fun. The restaurant has wall to wall knick knacks to look at. The staff is happy and bouncing around. They're attentive and courteous. Then the food. Absolutely amazing so much flavor that wasn't overwhelming. The plates are reasonably portioned. Overall I'd recommend this place to anyone who enjoys Italian food. Or just wants a fun experience.
author: Daniel L.

description: Bartender short-changed me, and it was quite obvious that he wanted some confrontation to occur around it. If you want to spend your time dealing with such persons, this is your place.
author: John W.

description:
Very very sad...to find out that Caffe Sport has been sold!

The menu is the same but the food is not.  To give the new owners are fair shake, maybe we need to give them time to iron out the transition/operations.

We truly miss the 4 cheese sauce and Vongole al Vapore, which were very unique to Caffe Sport.
author: R8 T.

description: Food was GREAT! Service was so-so. Our group had the pesto gnocchi, squid ink striped crab ravioli, chicken fettuccine alfredo, seafood cioppino, and spaghetti & meatballs - and the mango panna cotta, limoncello gelato, and coffee gelato for dessert. All delicious, but nothing truly knock-your-socks-off outstanding. The mango panna cotta was definitely the best dessert, but I had major plate envy when I saw someone at a different table order the vanilla gelato with espresso poured over top!
author: Hannah K.

description:
The food was fantastic as always!
Great atmosphere and nostalgia from days gone by. Luis who has been around for a long long time provided us with excellent customer service !!
Thank you !!
author: Pradeep P.

description:
Ended up at Caffe Sport because Sotto Mare had an 1hr 45mins wait and we were not disappointed. 
We ordered the Cioppino Bianco and Cioppino Rosso as that is what we initially came for. 
Both where absolutely amazing but the Bianco stole the show. Just the combination of white wine, butter and enough garlic mixed with so much fresh fish is mouth watering. 

Service was good and get there early as it has limited seating. Oh and did I tell you it fills up rather quickly. 

The decor gives it a unique atmosphere and this combined with the food one will definitely not be disappointed.
author: Charles D.

description: The appetizers including the zucchini with garlic sauce & cheese / cured meat platter were delicious, the sangria was full of real fruits and the risotto al fungi great. Nice service too.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description: My wife and I have eaten here many many times, it's as good Sicilian/Italian food as your going to find. Love the staff, very friendly and knowledgeable, I love to tell them what I feel like eating without looking at the menu and leave it up to them and they haven't failed me yet.  The cold calamari salad is off the hook. The decor of the restaurant is very cool as well. Can't wait to go back
author: Michael O.

description:
They didn't skimp out on the seafood with the antipasto le mare. We ordered the Rustica and Pesto pasta and both were pretty decent (pesto sauce was interesting). If there's anything I want to rave about that, definitely the bread and this brown sauce that they served on-the-house. I asked them what was in the sauce and they told me it was a combination of jalapenos, spices, anchovies, and a bunch of other things. Sounds like some secret family recipe. I almost ate a dinner's worth from just dipping the bread in that sauce alone. 

Food aside, the place is beautiful and not too crowded for a Thursday night. The decor is amazing, and there's just clutter everywhere (on the ceiling, on the shelves). This place seems to have history.
author: Kim L.

description: At the recommendation of a friend from Minneapolis we stopped by Caffe Sport while we were in town. I was told they had Authentic Sicilian food, and had quaint & unique decor. Was not disappointed as it was one of the best Italian restaurants that I have been to in quite some time. My wife had the risotto and I had the Sicilian meatballs. Both superb!  Service was outstanding and very attentive!  A definite must try and we will definitely go again!
author: Jason M.

description:
This place is like going to my grandmas house for dinner friendly, cozy, tasty
If you are in north beach area give it a try the food is good staff is friendly place os clean enjoy and write a review let people know what you think !
author: Joe O.

description:
What a busy place! We made reservations for a large group and they host over booked us. He accommodated but we had to split up the group. 

Food took a while to get and everyone ate separately. 

We had to ask several times for the same item that we were requesting. Seemed to be scattered and just to busy for them to handle. 

Food was ok! We were all burping up garlic all night hahaha. Even though no one had the same plate! 

I go out for quality and service. I don't mind paying for a good dinner. But this one was expensive and the quality and service just wasn't to par for it's pricing. 

Maybe next time.
author: JP C.

description: The food was amazing!!!!!! The sauce to start it out was superb and my main was one of the best dishes I've ever had.
author: Ashley A.

description: What a great find!   We are foodies and we love finding great restaurants by accident.   That's what happened to us this weekend.   The food here is incredible, and the staff is great.   We got lucky and slipped in here when the tourists (like us) were blindly trying to get into a well marketed but unfriendly "Sotto"place next-door.   That place was rude, snobby and dumb, because we found our new "go-to" spot in SF.   From the fried Calamari and Shrimp appetizer which was artfully served and seasoned, to the delicious Traditional Pastas, whole Lobster, omg there's so much here we want to try now.   Super friendly people, cool atmosphere, owner cooks and hosts with his crew....   they love good food and it shows.   This is a MUST GO for SF food lovers.   We will be back every time here, absolutely.
author: Dave R.

description: This is our first time here and plan to return when we visit the city again!  We had a party of 13 and the service was fantastic!  Jose Franco, the owner, took our orders and served us with gusto and enthusiasm.  Garlic/cheese bread was out of this world and the Cioppino Rosso was the best that I've ever eaten.  Everyone enjoyed their meal.... My mom is turning 90 and was too full for dessert, so Jose presented her with a plastic lobster holding a lit candle...such a fun night of great food and laughter!!!  Thank you , Jose,  for making this such a memorable evening!!!
author: Diane D.

description: Found this place on Yelp and was very excited as it appeared highly regarded. Ordered a burrata appetizer and the spinach ravioli. Everything was alright, the service was just ok but the price was ridiculously high. I paid $26 for just the ravioli and it only had 6 pieces. I balked at the $4.50 I spent with each ravioli piece I ate. So in summary, I wouldn't go back, this place is over priced for what you get and quality is just average.
author: Alexander N.

description: My wife and I visited Caffe Sport while looking for a new place in San Francisco.  The staff did an excellent job and the food was served nice and hot.
author: J P.

description: The waiters are awesome! I came here for my birthday, and they treated us so well. Plus, the food was delicious! Thank you for such a great time!!
author: Kelly H.

description:
This is a madhouse, the closest thing that the City now has to SF legend Fredrick Kuhn's "Old Spaghetti Factory" and "Savoy Tivoli". It used to be run by a would-be-dictator type (Antonio) who would send out whatever he wanted regardless of what was ordered, but everything, though steeped in garlic, was really, really superb. Alas, Tony has long been gone to the Great Ristorante in the Sky, and the food has been toned down considerably.

Nowadays, this is a more civilized establishment, and the food is not bad at all, but for all of us who tasted the wizardry of the cooking in the 70's and 80's,  it is a letdown.

Come here for Sicilian interpretations of seafood cookery that may not be as distinctive as once before, but if you are new or too young to remember, this may be a great experience.
At least the service is far better now, and the people seem to be quite nice.
author: George T.

description:
Food was good but not as good as I remembered. Lasagna special was advertised as having bechamel sauce but came with red sauce. Other dish was tortellini and mushrooms. Dishes were under seasoned. Tomato-y bread dip was delicious as was side of zucchini with Alfredo sauce. Wines were all good. 

The staff were very friendly. When they found out I wasn't happy with my entree, they served us extra wine and a house special strawberry aperitif   Coffee meh. Tira misu fabulous; coffee gelato was grainy and not too flavorful. Sad that the food is not as good as it once was. Atmosphere fun and kitschy.
author: Trish H.

description: I could not have been happier with my meal. The staff were amazing, the Ambiance is fantastic, and best of all, the food was awesome. Seven of us were packed into a booth, it was tight, but we all loved it.
author: scott h.

description:
Yes, it's kitschy.
Ok, it's really kitschy.
But, it's good for you to do some kitsch once in a while.
Why, you ask?
Because if you never do, then how will you grow up to be a well rounded individual?
How?

The pesto here is the best pesto in NB.

The crab salad is amazing.  It's a cold dish.  It is made in a heavenly white garlic sauce that is so good you'll be licking your fingers in sheer delight.

The house sauce for bread dipping.  If it settles, just stir it all up.  It's fantastic.

I believe these 3 things are what is great about this place, & they are why I go back.

Along w the awesome servers.  

And, along w the kitsch.

It's family style.  One plate is meant to be shared w your peeps.  Bring 'em!  Mangia!

Try & sit in the large, semi private, elevated table, or in a booth.  I think this adds to the "whole thing."

The whole family Italian thing.

4 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description: The spaghetti and meatballs were the best we've ever had. Didn't think pasta could taste so "fresh." Would consider going back to SF just to go here again...
author: Jessica K.

description:
I wished i could get the recipe for their dipping sauce for their bread, it's my favorite and most unusual tasting sauce to dip your bread in, most place have a seasonings and olive oil, this is spicy with tomato & cheese favor. It's terrific.   

The food here is fantastic, I would be a regular if i lived close be. The portions are big and the choices are great, it would a pleasure to try everything they have on the menu. 

It's another institution that has served many, many people. I can see why it's stood the test of time.
author: Jim C.

description: Very good ambience. The woodwork is just too good. Each sitting table looks different than the other. The choppiono bianco, lobster ravioli and gnocchi with meat sauce are the best items.
author: Ash M.

description: Home cooking at it's best!  Had very nice authentic spaghetti and meatballs here very delicious. I was with a party of 4 and the place has old world charm, the food was excellent and the wine was excellent.  Walking distance to Beach Blanket Babylon!
author: Michael C.

description:
Service was slow on Saturday- so beware if you are on a "time table". When we showed up, the waiter told us there would be a 15 min wait- 15 min turned into 45, and then 1hr. If they have a long wait they should be upfront about it and not string you along. Once seated the wait was long to get the food served.
Food was "ok". My garlic bread was burnt to a charcoal crisp and my calamari was tough.
author: John A.

description: This is a MUST!! I went while traveling in San Francisco and still dream about the white garlic sauce and alfredo sauce. We were told about this place by a local. Checked it out for my birthday dinner. The restaurant has a cozy vibe with lots to look at on the walls. The waiter was very kind and attentive. The dipping sauce with the bread was amazing. The food was FANTASTIC! Specifically the scampi al' Antonio ! Soooo good. For the dessert we tried the tiramisu and it was heaven. I highly HIGHLY recommend this little gem. It doesn't look like much on the outside but the food is outstanding.
author: Ashley B.

description: This place was amazing! Recommended to us by a coworker and it did not disappoint. Everything was fresh and delicious, the service was excellent and I loved the decor in the restaurant.
author: Rose C.

description: Thank you Caffe Sport for an amazing evening! Your carbonara was the best I've had, your staff is attentive and friendly and the atmosphere is something you have to experience. It reminds me of the Italian restaurant I grew up eating at with my parents that has since closed, we can't wait to return!!! If you haven't tried this gem you don't know what you are missing.
author: Tigerlily S.

description: Always a great meal in such an iconic city.  Cafe Sport is a unique experience.  You could spend hours just looking at all the "stuff" on the walls and ceilings.  The food is consistently fine quality and staff have always been helpful.  They offer a wide range of wines to go with your meal.
author: Sherry H.

description:
Super North Beach Italian.  I don't know where the name came from but it's just what I want in an Italian restaurant.  It's the opposite of the sterile white tablecloth restaurant.  This is casual, lots of "stuff" on the walls and at the tables/booths.  
We made a reservation online for 7 PM, got seated right away.  Wine, olives for appetizer, and 2 entrees.  Friendly efficient service.  Good prices.  We loved the food.  Can't think of one complaint so we'll go with 5 stars.
author: Robert C.

description:
The waiter who I also think was some kind of manager acted weird and childish. The staff was stressed and we almost felt as we were in their way. My 11 year old daughter hadn't finished her can of soda before they took it away. I asked if she could have it back and the manager gave her a new one but told us irritated that it indeed was finished. Like we would scam them for a free soda... Maybe in an adult way of looking at it but he could have asked her instead of being eager to have us leave so he could bring in new guests. We got the check when we had just started with the desserts which is not very pleasant at a new years eve dinner.  After the can incident the waiter stopped talking to us for the rest of the evening and didn't even answered when I thanked him for a really tasty dinner. 
Why I still give the place 3 stars is because of the really good food and the other staff members who were friendly and service minded.
author: Krysmyntha S.

description:
My wife and I recently got married in SF and chose to hold our rehearsal dinner at Caffe Sport, a few blocks from the Church where we were married the following day. Growing up in the city, I had already been going to Caffe Sport since I was a kid and my wife's family often went there for birthdays and other family celebrations, so needless to say we were already big fans of the restaurant. Caffe Sport is one of those iconic North Beach establishments that has survived over time as the neighborhood has changed around it. It has not changed a bit, keeping its funky artwork and decorations that cover the walls (and ceiling) and maintaining the familiar atmosphere that regulars have come to love. Every time you step into the restaurant, it's a bit like you're stepping back in time. 
Our experience the night of our rehearsal dinner was nothing short of perfect and we can say it is a direct result of the hard work and exceptional customer service put forth by the business owner Jose Franco and his team. We chose to reserve the small room in the back of their restaurant to accommodate our group of 26. It was an intimate setting and allowed everyone to mingle together. I got in contact with Jose Franco several months before our rehearsal dinner, to talk about menu options, wine for the dinner and overall cost. Jose made the entire process easy, and I felt he was someone I could trust from the first conversation we had. Jose is clearly passionate about the success of his business and just as import, the satisfaction of his customers. The night of our dinner, Jose and his team were hustling, keeping the wine flowing, checking in with each table frequently, and basically making us feel at home in his restaurant. That is something you cannot often say about dining in the city of San Francisco. Dining at Caffe Sport is family style, so portions are generous, and personally I think they have some of the best pasta dishes, certainly in the North Beach area, but moreover in SF. Jose gave us several options when we were coming up with the menu, and set us up with a 5-course meal for a very reasonable price when compared to comparable restaurant options. No joke, we ate like kings, and finished off the meal with a great Tiramisu.
Jose and his staff were very good to us and we thank them for making our special night a total success. We came away feeling as though we had made new friends with Jose and his staff and will be back to visit with him again soon. Jose is a family man and took a personal interest in our story, of how we met and all the details surrounding our wedding. It was clearly genuine and it was very obvious that Jose Franco is a stand-up business owner. Cannot say enough good things about Jose and his crew. Thanks Jose, see you around the neighborhood!
author: Colin F.

description: This place may have been a four (4) star restaurant at one point in time, but sadly it's gone down hill. The place itself is in dire need of dusting and plain cleaning. The food is no longer what it use to be. We placed a simple lunch order; house salad, gnocchi with pesto and the carne de fungi (beef & pork pasta). In San Francisco Italian Restaurants you can pretty much determine if the food will be good,  by the bread they serve. Well, the bread was sliced white bread. The entrees were served the salad forgotten. The gnocchi dumplings were heavy ( not light and airy) and drowned in pesto sauce which lacked  flavor. It appeared to have had dried shavings of basil. The beef and pork pasta was flavorless and had a total of one mushroom cut in half. No fresh parm served here. It's the the stuff that comes out of the green can. The waitress never checked on us ( there were only about six people dining at lunch time so she wasn't busy). We had to call her attention to the fact that our salads never arrived. She offered a free dessert on the house. We left our plates with more than half of the meal on them. Will never return. The name lives on, but clearly not the same level as once was. Perhaps,new  ownership and/or new chef or just ????
author: Myra A.

description:
From a non-native Italian New to San Francisco.... 
For the first time since I landed here in the city (in April), I have FINALLY found a place that I can call a "home"!! (outside of my own kitchen)... 

Saturday night, My wife Anna and I walked in to Caffe Sport "the little hole in the wall" as my brother called it with not to much praise and met José and his right hand man Luis. From the second we walked through the door they made me feel like we were part of the family. Just the way a Home style Italian place should be, the way MY Mother's kitchen always is!!!!

My wife is originally from here and went to Caffe Sport all the time as a child with her family, when it was run by the original owner Antonio La Tona. She has told me of the changes, small upgrades, tweaks and the new owners, who were intelligent enough to leave an iconic restaurant alone and not mess with success! To the main-staples that have remained the same, from the fabulously unique and eclectic decor, to the family style and sized dishes, to the open, welcoming and generous staff that treat you like family all remain the same since she was a child... As she always says I am a "fat kid" trap inside a skinny man's body, I could have very well have sat eating all night long but unfortunately they do have to close the doors and go home at some point ;-) 

We will tell anyone and every one who will listen... if you have not been there in a while try it out again and I bet you will love it! If you've never been there before TREAT YOURSELF to impeccable Mom style cooking and every better staff!!   

To José, Luis, Marcelo and the entire staff,
I have had my Yelp account since 2013 but never found a place good or bad that has been so deserving of my time to write about. So, as my very first review I can find no better and more deserving of a place than Caffe Sport and all of you...

Thank You Very Much and we will see you soon!!!!
David & Anna
author: David F.

description:
Our family has been coming to this restaurant since the 80s. It has been our favorite restaurant for decades and the place we go for birthday celebrations, family dinners, etc. We are HEARTBROKEN to report on our most recent visit (1/14/17), our daughter's 10th birthday, that both the food and the service are not what they used to be. 

In years past, we were always greeted with kisses on the cheeks by our favorite Italian waiters, guys who remembered not only your faces, but your favorite dishes, and the fact that your kids downed a plate of mussels in record time. On our most recent visit, the service was non-existent. We saw two employees our entire time, and the one who waited on us was missing much of the meal. We saw several parties come in, look around, and walk out, without any staff even noticing. We had to ask for bread THREE times before it came (and there were only 3 parties eating lunch). 

And our food...it was sub par. The pesto was delicious as usual, but it was all downhill from there. Caffe Sport has always been known for their amazing seafood; however, in the Prawns Al Antonio, usually my favorite dish, the prawns were overcooked and rubbery, like they had been cooked earlier in the day and then re-warmed for our meal. We tried a new dish on the menu, squid ink ravioli with crab, and the pasta was dense and chewy, totally ruining the tender texture of the Dungeness crab inside. 

Our waitress told us that Marcello's had bought the business and everything was to be turned over by the end of January. A very sad end to a real San Francisco gem.
author: Benjamin J.

description: pretty damn amazing. it's off the "strip" of fancy restaurants on Columbus, which--along with the millions of tacky decorations all over the walls--adds to the charm. we ordered pinots (red and white), carpaccio, steamy garlic spinach, seafood risotto, whitefish, and a caramel ice cream dessert. EVERYTHING WAS DELICIOUS.
author: Ronny K.

description: This place is amazing! The food is delicious. The service was a tad slow (busy Saturday night) the reason for 4 stars, however that wouldn't stop me from coming back. The atmosphere definitely seems to give off the Italian vibe in its truest form. Don't think twice TRY IT.
author: Adrienne F.

description: Will never return to this establishment when in SF. Three tables  occupied in the whole restaurant at 7 pm. Was treated rudely by wait staff  when asking for a table that was not in front of rest rooms or kitchen. Waiter curtly informed me all other tables were reserved! Hard to believe. He sat us at a two top in the front. Another waiter took my friend's order but failed to ask for mine! He was unfriendly as well. He finally came back for mine. When food arrived it was not that good - pasta was very chewy. Waiter never retuned to ask how we were doing. Never asked if perhaps we would want dessert. Had to wait a long time for check. Waiters were friendly and accommodating to the patrons at the other 4 tables in use.  When our waiter finally brought the check still only 4 tables in use - wonder what happened to all those reservations!  Will not go back or recommend- dismal experience.
author: Barbara K.

description: I came here earlier in the year January) with friends who love this place. I loved it! If you love garlic, and if you love authentic Italian food and personality, you will love this place. I can't wait to go back. I live out of town but in my next trip to SF, I'm coming back.
author: Esperanza N.

description: Hands down the best Italian food I have ever eaten and the most eclectic decor. had the regular dinner salad which knocked my socks off. I don't know what it was they were real tomatoes used on it with homegrown taste , the dressing was fabulous. The eggplant parmigiana was the best I ever had, Soto Mare and homemade bread with the dipping sauce was great but an identifiable. Also had the pesto pasta what a spread for under $75 and their house wine was also fabulous
author: Patti P.

description:
We love this place we specifically come here for the white
 cioppino its AMAZING.. However tonight we come here for a birthday celebration and we find a hair in our cioppino, we tell the staff they nicely bring out another one,  the second also had hair in it.. Honestly it wasn't even the hair in the food, it was the way the owner handled it he acted as if we were placing the hair in the dishes on purpose.. What kind of customer service is that?! Not sure if I'll be coming back which is unfortunate the food is really good.. Maybe my next move will be to call the health dept to further inspect..
author: Natasha M.

description:
First off, if you do not like eating family style (sharing your table with strangers) or lots of garlic, then stay home!

RESERVATIONS ARE A MUST!
Call first thing Tuesday morning when they open for a Friday or Saturday seating.  Seatings are only at 3 specific times each night.

ORDERING:
Each party must order at least ONE double order of a dish.  Otherwise, feel free to share single orders of everything else.  The serving sizes are HUGE!  A single order will feed 4.  Think of this like going out for Chinese - everyone orders something and then the whole party shares.  A couple going out for dinner is still going to have to order ONE double order of something, so going to dinner here is better for parties of 4+ .

SERVICE:
They are Italian, arrogant and at times rude.  The waiters are rushed and over worked, so do not expect small talk and mindless chatter.  At the later seating don't be surprised if your waiter is a little drunk... he may have been drinking wine since 4 pm !  Do not be offended or get upset if they ignore you because reservation was made in a name that ends in: -berg, -stein, -witz, -uyen, or -ow.  If you made your reservation under an Italian surname (or ending in a vowel), then expect better than average service.  Your food will not all arrive at the same time, so eat as it arrives.  Besides, there's not enough room on the table. SAVE ROOM, because more food is coming!  Turista , cosa vi aspettate ?

SUCKER...
Oftentimes the kitchen has too much of a good thing (they cooked too much of a dish and it just isn't selling well). So, expect your waiter to simply drop off a double order of something you did not order.  The kitchen is trying to clear it out, the waiters are moving excess inventory, and you're hungry.  But, if YOU TOUCH IT, IT WILL BE ADDED TO YOUR BILL !  AND - You're still going to get all of the food that you ordered as well...  Turista stupido !  They know EXACTLY what they are doing!

FOOD:
With all of it's idiosyncrasies, Caffe Sport is still one of the BEST ITALIAN RESTAURANTS on the PLANET.  Lots of garlic, fresh ingredients, olive oil and authentic recipes.  Tutto Fresco!  The parmigiana melanzane (eggplant parmesan) is to die for - it is a must do!  The gnocchi con pesto is also very tasty.  Tiramisu and a cappuccino for dessert is a must!

DECOR and AMBIENCE:
The cobweb covered prosciutto hanging from the ceiling and the candle wax covered wicker wrapped chianti bottles on the tables should make you feel like a wiseguy, eating dinner in grandma's basement.  The tables are wooden picnic tables or old round electrical reels.  They were racking up LEED Points before it was en vogue !

CASH ONLY!  
Like true Italians... declare $1 to the IRS for every $5 they pocket!

PARKING:
It's North Beach... GOOD LUCK!

They'd get 5 stars if it wasn't for their "DUMP AND RUN" scam of dropping off unordered food.  I've been here 20+ times and it has happened to us on 17-18 visits !  But this is what adds to it's charm. Locals know...
author: Paolo B.

description:
I love visiting North Beach and the Chinatown area.  Whether we are visiting Cobbs, or Bimbo's, we find ourselves having dinner here at Caffe Sport.

Not once, over the many years we have been coming have we been let down.   The 5 stars is for consistency and great everything.

1.  The food is excellent.....I am biased to the clams....in any fashion.
2.  Wine is plentyful  
3.  Service has always been excellent, and actually we have been seated , regardless of how crowded.
4.  Venue is cool and cozy like you are in someones house.....well....someone that like stuff on the wall.....nevermind (its nice).

Solid place, and our "Go To"
author: Tom P.

description:
I am so sad to be sending this but hope that the owner will take note that he has destroyed a North Beach institution.
My husband and I have been dining at Caffe Sport for 33 years. We come up to the city 3-4 times a year and have watched the dining experience their change. When Tony Sr. was in charge it was a well oiled machine. Food constantly warmed your soul and kept you longing to return. In addition, Tony Sr. was a kind soul. His English broken, but his eyes said everything. 
After Tony's passing Tony Jr. took over. He was blessed to keep the food consistently delicious because Marcello the chef remained.
Alas, new owner. No Marcello. A restaurant is only as good as its food. People do not go to a restaurant because they like the server or the decor.
My husband was unable to travel because of his health for the past year. Now healthy, we decided to go for lunch for the first time since the new owner. I am unsure who cooks at dinner but the female chef needs to go back to culinary school. The pasta was barely cooked. I love my pasta al dente, but this was ridiculous. The Antonio sauce instead of being a creamy garlic sauce now has a sour vinegar undertone. They should also not post photos of  receipe's online that Marcello cooked. Their new version of the Cold Calamari Insalata instead of the olive loil, lemon and garlic marinade is in a watery diced giardinnari. It was slimy, awful.
The new owner should beg Marcello to come back and show him how to make the sauces that accompany the dishes. Tony Sr. must be rolling over in his grave.
author: Kathy B.

description: Awesome, authentic food. Cozy atmosphere with staff that makes you feel like family. We ordered several entrees and are family style. Everything was amazing, especially the ravioli. They also were quite knowledgeable about their ingredients, which was helpful to my wife who has Celiac disease. If we are back in The City we plan to come again!
author: Drew R.

description:
Generous portions and even more generous customer service earns this place five stars!

I ordered the pesto penne and the calamari and was more than full after sharing with one other person.

Our server Luis G was real delight as well and the spicy orange sauce was to die for.
author: Austin K.

description: So disappointed!! We were expecting the great family style meals as we always experienced in the past! Quality, and quantity and flavor was extremely lacking! Spaghetti with meatballs(only two small meatballs) had watery tomato sauce! Terrible! The second dish was chicken Parmesan and wasn't even enough to supplement the spaghetti dish! As in the past we always had more than enough food and even took home extra! Even the sauce for dipping for the bread had no flavor! The Capresse salad had terrible unflavored tomatoes that were light red in color! I can get beautiful RED tomatoes at the farmers market every Saturday! For $120 for four people we left hungry!! What happened to this great Restaurant?? NOT coming back!
author: Barbara n.

description: I haven't been here in decades, and am so glad they are still here. The food is still served family style which was perfect for my party of 5. We got some caprese salad and antipasto to start. The cheese was fresh and delicious. The meats were tasty served with olives. We were able to try all the sauces (marinara, pesto, white & pink) on various dishes. We all agreed the marinara was the best we have had, but we all had a "favorites" order. We had a couple of bottles of wine, espresso and shared 2 cannoli --- all this fabulousness was for a bit over $200. We will be back for our next Beach Blanket Babylon show!
author: Laura O.

description:
Really fine Sicilian food - lots of seafood and great pasta with delectable sauces. The alfredo was perfect and the ravioli tasty. The meat sauce with meatballs on spaghetti - to die for! The staff is friendly and the ambiance is comfortable and European at the same time.

Will definitely be back again.
author: Laurie Anne B.

description: A secret find in North Beach! Charming decor. Great Italian family style portions. Awesome place for a party!!!
author: Anna D.

description:
After a long walk home, shellshocked from the experience of this restaurant, I accepted a solemn and terrifying truth: this was the worst restaurant I have ever patronized. Frankly, I'm dumbfounded by the other positive reviews.

The steamed clams were an inexplicable atrocity. It should have been an ultra-simple dish, clams simmered in white wine with garlic and butter, yet this restaurant managed to butcher every aspect. The clams were overcooked and never cleaned. Every bite offered only dry, rubbery flesh or a jarring crunch of sand. The plate was completely flooded in raw garlic paste, a petty attempt to mask the rotting shellfish before me. This is forever seared in my memory as the single worst dish I have ever received.

Even the bread at the beginning of the meal was awful: dry, dense, and stale- as though it were sliced a week prior to my visit and recycled off the plates of other customers who refused to eat it.
author: Emily C.

description:
Hm, this place's decor is quite interesting and a bit kitschy for my taste. But I guess, it's also North Beach and I feel like a lot of the Italian restaurants in this district tend to overdo their interior decorating :p.

Food wise, their pesto is seriously legitimate. It was good over penne, it was good over the gnocchi. Just get the pesto.

Really great service and accommodating (we were a big group) and I really like the family style, family owned vibe they were giving off!

Also, their website says "Cash Only", but they definitely accept credit cards!
author: Christina C.

description:
Cafe Sport had delicious food back in the 80s and 90s. Last night the service was horrible and so was the food. We had Cioppino and the seafood was over cooked. The bread was stale. They brought the main dish right after we received our starters. 
There are so many good restaurants to choose from in North Beach. Sadly, Cafe Sport is no longer one of them.
author: Denise A.
