description: This place may not be everyone's cup of tea. However, if your hungry, enjoy rich Italian food and can bring a big group so you get fed lots and want to try a little bit of everything, this is your place.
author: Brian S.

description: We ended up here by chance and loved it! Both the shrimp Scampi and crab ravioli were great - lovely ambience and awesome customer service.
author: Zeenat U.

description: food was very bland and the place is extremely dusty, looked like it hadn't been cleaned in a while
author: Kayla L.

description: Great service, some dishes are better than others (avoid the fettuccine alfredo - tasted like it was made with powder mix and the chicken was tasteless), and very small portions. They call it family style when you're ordering but it's not. I would say the pasta dishes are less than what you would get at other Italian restaurants and you're paying double.
author: Ryan H.

description: Not sure why so many complainers on here with this sacred and historical spot firmly planted on green street since the 70s. I still come here everyone in around SF since 1978 I've made the trip into this iconic drop. Take a breath enjoy old world goodness. Relax. Have two glasses of wine and open your minds and tastebuds. OG spot. Respect it. New Owners are fine. Longtime Latona family friends and chefs. Worry less eat more.
author: Southbay R.

description:
We started coming to Cafe Sport in the 80's.  For many years the cooks and servers were the same. I visited recently and while there was some turnover the food is consistently excellent! the service friendly and quick and the prices not unreasonable for what you get.  

The crab salad is unparalleled and can't be compared to anywhere.  You get a full plate of crab parts covered in a white garlic sauce that you eat in a messy way with your fingers. By the time you're done garlic is oozing out your pores its amazing. We coupled it with the creamy pesto plate and the mussels and had one of the best meals ever.  Not to mention the bread and gorgonzola, garlic, spicy bread dipping sauce .  I can't wait to come back. We usually come once a year if we are able.
author: Nick P.

description: Fortunately we had a reservation for this restaurant, because when we arrived people were waiting outside on the street. Normally that's a good thing, but I don't think this restaurant warranted that much attention. For starters, we had to Caesar salad and the calamari. Both were excellent. My wife had the penne fettuccine, and the sauce was incredibly thin and really not that much flavor. I had the lobster ravioli, which was good, but not great. The Decour of the restaurant was very eclectic, and interesting. The staff couldn't of been nicer and were very attentive. With all of the other fabulous Italian restaurant in North Beach, I would advise trying someplace else.
author: Greg F.

description: Amazing food and service! Highly recommend this restaurant, incredibly authentic Italian, Jose took great care of us!
author: Micheal C.

description: This place was a Huge surprise and made our evening.  Unbelievable decor and the food was excellent from an incredible house salad (dressing rules) to seafood, pasta and my favorite beer - Moretti la rosa. Plus the new owner is a great character....  We LOVED this place!
author: Tom T.

description:
What is it with people saying "it's to DIE for!", "you MUST try it before you DIE!", "I'd KILL for it!" when describing food? I mean, I get it, but I'm more on the side of life. So, if you're looking for a reason to live, or for something to make your life more enjoyable, stop in at Caffe Sport for a decadent, filling, and flavorful meal.

My dear late granddad used to rave about Caffe Sport. Being a wine aficionado, and an original Mad Man (ad exec for TV Guide mag in the 50s and 60s, nbd), he took my mom and dad out to one of the primo spots in North Beach when he came to visit SF from Napa. My parents had shacked up together in a small Clement St apartment, and my dad boldly thought to ask Grandpa for my mom's hand in marriage over dinner at Caffe Sport (to which Grandpa said no... at first!). Well 26 years later, I'm here, and with four other siblings to boot, I guess it worked itself out after all.

Caffe Sport brought my love of Italian food to the forefront of my taste buds. My parents always made great Italian food when I was growing up, but since they now don't eat meat or dairy, the food during holidays has mostly turned to fruit, eggs, and lentils. I was brought back to Caffe Sport recently with my friend's stepdad who likes to order almost everythingon the menu and eat family style (my favorite!), plus multiple bottles of wine, and lots of desserts. How can I complain?

The Pesto Gnocchi will *gnocchi* your socks off with it's tenderness. One of my favorite dishes of all time is the Rustica al' Antonio. I swear, someone's sweet little Italian grandmother is sitting in the kitchen, singing "That's Amore" in Italian, with a pastry bag of their delicious four cheese sauce, funneling it into each and every piece of penne. 

Okay, that's probably not what's happening, but that's what it tastes like, and it's simply divine. The Steamed Mussels are baller, and I normally don't order mussels or clams because I've read Kitchen Confidential, and, uhh yea, I have my reasons. But the garlic broth with sourdough bread dipped in it, ahhhh, this is probably what life is all about.

Enjoy, Yelpers. It's really a great experience, food and décor wise.
author: Crystal C.

description: Great food and service at this small, hole in the wall Sicilian joint. We had a caprese salad and eggplant involtini for staters, both were delicious along with a few cold Italian Lagers. The pasta plate that followed was good as well, and the dipping sauce they provide for there bread was very addictive. We would definitely return and try some other dishes.
author: M F.

description: there steams garlic clams are out of this world!!!! there squid dish with white sauce is also amazing. Not to mention the rustica pasta is a must have.
author: michael m.

description:
Great food, great service, great atmosphere.

Went here with my family and we all really enjoyed the meal. The waitstaff was very friendly and the food was great. Easy to see why this place has been in business for so long. I will recommend the restaurant to others and look forward to coming back the next time I'm in the city.
author: Chris K.

description: portions are smaller. but they have extended their menu. they have steak now and quite a few other items ! but it is still good .
author: Nellie J.

description: The atmosphere at this place is amazing.  I would go back just for the quirky and eclectic style of this Italian restaurant.  The food was good, not amazing.  Not a dealbreaker...just not compareable to some of the better Italian places I have dined at over the years. Kind of tough when you're located next to Sotto Mare!
author: Denise V.

description: Read a lot of middling to bad reviews before posting this. We went to Caffe Sport recently for the first time so have no way to compare "new" Caffe Sport to "old" Caffe Sport. What I can say is my wife and I stopped for lunch on a nice, sunny day, sat outside, and loved what we ate. OK, I didn't like the bread dipping sauce but it contains anchovies and I can't stand even the slightest hint of them. So, I just didn't dip. My wife had the Gnocchi for lunch and I had the Penne with Sicilian Meatballs. Both dishes rated "Very good" on our scale. Service was crisp and friendly, and as others have noted, no trip there is complete without a good long look around inside. We'll definitely go back.
author: Steve K.

description:
Caffe Sport has a really good vibe, terrific pasta, fresh seafood and a lot of history.  The decorations, service, price was all very agreeable.  There are interesting things to look at in every direction.  It's kind of small, and the benches were a bit on the hard side for your tush, but I got past that pretty quickly.

Our server, Gustavo, was super energetic, friendly, had a nice smile and quick wit.  We enjoyed interacting with him immensely.  If you find yourself in Washington Square, they take walk-ins with about a 15-30 minute wait.  We just went across the street and had a drink while we waited.  

I would recommend this restaurant.  Its tasty and fun.   :)
author: Paul R.

description: Food was awesome.  Best Petrale Sole my husband has ever had in SF.  Scampi w as great too.  Will defiantly come back.
author: Kathey E.

description:
Granted it was the day after Christmas and several staff were probably missing but our waiter should have given us a heads-up.  Service was abysmal.  The entrees for a party of 16 arrived one by one, delivered two hours after we were seated.  No apologies from the waiter.  We had to tell whoever got a dish to eat as the delivery of dishes spanned thirty minutes.  We literally clapped when a dish arrived.  Then as we were waiting for the last dish, the waiter said "the chef says there's no filet of sole, only salmon."  This was two and half hours after it had been ordered.  Bad communication?

On the food side, it was mediocre at best.  The eggplant and chicken parmigiana were overcooked and hard, the pasta with mussels and pesto was way too salty, the carne y fungi was good, the calamari Antonio had a goopy, raw garlic sauce, and the clams were swimming in garlic butter.

Decor is colorful, but there is a lack of structure at the restaurant that makes your dining experience bewildering.
author: Nina K.

description: Worst dining experience of my life. Took two hours to get our food and the dishes did not all come out around the same time. Consistently had to ask for water refills, to take our order, ask where our food was, and to ask for the check.  Waiter came out after about an hour waiting for our food to say that it was coming but we had to ask where it was again 30 minutes later. On top of that, a lot of the dishes were overlooked or incorrect and the waiter came out after all dishes but one were served to say that there was no sole as if they were about to start cooking it two hours after it was ordered!!! The waiter was unapologetic and slow and the food was poor to mediocre at best. Would not recommend.
author: Frances H.

description:
The Good: 
-Located in a lovely area, so perfect if you want to bar hop or walk around to burn off those carbs! 
-Service was great, the bartender brought us drinks since our table wasn't ready yet 
-Food was overall great. I ordered the pesto per the Yelp recommendations and I was just tooooo overwhelmed by the pesto after about 5 bites. Definitely recommend for hard core pesto lovers only :) 
-Wine was fantastic and they even let me take out unfinished bottle to-go 
 
The Bad: 
-This place is tiny, so don't recommend trying to just walk-in on busy nights...make a reservation. I deducted 1 star since we made a reservation, but they didn't have a table for us and we had to wait another 25 minutes. 

The Amazing: 
-The RUSTICA is a must-have!!!
author: Amanda T.

description: Great spot my girlfriend brought us to. The special dipping sauce is amazing! Never have I tried something like it before. I'd come back just to have bread and their sauce. We did order a seafood platter with tomato sauce and carne e funghi. Both were very good. Sauce was a bit watery. Our server, I forget his name, was funny and informative. He even gave us some bread and secret sauce to go!
author: Bernard Q.

description: The best meal I've had in 2017.  This charming Sicilian eatery has everything.  Delicious food, a colorful atmosphere, and impeccable service.  We now know why my girlfriend's parents have been coming here for years.
author: David G.

description: Staff and atmosphere were great but food was mediocre. If you're expecting noodles with your seafood you need to order a side dish. Wine is not the best.
author: Karina A.

description:
YUMMMMMM the place is amazing.  We've eaten here a few times and it's always so good.  What I love about this place is the pasta.  In most places, the pasta is just a carrier for sauce.  Here, the pasta actually have a crave-able taste and texture.  Perfectly al dente.  The sauces are great.  Instead of just olive oil to dip bread, they bring a spicy, creamy red/white sauce.  Wine selection is delicious and very reasonably priced.  

The inside decor is hard to describe - very cool, bright, hand painted objects.  It's almost Spanish looking.  It really makes you feel like you're in a piece of history.
author: Greta R.

description: The Pesto Pasta is what we come here for, although I remember it being so much better.  Been coming here for years and one time we came early for lunch and notice that the portions were smaller compared to dinner.  But the price is also cheaper of course.  Just wish they would keep the same menu. The food is good but again, not as how I remembered it to be a few years back. Something is lacking.  Sometimes, if you're lucky the service is great, other times...good luck! Still giving it a 4-star even though it only deserves 3 1/2
author: EL C.

description:
Their one of the kind sauce & bread for appetizer is the best. You can be full but never too much of it. 
Shrimp Antonio is so delicious! Meat & mushrooms pasta is just melt in your mouth. 

Those waters are friendly, make you feel like at home. 

One of favorite restaurant at all time.
author: Jade L.

description:
This place has been around for 30+ years and I think they stopped caring about their customers about 29 years ago. The quality of the food was poor, bland, and tasteless.  I never leave bad reviews, but I really think the time for this place has past and I want to warn people. If the management wants to keep people coming they need to start from square one and seriously revamp the food. Taking out a lot of that old crusty crap in the place would help too, less is more in that case.  The service also left a lot to be desired. We were the only ones in there and the service as very slow to nonexistent.

One positive there is a lot of kitsch and clutter, but it does seem like they dust it because you would expect it to be covered in grease and dust and it wasn't that much. There was a 30 year old salami hanging next to us that was pretty gross, but not dusty.
author: JC D.

description:
Love this place. Will be going for my birthday. Really heavy. Only complaint is that it is small and gets crowded on the weekends. Parking sucks. Usually have to pay for parking across the street. 

The portions are pretty big. 1 order is good for 4 people. The penne pasta and house salad are a must try. Their chiopinno in white sauce is the best I've ever had. I usually do not care for chiopinno but at caffe sport it's a must. My husband loves the mussels. The complimentary bread with their special sauce is delicious.
author: Lizette T.

description:
I visited Caffe Sport in January while I was in SF for business and absolutely loved it. The ravioli were delicious, the service was personable and downright warm. Tonight, however, while visiting the city for a play, I convinced my mom to grab a bite at Caffe Sport even though she wanted to eat at her favorite spot, Sotto Mare, a few doors down. 

When I checked in with a waiter for my 7pm reservation I was rudely told "um ok you can wait outside like EVERYbody else until we call your name" while he waved a fork around at me with some real flare. A little dumbfounded I took my place outside (with everybody else) and waited some 20 minutes while others were sat. After a few minutes more we approached one of the waiters to confirm that our seats were coming soon, only to find out they had no idea we were here and had no table prepped.

I'm not sure the point of offering reservations if you seat people in the order they arrive. Even more shocking, though was the air of inconvenience with which all of the staff treated us with. Sotto Mare is apparently the better choice next time.
author: Cait S.

description: This used to be our favorite Italian restaurant in San Francisco and had been coming here since 1999.  But in the past 6-9 months, everything has changed.  The food is completely different and just ordinary now.   Ingredients are of much lower quality.  Portions are also now very small.  We have been 2-3 times since this major change happened and are now pretty much giving up on them.
author: AC C.

description: Funny name but this is a very good Italian restaurant and not a sports bar like we initially thought. Very personable waiter who knows the history of the restaurant and he gave us the best suggestions for our first time there. We got the pasta rustics and the ciappino... So delicious we cleaned all the plates. I would come back
author: Anissa S.

description:
I had raved about Cafe Sport so we recently went out to  dinner with friends. I remembered the ambience and thought it would be great for a couple of upcoming team dinners. Unfortunately, the dinner was quite underwhelming. I learned that the restaurant recently changed ownership as the meal was not at all what I remembered. It used to be my go-to restaurant, but I don't think I will be going-to in the future.

The food tastes good enough (nothing wrong with it), but it's lost its WOW factor. I remembered the fun decor and the generous portions. The decor is still funky, but when the waiter brought out our entrees and we all just looked at each other. Food is served family style (fun!)  but the portions were pretty tiny so we were careful to take polite portions.  My favorite dish was the calamari fritti with the garlic aioli sauce. My friend's handmade mozzarella and tomato ravioli was tasty enough, but there were 4 raviolis (for $22) which breaks down to $5.50 a ravioli.  We could probably have doubled our entire dinner order, but instead we just left saddened and still hungry.

On a positive note, we did not have to wait for a table.
author: Cheryl H.

description:
Had my 25th birthday dinner here last night and while it was very busy the service was literally horrendous. The food was alright but not spectacular but the server I don't think spoke english. It was a party of 7 and we had to continuously ask for more water, bread, and to order more drinks, by literally waving down the sever as he continuously ignored us. It took 10 minutes for anyone to even ask if wanted to order drinks when we sat down. The server basically avoided the table and was rude in his interaction making it feel like we were inconvenience him. 

I use to work as a waiter and the service didn't even come close to the bare minimum of acceptable behavior, it just hurts the businesses sales. While Caffe sport has good reviews on yelp and the food was alright the service made everyone in my group never want to return. This is not a one person mistake and should be addressed by management. 

The issue with the service started when we sat down, we waited ten minutes to ordered our few beers and they didn't arrive until we asked again, we asked 5 times for bread and there famous bread dip after waiting over 15 minutes for it.  The sever didn't even try and communicate with us, like we are out of bread and are making more it will be out when its done, or apologies for the innocence of late dishes. We then ordered 7 dishes and only 6 of then arrived. One person in our group  didn't get his plate for another 20 minutes. 

After our table was cleared the waiter just brought the check and never asked if we would like desert or coffee. We then divided up what each person owed and wrote it nicely next to the last 4 digits on the card, we even included tax, which after being a sever know many people forget to divide in. The server ignored us and just divided it evenly among the cards... this was outright wrong, but after such bad service we just left without tipping. We are all such good friends that we called it good and just left. Not a single of of us was happy with the service and because of it I wouldn't recommend this place.
author: Nicholas J.

description:
Intimate place tucked away from view...you enter and immediately feel a good Italian vibe. The bustling waiters are polite and helpful. The food is very good. We had family style dishes of Patrice solr, ravioli, pesto penned and shrimp scampi...all excellently prepared.

It was easy to feel right at home although this was our first visit.

Highly recommend this for a relaxed ding experience with Excellent food.
author: Charles U.

description:
I never go out for Italian because it usually sucks, but this place in SF's North Beach neighborhood made me a believer! We were lucky enough to be seated right away on a busy Sunday night at a prime spot up front where it's a little less cramped. The restaurant is teeny tiny and filled with lots of funky decor and furniture - a super fun, bustling feel to the place with the service to match. Our server kept the bread and awesome dipping sauce coming and kept our drinks filled throughout the meal.

Five of us went at it family style and ordered the pasta rustica with scallops and shrimps, spinach gnocchi with meat sauce, pesto gnocchi, a pasta alfredo and a giant chicken parm with a bottle of red wine to share. A serious feast for our last night in the city, and it was all so perfectly delicious.

Each dish was simple and full of flavor. The pasta was incredible in each dish and generously sauced, but not so much that it was swimming. The pesto sauce was creamy while retaining the vibrancy of the basil. The balance of tangy and rich flavors in the marinara was amazing and all the seafood and meats were cooked just right. 

I left feeling satisfied and happy as opposed to bitter and feeling like I could do better at home, because I can't - I would eat here all the time if I lived in SF!
author: Jeni C.

description:
Came here for a late dinner. We ordered some wine, cheap wine and we could tell. 

They have plenty of bread for the table. We ordered a seafood dish and a ravioli. All family style. It was just a little too much for us. 

Servers were great. Very authentic, family owed feel. Not sure when I'd be going back. Probably better for a group. 

My recommendation: Go with a group and share a few dishes! Great cannoli!
author: Heather H.

description: Great food and ambiance.  Try the pesto pasta, yummy!  The place is small so get there early.  Also, bring cash,  The do not take plastic.
author: Debra C.

description:
Pre-Nike Women's Marathon carb loading choice goes to Cafe Sport
Don't let the name throw you off this little Italian treasure rocks the house!
Friendly staff, family style food, fun decor, and gourmet Italian
entrees let me know why I have been coming back to this
place for 13 years :)  I'm sharing the most recent choices:
Egg plant Parmesan-yes! If you love pasta penne pesto won't steer you 
wrong and last but definitely not least crab stuffed ravioli 
with Alfredo yummers! For the sweet tooth in you
best tiramisu ever and your gonna want to leave the gun
and take the cannoli (recommended by the godfather and me :)
author: Francine S.

description:
Had a family dinner here last week on a quiet Weds evening.  We picked this place over another based on the favorable yelps.  

What a big disappointment.  Luckily we had a very nice waiter with good service.  But the food was ... weak.  We had four dishes and only one - the penne with meat sauce - was good.  The gnocchi pesto was average at best, on the bland side.  The petrale sole was the same.  Not much flavor.  And the prawns scampi was unlike anything we had ever had.  The dish surely didn't match the menu description.  A plate of medium/large prawns were completely drowned in a thick, goopy white "sauce" that was nearly cold (but prawns were hot) and was brutally strong with raw garlic.  We didn't have the heart to send it back because the wait staff was nice.  And because the rest of the food wasn't exactly stellar.  

I can't reconcile our food experience with all the 4 and 5 star yelps that have been posted.  This was the first time we have eaten here.  And probably the last.  That should be good news for their fans - more seating for them.
author: Lewis C.

description:
had very different experiences than some of the reviews. i really enjoyed my time at caffe sport. i went on sunday night for dinner and got seated promptly. the service was great. the server asked us often if we needed anything else and how the food was. the ambiance of the place was great. i just love the decoration - that in itself makes it more unique than other places. you feel like you're in another time and place. i live in north beach and have been to the majority of italian restaurants in the area and would recommend this one! 

the boyfriend and i ordered the 
- Ravioli di granchio - hand-made squid ink ravioli filled with crab - so delicious and creamy! 
- Spaghetti e vongole - spaghetti with clams -  it was light and delicious. i'm sure it had a ton of butter too but its ok, it's date night ;) 
- free bread with dipping sauce - amazing. i loved that sauce. i added it to the main dishes!
author: Jen S.

description: Had a 7 pm reservation for 9 with family to celebrate a graduation.  Got there at 6 and it was no problem to be seated early.  We spent 4 hours and had the time of our lives!  The food is wonderful and the service is even better.  Jose was our waiter and he took terrific care of us.  Made this family event the best ever!  Thanks to the entire staff at Caffe Sport !
author: Carol A.

description: Our long term favorite eclectic Italian in north beach. Never go wrong. No reservations but worth the wait. Across from beach blanket Babylon the funniest play ever for the whole family.
author: Geanr L.

description:
The food at sport is quite a bit better than many of its higher priced competitors. The Scampi all' Antonio uses a garlic cream sauce that is just unfairly good.

The staff are clearly proud of the place. They act more like family owners than minions. At least one of them must be.

The decor is, um, well, er... It is perfect to keep away the tourists, so you can get a table.

Service is family style and portions are generous. Get a variety of styles of dishes and plan to share.
author: Mel N.

description: Fantastic lunch spot (thurs-sun) with huge portions of seafood (try their cioppino! Less of a soup than a giant bowl of garlicky seafood!) and their pasta sauces are great, not to mention their spicy creamy tomato bread dip-- could have filled up on this alone! Good customer service and an interesting spot with owner-crafted decor
author: Danielle S.

description: We enjoyed a late lunch here on Saturday.  We split the amply-sized verdure miste appetizer, and it was a genuine highlight -- a rich caponata with flavorful roasted shishito peppers.  Abundanza.  Absolutely loved it.  My wife had the ravioli stuffed with a good deal of yummy dungeness, while I had the calamari al' Antonio.  The calamari was perfectly prepared, tender and happy to be spending time basking in the garlic sauce.  Lots of garlic, to be sure, but never overwhelming.  We used to come here when we lived in Marin, but this is our first revisit to old haunts in almost a decade.  Really glad we returned.  Love the funky decor.  Very good service and, as in days of old, great Sicilian style food.
author: Bill M.

description: My husband and his family are Italian. This is their favorite restaurant and the food is amazing! The carne e fungi and the pesto are our go-to's.
author: Jessica F.

description: The best Calimari I've ever had! Il cibo sciciliano! The Eggplant appetiser is phenomenal.
author: Terena F.

description: 40 min wait at nearby place and welcomed to open arms. Delicious and attentive service and no wait...
author: Steven P.

description: I recommend all my Uber customers to Caffe Sport. I've been a customer for nearly 25 years. Each dish is delicious, but my favorite is the eggplant pasta. I hate eggplant, and so this is a unique restaurant. I'm planning to visit Silicily in a few months, and can't wait to compare food.
author: Michelle H.

description: I had the calamari over pasta which was nothing special.  The bread was stale-ish.   Service was average at best.  Wine was good but that's not really anything they did.  Would have liked to have known that the pastas are family style rather than ordering it as my entree.  I'd give it a second chance but did not leave a satisfied customer.
author: Paul L.

description:
Service 5/5: very nice waiters (though at 10pm we had to leave the restaurant because they wanted to close) 

Food 4/5: good italian food but there are better restaurants in the area - get the spinach dough ravioli!

Quality/quantity/price 3/5: 20 dollars for a simple pasta plate is definitely too much.
author: Margaux M.

description:
Great food 
Great service
Had the secret Italian flag u can get if u catch the chief in a giving mood
Been coming here for 20 years 
Leave snootiness home and enjoy the food and funky ambiance
author: Ed K.

description: Absolutely incredible! I'm vegan, my coworkers live/love meat and they exceeded the expectations of all of us. The ravioli, house salad, and calamari were particular favorites. However, the service was what stood out the most for us. Large portions, wine flowing, we had a wonderful night.
author: Morgan E.

description: The food was absolutely amazing. The waiters make you feel like family. A must when in SF. The best date night with my daughter. We went back 2 nights later and was as pleased as the first night.
author: Brenda P.

description:
The food was decent, I really like the atmosphere..  but our waiter was horrible.
Walked away while we were ordering drinks, would come back every ten minutes or so, take another couple drink orders and then disappear again.  We ordered our food and as it came out he said "so you see now that this is family style" AFTER everyone at the table had ordered a plate.  Would have been really helpful to have been told this when we ordered the food! I would let this slip if the food was amazing, but it was just good.  Massive portions of just "good".
author: chris b.

description:
When in doubt, get it with the pesto.

There were some sloppppyyyyy drunk-ass people here this past Sunday (4/12/15). Which was hilariously out-of-place because all the other parties were families, elderly, and non-sloppy-drunk, respectable people (I was with my mom). Like, this is not a pub. And also super weird, some guy on the restaurant staff - I think he worked in the kitchen bc he wasn't a waiter - seemed to be encouraging it or flirting with some wasted girl - I mean, come ON dude. NOT the time/place to try and spit some game! You're just making this drunk girl yell and she's ruining my favorite pasta.  LOL. But, our waiter was excellent, and effectively counterbalanced the weirdness happening. 

Normally this situation would call for a negative Yelp review, but I just can't. I have never experienced this before at Caffe Sport - this is my family's FAVORITE restaurant, and has been for like 10+ years. And we live in LA!!!

We come up to SF often, and we ALWAYS have to eat here. There's even been a couple of times (like this last time...)  where we order a couple of pastas to go, wrap it in layers of plastic and ziploc bags, and carry it on our flight home for family members who couldn't make the trip. LOL I know, I know.

First off, the sauce you get with bread when you sit down is sooooo goooooodddd I'd be happy just eating bread and that sauce.

We have standard favorite pasta dishes we get here - Pesto, Meat Sauce, Lobster pasta. ALL the sauces have so much flavor, I just can't. 

I freakin love the pesto. It sorta smacks you in the face when you eat it. I mean, it's the kind of sauce where you can taste the ingredients very clearly - basil, garlic, pine nuts, olive oil, parmesan, and I guess probably some proprietary blend of cheese/spices/etc from a family recipe...I don't know - just get it. My favorite pesto of ALL TIME!

The meat sauce - this last time we got the beef/pork ragu with mushrooms - it comes layered on cheesy creaminess and the FLAVORS man, the flavors.

The lobster pasta is expensive (market price), but it's tradition for my family to get that, and it is worth it. It's rich and savory and so good.

I've also had the spinach gnocchi - perfect pillows for any sauce to lay on. Of course we got it with the pesto.

I mean the place is not cheap, but we think it's worth it bc it's so good. The pastas are family style plates, $18+ each - but like okay I know it's just pasta, but I'd gladly pay $18+ for the best pasta ever.  Also, I loooove the interior feel - the garlic wreath chandelier is my fave. 

Just like, next time - I would hope the staff would cut off the alcohol or tell their drunk-ass friends to leave.
author: Jessie I.

description: We lived in San Francisco 20+years ago and came here for special occasions. We flew out for our 25th anniversary and wanted to check things out. No two settings  anymore but the the food was as good if not better. This place still rocks. Times have changed but awesome food never does.
author: Doug B.

description: Unfortunately I didn't follow my own advice of following up with reviews on what used to be one of my favorite restaurant.   I have been going to Caffe Sport for over twenty five years (most likely longer) and my last visit was with a family reunion a year and half ago.   On my last visit it was as I always remembered.  My brother-in-law is in town for a visit and decided to have him experience CS.   The service was ok however when our food came it looked unfamiliar.  Penne Pesto, which used to make my pores reek of garlic for days after my visit, was a pale comparison in both flavor and quantity along with being under cooked. If it is possible to make a bland plate of pesto this was it.   The saute' Calamari alla Marinara was a bland watery mess.   Frankly there should have been a sign up that said new owners or under new management.   Don't be fooled.  This is not the same place.
author: Anthony P.

description:
comfy,dark,"couples" kind of environment for me with lots of decor,(red checkered kind of deal) and ambiance' .
I had the biggest,pile of absolutely delicious Cioppino I ever had. (They have several different sauce options*) Family style and  I ate it all myself. In the tail of the italian neighborhood,this place was very much what I expected in every way.It really did remind me of the Italian hood in New York City with aggressive,direct wait people I used to be accustomed to. The desserts are traditional italian,(and calorie loaded),just as you'd expect as well!
author: Brian D.

description: I was about to give this establishment three stars but the waiter disappeared. Food was ok.  Calamari with the white garlic sauce was good.  The pasta was good. Just nothing that was 'wow'.  I guess we came at a bad night?  Reviews were pretty good so we were disappointed.
author: John W.

description:
Another really yummy dinner at Caffe Sport! My husband and I enjoy coming to this spot from time to time for a not-so-formal yet delicious dinner.
Just know that it will be garlicky... Yes, that wake up in the middle of the night, "wow... I had lots of garlic" taste will happen!!! Decor is fun... A bit too dusty for what would be ideal, but bland, this place is not. Speaking of bland... Not sure what some of the other postings are talking about... The food is perfectly seasoned to enhance that flavor of the food. Perhaps they are upset that it is not over-run with herbs and spices like a cheap american pizza would be....

P.S. We are local Bay Area folks who have specifically come here for years due to the quality and authenticity of the food.
author: Malaika R.

description:
Finally! Upon returning to the Bay Area after 15 years, I had the pleasure of taking my husband to my favorite child/young adult-hood Italian restaurant in North Beach.

Caffe Sport, you continue to amaze me with your delicious cuisine, eclectic collection of art (which I could never get enough of as a child) by Antonio La Tona and most importantly unparalleled customer service.

I wanted to say a special thank you to the new owner Jose for his generosity, kindness and for bringing me back to my childhood days of talking and laughing in the restaurant. For making us feel like we were part of his family, welcoming us with open arms and spending his hard earned time with us! Another thank you to Jose's right hand man, Luis who continues to provide excellent customer service. You made my husband and I feel so welcome. And last but certainly not least the man, the Chef! Marcelo thank you for the delicious food you continue to prepare with love.

I encourage any and all, native San Franciscan or visitor alike to give this restaurant a try. There may be a slight wait for a table, because yes they ARE that good, but I can assure you, you will not be disappointed. 

Many thanks and I can promise we will be back!

Anna and David
author: Anna S.

description:
Yummy! Home cooking Italian sea food restaurant 

Once you walk in it looks like like a little restaurant that you don't expect much from. And I really didn't expect the food to be sooooo good!

Very good seafood! Good Service! 

I highly recommend to try it :) You Won't regret it
author: Ella B.

description:
3 - friendly staff, didn't ask if I wanted more soda
2.5 - limited menu, cipionno garlic sauce was good, cipionno tomato sauce was bland, seafood was not the freshest, dungeonous crab was frozen/soggy
3 - coffee was good
4 - tiramisu was really good

The place was empty on a Friday night, which isn't a surprise.  I would recommend going next door at Sotto Mare.  They have better seafood.
author: Ryan Y.

description:
This is my favorite place in north beach. If you love seafood and the sauce of Italian food, you will love this place. A few of my favorite dishes:
Pasta rustica. A four cheese marinara sauce with a mix of seafood, including calamari, scallops, and shrimp. The sauce is so delicious and the seafood is cooked to perfection. 
Scampi alla Antonio is a must get. The signature dish of the original owner, it's a creamy white garlic sauce on top of large scampi and sliced zucchini. The sauce is made without dairy but is still so creamy and delicious. It has a lemon yang and a crispness that will leave you wanting more. 
The pesto is so good too. They add whole pine nuts for extra flavor and, again, it has a creaminess that's delicious, without added dairy. 
If you're in north bay, make sure you hit this place. It's got an Italiana Classico style that isn't preserved in many other places in the area. 
Antonio, the original owner, was also an artist, and his interesting paintings and designs are all vet the restaurant. This place is a unique work of art where the tastes of the food are the only thing more interesting than the decor. 

The only warning: this place puts the garlic on thick, as you should in Italian cooking. Don't come on a first date, because the garlic breath is intense. In fact, don't go anywhere important for 24 hours--- the garlic will be sweating out your pours that long!
author: Marisa W.

description:
We brought out of town family here because of the reviews and the 'North Beach look' of the place-- wine bottles, etc.....BUT the service was so erratic I would think twice about coming back.  We had six people-- each ordered something. They brought two dishes and then twenty minutes later brought one more-- then another about five minutes later. Six plates arriving at thoughtlessly staggered intervals was unacceptable.  Also, we went for twenty minutes at a time without our waiter.  Not good.

Food was fine.  Nothing to write home about.  Not bad but not 'good' at all.  The cioppino was especially odd-- just a plate of seafood-- no broth that is typical of this dish.  The bread was hard and white (and my toddler ate it anyway, and we had the hardest time getting a refill).  Requests for olive oil were ignored.  Just a strange experience overall.  This is probably a resto that is used to tourists only, and everything about it shows.

I'd go back to Sotto Mare next door in a pinch.
author: Kate I.

description:
Best Cioppino in SF! Evertyhing they make here is simply amazing and delicious, you can taste the freshness of the seafood and the pasta sauces. 

They need a better selection of wines and better bread.

Besides that the food is top notch and very good, they never fail to please me here.
small restaurant so come early for good seats.
author: Ella P.

description:
Food was very bland. It arrived quickly but tastes like they emptied the sauces from the cans and heated it up. 

These yelp reviews are very deceiving. The inside of the place seems very cluttered.
author: Jane W.

description:
Absolutely the best Italian food in Northern California, all others pale in comparison.
The pesto dishes are bountiful with rich delicious sauce displaying abundant
flavors. The seafood dishes are amazing and like no other.  The atmosphere is fun, but you do need to go with the flow to appreciate it.
author: Martha L.

description: My family and I love this place! We try to head there every year for a birthday or two in our family. The decor is so over the top it's great! The food is served family style. You have to order the pesto most definitely, it's the best. We always order the mussels, clams and the grilled calamari. It's amazing! We also walk out satisfied and stuffed!
author: Amanda W.

description: I came to this place many times , the food is amazing and good service.I always have a wonderful dinner with my friends .The server Luis is so nice and funny,I'll come back again .
author: Tiffany D.

description: Chipino Bianco Seafood is the bomb! Stellar service most especially by Luis. Food came really quick! My cravings were immediately satisfied! Totally legit Italian Restaurant!
author: Luise C.

description: I have owned many restraunts but this place is amazing from campy colorful decor, and great service to fabulously prepared garlicky light and creamy sauces for pastas and fabulous fresh seafood...do not miss this !!  House salad crispy organic tomatoes and piquant homeade dressing!!!
author: Patti P.

description: This is an amazing restaurant!!! The best Sicilian pasta and food in the city. A tradition created by Antonio many years ago....but the new owner Jose is the new Tony. Great host! A must visit place in the city by the bay. Our waitress Jewell is a gem!!!
author: Francisco J.

description: Amazing Italian food at this hidden gem in North Beach!   Small restaurant with lots of fun vintage decor.  Friendly and fast service and the food was absolutely amazing.  The bread with spicy tomato sauce that is brought out before the meal is incredible.  My husband and I ate an incredible meal and had wine and beer all for less than $80!   Make a reservation as its a small spot and fills up quickly. One of the best meals I've had in SF.
author: Joanna P.

description: Great atmosphere, food is great. Large portions,  family style. Decorative and different but cozy. Would totally recommend this restaurant.
author: Frank D.

description:
Great ambience, good service and flavourful dishes. No pizza in the menu.
Spinach gnocchi with meat sauce was tasty. The spinach raviolis were good too.
author: Yan P.

description:
First note, this is FAMILY STYLE so don't order similar dishes because weather you want to or not you will be sharing since duplicate orders will be combined on one plate.  If this doesn't appeal to you keep walking.  If I only read the reviews first.

We have walked by this place many times but never stopped in until now.  The atmosphere is quite unique and very eclectic.  Tchotchkes everywhere you look, every nook and cranny filled even the ceiling.  It almost seemed Italian with a Mexican flare, a bit odd.  Like I said as for the food I would suggest keep walking.  I like to share but I want that to be with who I chose and have an input on their dish.  Instead what arrived was three plates of penne pasta, one was a double batch vs. four.  What it did allow me to do was to compare all three dishes which turned out to be a bad thing.  Maybe if I would have had my own plate I wouldn't have realized they tasted too similar.  The mild white sauce had a touch of red sauce in it but a bland mild white sauce that was drowned out by the touch of red, the red meat sauce wasn't bold or  flavorful enough and the lobster over red sauced pasta was just a mess.  As I tried to crack the claw I was afraid it was going to shoot out of my hand across the table and injure a third party.  I will say the caprese salad was very tasty but skip the troughs of penne pasta with either of these three white or red sauces.  I was thinking this was the "no soup for you" place, not sure if this is true but I wish it would have been because we could have saved $70 per couple if they would have taken it away.  For the four of us ordering four dishes of penne pasta was too much.  We could have gotten by with two.
author: Dianne M.

description: Best Servive, best foods. Nice place! You guys should go to try it! You guys will love it A LOT.
author: Jen H.

description: Had the worst experience at this restaurant we have been going to for 14 years.  went from getting kisses on both cheeks to not even having a waiter or waitress serve us. asked for cheese I get a hand that says one moment never got cheese had to go into the kitchen and get my own cheese. food was mediocre service was the worst I've ever had at any other restaurant this place was great but it really went downhill
author: David V.

description: The absolute best Italian Food in SF. Stop reading and go there. I'm not f^cking kidding.
author: Justin G.

description: THE.ABSOLUTE.BEST! If your in San Fran and enjoy Italian, this place is a must! We got the Caprese salad (the best mozz and freshest basil I've ever tasted), a seafood dish to die for and a deliciously filling pasta dish (all family style). Go here, you'll truly be missing out if you don't!
author: Emily T.

description: The food was SO good, I had the raviolis, my husband had the spaghetti & meatballs. Our friends loved the sole and the penne pasta.  All were perfectly cooked and hot when served.  The wine, bread and the dipping sauce was all fabulous.  The service was excellent also, thanks Jose!! We also enjoyed the desserts, I can't remember the name of the 3 chocolate one, but it was yummy!!  Walking distance to Beach Blanket Babylon and convenient parking across the street ($25. for the whole day).  Italian decor and interesting things to look at throughout this quaint place.  We will be back soon to try something else.  You won't be disappointed here!!
author: Denise B.

description: We were going to a different place but they closed so we walked around and found this place. We decided to try it spontaneously and in conclusion, This is a really good Italian restaurant. The interior gives a cool authentic Italian feeling. The sauce that comes with the bread is amazingggg.  The pasta is amazing. Other restaurants that I've been to, their pasta tastes as if the pasta and saute hate each other. Tastes like they're 2 separate things. But here the pasta and sauce are in harmony. The seafood is sooo good and I don't like seafood. I recommend trying to place out even just for the bread and sauce. Yumm!
author: Liza C.

description: If I could give them 10 stars that still wouldn't be enough.  My mom and I were planning a mom daughter weekend in San Francisco.  We were going to see Beach Blanket Babylon and looked for some Yelp reviews..  Caffe Sport has mostly good reviews so we decided to try it out.  We walked in and were instantly transormed to a cafe in Italy and were greeted warmly and shown to our table.  We were told this is family style (note I have had family style where you share a salad, soup, pasta and order your Secondi or meat) well this family style is where you order your food and share and they are huge portions.  So we got the Insalata caprese to start, then wanting to save room for dessert we order gnocchi with a tomato, meat and mushroom sauce..  These gnocchi were not like anything I have ever tried (and I grew up with an Italian grandmother who made amazing gnocchi) they were lite fluffy pillows of heaven and the sauce was nothing short of brilliant.  So then came desert time, they have tiramisu and chocolate chip cannolis that were homemade...  That word became the deciding factor to try both, the tiramisu was fabulous but oh my God the cannoli was like none I have ever had.  The wait staff was amazingly friendly, the food out of this world and ambiance was wonderful..  The bill came and the price was great for what we order...  This place started our evening right and I my belly is still happy...  I will try to post pictures...
author: Raquel D.

description: We loved this place for the past 30 years but this is our last visit. The portions are 1/2 what they were. The pasta with meat had almost no meat. The scampi had thick gloppy sauce and 5 prawns. Had to ask for more bread because they gave so little. Too bad.
author: Paula W.

description:
Had a family dinner there last night and still can't stop thinking about how bad it was.
We ordered a meat ragout and were served  penne with white sauce and one scallop. When we informed the waiter he paused and took some time to get the nearly "meatless" meat ragut. The pesto penne was lukewarm and uninspiring--out of a jar? The eggplant penne had some color and character, though not a lot of taste. The wait staff --pretty flat affect. I have fond memories of this place 30 years ago but won't be going back.
author: Kathleen J.

description:
Love the restaurant and decor. Service was excellent and very attentive. Was with friends. We ordered three pasta items and the crab salad covered with the white sauce....  one dish was the pasta con calamari - while both dishes was lukewarm, parts of the pasta with calamari was COLD. THAT really turned me off right away.....   I agree with a few other reviews that for $20 the dishes were very small as compared to other North Beach italian restaurants...

Also, going to the website of this restaurant got the following message:

Warning: Something's Not Right Here!
www.caffe-sport.com contains malware. Your computer might catch a virus if you visit this site. Google has found malicious software may be installed onto your computer if you proceed. If you've visited this site in the past or you trust this site, it's possible that it has just recently been compromised by a hacker. You should not proceed, and perhaps try again tomorrow or go somewhere else. We have already notified www.caffe-sport.com that we found malware on the site. For more about the problems found on www.caffe-sport.com, visit the Google Safe Browsing diagnostic page.

Beware....
author: Tony L.

description: Outstanding service and excellent food!  Affordable family style restaurant.  A must if you're in San Francisco!!
author: Nelson V.

description: Service is excellent.  Seafood is good but lacks the WOW factor needed to set them apart in this restaurant laden area.  Decent but not 5 star food.  Food is 3 star, service is 5 star.  I would go back but maybe not choice #1.
author: Jay W.

description: I was here on a Tuesday at around 5:30 pm.  There was no wait and the service was very good.  We were not starving so ate light.  My daughter and I shared the Eggplant appetizer - the best eggplant dish I think i ever ate, the caprese salad - this was good but not great and the clams in their garlic, wine sauce - they were absolutely delicious!  The prices were reasonable for food that was really worth another visit.  My only warning is that when you get the bill, the bottom suggests tips at 18%, 20% and 30%.  Don't be fooled.  Read your bill carefully.
author: H. D.

description:
Seriously, an average of 4 stars??

Yes, the place is cute.
Yes, the service is great.
Yes, the choices are pretty unique.
Yes, the bread and tomato sauce dip they give is delicious.

But...

Yes, the prices are really high for an italian place (most everything is over $20).
Yes, it's served family-style, but the portions aren't that big, especially for what you're paying.
Yes, it's hearty food, but it's not very good.  My meat sauce with mushrooms was too heavy, it lacked a freshness that I love with pasta dishes, the meat was severely overcooked and dry, and the cheese sauce under the meat sauce was just overall way too much.  My friend's sole filet, though flavorful, was also overcooked, as were the vegetables (and they were bland).

No thanks to paying $25/person for an underwhelming, mediocre-at-best meal.  2.5 stars, rounded up for the nice service.
author: Tori S.

description:
one of the best sicilian italian places in north beach area. you should try their crab ensalata, shrimp scampi,
penne pesto and the to die bread dip.
have been going to this great location for decades and still enjoying the food and great service consistently everytime
author: Jojo V.

description: Same pasta 40 years later. It's amazing,  not only the decor is hokey, the food looks like it hasn't changed in 40 or so years.  Unimaginative,  dull, very basic looking pasta,  mediocre at best.  Smallish portions and not cheap,  especially as there is little imagination used to create these dishes.  Visit Capo's instead.
author: The A.

description:
My very favorite restaurant in North Beach! The food is just delicious! Very yummy sea food and decent portions. They use a lot of garlic ( Which I personally LOVE), so you better let them know in advance if you are not a big fan of garlic.
The design of the restaurant is very unique and decent.Remember myself first time going there: I had a feeling that I got in  museum! 
Great food and friendly stuff!
Highly recommended!
author: Aglaya S.

description:
We meant to go to a different restaurant, but passed by and decided to eat here instead... why? IT SMELLED SOOO GOOOD, even from outside the restaurant!

It was a 50-1 hr wait but well worth it. They served us some orange sauce thing with the bread as appetizer.... DELICIOUS!! Couldn't stop eating it! SO YUMMY!

We got the scampi and 4 cheese pasta to share between 3 people. Really large portions (it's family style). YUMMIEST. PRAWN. IVE EVER EATEN!!

The whole dinner time, the only thing we kept saying to each other... "This is really good. Wow this is really delicious. Should we order more? This is so great!"

I would recommend this place to ANYone! If you aren't a seafood lover, this place will definitely change your mind. I'm not really a fan of italian restaurants because I feel like I'm never pleased, but this restaurant blew it out of the park!

Will definitely eat here again the next time I come to SF!
author: Sophie S.

description: We were going to a real popular spot down the street, but it was loud, tiny, crowded and had an hour wait, so we walked down the block and saw this place. Wow, so glad we went here - really nice, fairly quiet atmosphere, interesting interior, great staff and amazing food. If you like seafood and/or Italian food, and you're not necessarily looking for the most popular place in town, I highly recommend Caffe Sport - I can't believe this place isn't more popular. It's been around for quite a while though, so they must be doing decently well.
author: Spencer S.

description: First time here and I was as expecting it to be a lot better. I thought the food was comparable to fast food Italian. The sauce was too thin and watery it was like eating naked pasta on every dish. The shrimp scampi was just cooked shrimp with a white suave dumped on top. Most of the dishes the pasta was cooked great but with just added toppings thrown in half ass. We also had a reservation for 8:45  only to find out the kitchen closes at 9:10 when we got arrived which left no time for anything. The staff was rushing everything because it was obvious they wanted to leave as soon as possible. Probably won't go back again with so many other options in the area that seem to have a little more pride in their dishes.
author: Ben S.

description:
Nice Italian restaurant. Shrimp at Alfredo is very good plate. Nice scenery.
Recomanded.
author: Chris C.

description: Went last Sunday with our granddaughter and friend. VERY disappointed. Had been previously a score or more times over last 35 years, but not for maybe 4 or 5 years.  Neither of the two appetizers (fried eggplant or fried mixed seafood) were any good.  Eggplant skin very bitter, shrimp not fresh and all seafood overcooked.  For us the very famous Prawns a la Antonio were much changed and terrible.  The prawns were 1/3 the size of previously and there prawns  and (previously crunchy) lightly steamed zucchini were both way overcooked.  The previously wonderfully-garlic accompanying sauce/aioli must have contained less than 20% as much garlic; could barely taste a hint of garlic; awful!  Service was incredibly slow at 5:00 PM with ONLY one other party in the restaurant.  perhaps the greatly deteriorated food quality and serveice are the reason.  We won't be back.  Don't go if you are expecting the same quality food and experience of 5 - 25 years ago.  Too bad.
author: David G.

description: I was first introduced to this place back in the 90s, as it was the favorite eatery of Yelp Goddess, Chum L. All these years later, I hosted a group of six there last night to celebrate a birthday. In spite of ... or maybe because of its tourist-centric locale, they're still thriving and serving amazing family-style authenticity. The ravioli, meatballs and gnocchi were the superstars on my plate. The only thing keeping this from a perfect rating was the chaos and rude vagueness received while trying to check in with staffers for my reservation. Their choice of words and inefficient structure for handling patrons left a very sour taste in my mouth. Luckily for them, the ravioli made up for that in deliciousness. But I am definitely not happy with them from a welcoming perspective.
author: Gregor G.

description:
Garlic lovers - this place is for you! We enjoyed a dish of mussels and a dish of various seafood (crab, clams, mussels, etc) and both were smothered in a delicious garlic sauce. Save your bread for this!
We also tried a perfect al dente pasta with meat and mushrooms with a fantastic authentic sauce.
The service was very friendly and the atmosphere was kitschy. For dessert, I recommend the canolli!
author: Allison S.

description: What an awesome place.  I am picky about Italian and my girlfriend knew that.  We came in and had a great time with great food and service.  I look forward to going back to the city.
author: Jason G.

description:
My thoughts are wide ranging. The crab and lobster were excellent. The atmosphere fun.  The service poor and chaotic.  They missed one of orders and never checked is after taking order. The pasta sauces were good but the pasta was way overcooked. Tasted like poor quality dry pasta. Disappointed.  

This was on top of my list.  Now not eager to go back.
author: Mary Ellen T.

description:
To each his own, I guess. It seems like you either really like this place or you don't. 

First off, I don't have to complain about the horrific parking/driving issues because we do it the simple way: cab. Second, maybe it's just me but I think the portions are pretty hefty, thus justifying the price. And lastly, definitely a spot to hit up if you're seeking some hearty comfort food.

Family style between the 4 of us, we ordered the giant house salad, 3 pastas, and the steamed garlic clams. The house salad is so simple yet so satisfying. It has fresh cut romaine lettuce, roasted red peppers, olives and tomatoes with a house vinaigrette that makes it just divine. We got 3 pastas, but one was actually supposed to be eggplant parmesan. Nonetheless the eggplant pasta was just as good. The shrimp/scallop as well as the pesto were both to die for! There's just something about the rich and cheesy sauces that make it so addicting. The steamed clam appetizer is a must order if you love clams. Every bite is filled with delicious pureed garlic, lemon and wine exploding your taste buds. Oh, and of course you can't forget about that complimentary spicy cheesy sauce with bread to start.

I guess you could say $20 a plate may be a bit pricey for something so seemingly simple, but really, can you make those sauces at home? It is a lot of food and you probably want to have a party of 4 or more to eat here.
author: Stine H.

description:
Ehhhhh.  Good Italian is so hard to find in the city.  Yelp cannot be relied on for it; the tourists have tipped the scales.

I'd go to E Tutto Qua instead if you're in North Beach.  The Mission has way better Italian.
author: Erika C.

description: My first time to Cafe Sport in at least 10 years.  The new owners are really turned up the quality of the food.  The complementary bread and sauce is awesome, not sure what makes the sauce so good but I would have been happy with just that on pasta.  But it was the house made ravioli that I will be coming back for.  Wow, I have eaten a lot of ravioli but I can't think of one that was better than this.  It was a business lunch do I didn't try a desert but I will be back soon.
author: Dave H.

description: The decor inside is so festive & fun! I came with a group so we shared a few plates. The sauce that comes with the bread is very tasty. House salad is also very very good. To sum it up, everything was good - pesto pasta, eggplant, and shrimp scampi!
author: Jessica P.

description: Walked in the other afternoon for anything, counter person was facing the wall.  A woman came behind me, she walked out.  At least in the reviews other people got served & still said it was horrible, horrendous.  The place was posh, but so what, I'm outta here.  I don't have to say things like, "Sir, but do you work here?"  Think the crowd there was about 2-1/2 people.
author: BanBan B.

description: yes came here for a 13 years old boy birthday..didnt order much..the portion size here is ok..but for family size portions will cost you $$$$...so for those of ou kmow how to cook pasta..no need to order much here..cuz isnt worth it...
author: Crisy G.

description: Ate here for our final night in San Fran visiting from the East Coast. The waiter (Jose) was very friendly and accommodating. We asked what he recommended because it was family style. We were 4 adults. He said 3 dishes plus our salad appetizer. We ordered the Chicken Parm, ravioli and pesto pasta. Now don't get me wrong.... The food tasted good, by no means outstanding but the portions were really tiny. Dipping sauce for bread was good, jalapeños in sauce? OK. Basically we got one breast of chicken pounded out and fried for $16, pretty simple like I make at home, a small plate of ravioli, was good and a small plate of somewhat oversauced pesto pasta, so much leftover sauce in bowl so bread was handy for dipping after. A glass of beer and wine sent us over $130+ and we were looking at each other still hungry! We contemplated ordering more food but opted to leave and get gelato next door. This was not what I would consider family style by any means, basically each plate is like a single dinner, so order that way. Portions are small and don't go far.
author: David K.

description:
Prepare yourself for a true Italian, garlic heavy feast. 

I have been coming here for over 10 years and I think my future children will be as hooked as I am.

My favorite dishes: cioppino bianco, petrole sole, pasta rustica, and that sauce given with the bread basket. 

Not a place to eat light..... Ever. This has a very rustic, warm family style ambiance and the staff is a group of young, friendly and very helpful gentlemen who are really good at helping you navigate through the menu. 

The chef always had his window open, so stop by and see how he works his magic or to say hello, he's a really sweet old guy.

Antonio  LaTonne Jr, has really kept the spirit of his father alive at this restaurant. I remember seeing the late LaTonne and he was so welcoming and jolly with everyone.

Keep it up caffe sport!
author: Jacqueline Z.

description:
Sotto Mare was crazy packed so I went to Caffe Sport instead.  While most other Italian joints couldn't live up to SM, Caffe Sport was a serious downgrade.

I ordered the pasta con vongole, and though the menu had no further description I assumed it would come in a white wine/butter/garlic/lemon sauce as I've had it at almost every other place I've ordered it from.  I got two sauces and neither were what I had expected. 

The penne came with a thick covering of white sauce and another layer of tomato sauce.  It was a very heavy dish, unlike what I had expected. The clams were ok and the pasta was prepared fine as well.  Neither the white nor red sauce was that good.  I should have just loaded up on their bread and dipping sauce (which is delicious!) instead.

Maybe I missed a note or message somewhere about what to expect, or maybe I should have asked what kind of sauce the pasta comes with.  Either way, the non-descriptive menu and unexpected preparation made this a very disappointing meal.

I also had a bite of the cioppino and it was very subpar, especially compared to SM.  I guess that's what you get when you pick the restaurant close by that isn't very crowded.  Now I know better.
author: Naoko M.

description:
Met up with some friends here after she got her masters. This food is AMAZING! I never give anything 5 stars but this place deserves it! Food is delicious. Service is great. We had the dish with the scallops and shrimp and it was life-changing. Also had the one with clams and mussels and it was also delicious.

Parking in that area is terrible but I'll sit in traffic and wait 30 mins to find parking for food this good!
author: Marvin T.

description: Not what it used to be, lacking taste.  Went back after a few years and I was disappointed.  Too bad cause I loved it.
author: Ricardo A.

description: Great food. Great atmosphere. The dipping sauce you receive is delicious. I ordered cioppino in a white sauce and my parents ordered eggplant Parmesan. The portions really aren't that huge (unless you're a dainty eater). The entrees run around 20 a plate, but I would say its worth it as long you go with someone else to share plates.
author: Gill S.

description:
I'm a fan of Caffe Sport for weekend lunches.

The pesto pasta is delicious, and a great dish to split with your lunch date (hello, carbs). I can't get over the flavor of their pesto sauce...why can't I make it like that at home?!

Steamed mussels were okay. A bit pricey, and a bit cold, for $15.

Wine by the glass will run you $8, which seems a bit much to be honest.

The decor is quirky, the servers are great, and I had to cut myself off on the dipping sauce they serve with their bread.

All in all, a solid spot.
author: Caroline M.

description:
Among my group of 5 who dined here, you will probably get about 5 different opinions.  However, since I am the one who is Yelping, I'll give a quick rundown.

-Decor:  Very cool.  Super cluttered with art, objects, etc.  It's like a neighborhood garage sale puked all over the walls.  Probably more interesting than any of the food we ordered.  Be sure to check out the ceiling and see the fun artwork.
-Service:  On par with what was expected.  Our waiter was a dead ringer personality-wise for Jonah Hill.  Partially in looks, too.
-Food:  "Italian" and "seafood" are dead on as nearly everything contained some sort of pasta and some sort of seafood.
-Favorites:  The Pesto Penne was delicious.  It was much creamier when compared to similar dishes elsewhere, but it was a great choice.  Be sure to hold on to some extra bread to wipe up the excess sauce (literally, my pasta was practically drowning in it).  It's supposed to be family style, but I decided to be a family of one and kept the whole plate to myself ;)
-Other Favorites:  The bread and dipping sauce!  I have absolutely no idea what it is made of, but I think it was anchovy, garlic, spicy tomato... shoot, I have no idea.  If I could find the recipe to make this, it would be a staple in my home.  It alone warrants 500 stars.
-Disappointment/Rectification:  our friend's Ruscta All'Antonio was a bit "too watery" for her liking, and our waiter had no problem taking it back, bringing her something different, and removing it from the bill.  
-Pricing:  Considering the amount of food, I think it was fair; my pasta dish was big enough to take home nearly half.

Credit cards accepted.  Stop in, if not for the food, but for the bread, dip, and decor.
author: Damian C.

description:
I'm definitely a sucker for ambiance, and if that's what you're looking for, let's say for a date, maaaaybe not this place. It's overloaded with decor, and quite cramped, but otherwise...

FOOD IS AMAZING! And good with friends/family!

Plates are served family style. There were four of us, and we ordered the cioppino with white sauce (or a choice of red sauce), which I think is MANDATORY; the eggplant (without pasta), and was my FAVORITE; Crab Insalatta (I'm indifferent about crab, so my opinion here wouldn't help... but it was good to me, which might say something for someone who is indifferent about crab); and... oy, I can't think of the last platter! Shame on me! Perfect portions for four hungry people, I think we could've done with three platters instead.

Service was great, all waiters were friendly and well-informed. I want to say it was the chef coming out with a couple of our platters, felt nice :)

Each platter had such great flavor. I highly recommend this place if you're looking for excellent, authentic Italian seafood!
author: Jennifer A.

description: Food was very good.  Waiters were charming, but not very attentive.  We were seated at 5:30 on a Sunday.  Very few customers and the atmosphere was pleasant and quiet.  Our order came in a timely fashion, and after that we were invisible!  When I pressed for my desert order, "We're busy.  It's coming"  Well, it took forever!!  I canceled my order and paid the bill.  If they were "busy" with the restaurant over half empty, I would not want to be in the wave that was about to come in around 7:00.  Line was long and I thought they weren't going to get served for ages.  Would not return.
author: Douglas B.

description:
This place is great! Me and my girlfriend went here a year ago while on a roadtrip on the recommendation of her dad who had lived in the area forever.

I'm so glad we did. I'm a pretty snobby person when it comes to coffee in general, and in particular coffee houses but this one takes the cake for all of it. Great food, great coffee, great atmosphere and a storied history. What more could you want?

Definitely go if you're in the area.
author: Connor L.

description:
All I have to say I am your carb slave, bread and tomato sauce alone is enough to render me weak with a hint of garlic; Bellissimo! Just thinking about it made me gain at least ten pounds but I care less it is dam good. Colleague wanted comfort food and she stopped by my hood and we stumble upon Caffe Sport walking and enjoying the sunny weather. I was excited we split tomato pasta;  fresh tomatoes, hint of cheese and basil and the basil pasta with a hint of cheese also.

I stuffed myself and turned into a  food zombie, I couldn't move and had an interview to conduct, all I wanted was to take a nap. My colleague just laughed but both knew we found our lunch spot for great Italian food;comfort our souls and did not break our wallets.
author: Jennifer M.

description:
It's probably only a 3 star restaurant but that sauce with the bread is out of this planet.  The last time I had a dipping sauce this good was this restaurant called La Siciliana in Berkeley.

It's a family style restaurant but their portions have gotten smaller.  Very rustic, homey, comforting feel to this place.  It is a bit pricey as well but the service was excellent.  It's a place where you would go once in a blue moon.
author: jason g.

description:
I was up in SF recently and wandered into Caffe Sport due to the fact that Tomaso's was packed...what a great place.  So good in fact that I went twice in three nights.  I'll be returning to SF in a couple weeks and can't wait to go back.

Linguini and mussels...it'll do ya right.
author: C S.

description: By far the most amazing Italian food I have ever had in my life! Gives me a whole new perspective on what seafood and Italian food is suppose to taste like! Everyone come and eat here!
author: Matt O.

description: We loved it. Family style Italian. Excellent ravioli and canolli. Casual attire. Reasonable prices.
author: Phil D.

description: Worst service and terrible food. I couldn't imagine a worse Italian restaurant if I tried. Crab was soaked in garlic to the point I lost my appetite. Crab ravioli tasted like ground chicken. Terrible.
author: Nick V.

description:
If you like good italian food and want to have a unique SF experience come here! 

This is a great example of diversity in the city. They served italian dishes, but the restaurant itself is different. This place is tiny, sometimes even stuffy. They have lots of random crap on the walls like Chevy's. Sitting arrangement can be from a  wooden booth to family style benches. 

The pasta dish are freaking amazing. It is a old family recipe that has been pass down 100 years ago. There shrimp dishes uses jumbo sized browns and go amazing with their penne style pasta. The menu is really short, probably less than 10 entrees last time i checked and they all cost $20. The portion sized are meant for one person, but usually everyone orders a dish and share it family style. Staff is super nice, they talk to you like you are a local. 

I recommend this place if you enjoy good pasta and a unique dining experience.
author: Ryan R.

description: Service is kind of abrupt and slow here. Our initial waiter was really prompt, but afterwards, I think he might have left, and we ended up with a portly fellow who neglected us for a really long time. No request to refill our beers/wine and a really messy plate of ravioli. Not too down with such a greasy plate of spinach-filled ravioli, and by spinach-filled, I mean that the ravioli had just chopped spinach inside of it. Not very original or appetizing, especially seeing as how the spinach was still raw. The appetizer bread came with a nice aioli, but it was baked so heavily that it cut up my mouth. Paid $60 for two entrees and two beers. Seems a little overpriced for a small meal.
author: Danny C.

description: Personally, I like it better than the Stinking Rose.   It is more quaint and the food has more personality.   I do not really like Italian food but this place has dishes that are just amazing.  Compared to what I have known as Italian food ... this is creative and tasty!!!   They play with flavour as if they enjoy being creative.   They've been here since 1969.  If you are in SF you should stop by.  They are closed on Mondays.  Last time I had the shrimp scampi....  like no other before!!!!    ....and you can hear the person you are having supper with speak.   They are not a huge cafateria style place.  small and quaint.
author: Jenny L.

description: The food alone is a solid 3.5 to 4 stars but the experience was sadly a 1.  Came with a group for a special occasion and we were treated by the waiter as more of an inconvenience.  They cleared the table and 20 minutes go by without a word, it's a very small restaurant not hard to check in.  Finally I flagged the waiter down to ask for dessert.  He informs me they are out.  Out of dessert!  He chastised us for not ordering enough food instead of being happy we enjoyed it enough to order more.  No pleasantries, a simple "how are you doing tonight?  Is everything tasting good?  Can I bring you anything else?"  They just must not care about being great.  Leaving a place you've looked forward to coming to for months feeling unwelcome was such a disappointment.
author: Jaycee C.

description:
I give the food 4 stars. I give the service 2.5.

Came here for my roommates birthday last night. We had reservations for 10 people at 8:30pm. We got there at 8:15pm and the waiter said "It's not 8:30pm yet. You need to wait." Um... rude much? So we waited outside for a bit because the place is tiny and finally it's past 8:30pm and we ask again if we can be seated. The waiter looks at his watch and says "OK, it's 8:30pm. We'll set you up." I was annoyed to say the least.

We ordered a variety of food but we had never been before. The same waiter gave us attitude and said "Is this your first time here?" And recommended that we ordered double order of food instead of a bunch of single order of different food. Yes, it was a good suggestion but you didn't need to be rude about it. 

I like the dip that they served with your bread. We joked that it looked like curry but it tasted like bell peppers and tomatoes. The pasta isn't anything extraordinary but the sauce is! I highly recommend the meat and mushroom sauce and also the eggplant parmesan. We also got an order of mussels that were fresh and delicious! We also ordered the pasta with eggplant, pesto, and the spinach ravioli. My favorite dishes were still the meat and mushroom sauce and eggplant parmesan.

The cannoli wasn't anything spectacular. The restaurant is small with a lot of character and definitely affordable. Dinner for 10 people with 3 bottles of wine came out to $40/person (we all chipped in for the birthday girl). Great place to come with a group because the portions are big and meant to be shared family style. I'd go back for the pasta. Just hold the attitude.
author: Jackie T.

description: It's one thing to have great food but to find a restaurant with great atmosphere as well can be hard to find. Been coming to this place for over 25 years and Caffe Sport is always a "must eat" whenever my family and I travel to the city. You know you're in for a treat the moment you taste the bread with dipping sauce. The prawns with zucchini, pesto and clams in garlic butter are a mandatory staple every time we go. Waiters are always friendly and more than happy to assist in order suggestions when you don't have a clue as to what to eat. Honestly, one of my top 5 restaurants ever!
author: Victoria N.

description:
My family has been going to Caffe Sport for over 30 years. It's the go-to spot for all family dinners and out-of-town guests.  Last night was no exception as we piled ten people into a table full of pasta, seafood, salad, and wine. 

All the food is great. The sauce for the shrimp scampi is to die for and the Pasta Rustica is a family fav! 

Visit soon, buy a shirt, and dig in!
author: Nuna R.

description: Awesome! Good atmosphere. Good service. And the food was excellent. We ate family style. Their house salad was not your regular salad. It has fresh made salad dressing. The pasta with clams was so fresh and had a very tasty sauce. The gnocchi was made with spinach and pesto sauce. The seafood dish was yummy with lots of garlic and lemon. Service was excellent. They are very tentative and informational. Great place to take your family. No wait
author: Hong R.

description:
Walking in, it reminded me of a more authentic Buca Di Beppo. Paintings, lights, photos, and all of that from top to bottom.. and the ceiling! I have to say I felt a bit claustrophobic but the food and service was great.
