The clam pasta tasted so homemade. It was a bit salty (which i'm sure was a contribution from the clams) but i liked it like that!

The tiramisu came with an edible smiley face drawn on top! It was one of the better tiramisu's i've had and wasn't soggy at all. It was made well and i recommend it!
author: Samantha L.

description:
My friends and I have been coming to Caffe Sport for nearly two decades now, and not once have we ever been disappointed. The prices are great, the portions huge, and the sauces superb. 

Just a few of the dishes we love:
Meat and Mushroom Pasta (Carne e Funghi)
Pasta Speciale (scallops & shrimp in an exquisite 4-cheese tomato cream sauce)
Shrimp al' Antonio 
Sicilian Spaghetti w (giant) Meatballs (ask for the delicious marinara sauce w/ this)
Fried Calamari

The wait staff are terrific--very friendly and accommodating--no matter what my request. It's also one of the most unusual restaurants in North Beach. First off, the décor is one-of-a-kind, like a Sicilian funhouse. This is because the original owner did woodworking and crafted almost all of it himself--and that décor stretches to the ceiling. The tables and chairs don't match from one piece to the next, and because of this it lends the place a wonderful warmth and charm. 

It's also the only restaurant I've known where people will strike up conversations at the neighboring tables to tell them to try this or that entrée. In fact, I happened to taste one of their best dishes, Shrimp al' Antonio, for the first time because the people at the next table (who come there every weekend, btw) invited me to partake from the plate they'd ordered. Seriously. 

Even the dipping sauce for the bread you get is addicting. I could just have that for my entire meal. I don't mean to talk up the place too much because then, no matter how good the meal is, you'll be disappointed. My one complaint really is that they only serve lunch on Friday & Saturday. Careful with the wine, too; it can get expensive. So next time you're in North Beach, treat yourself--but don't take my word for it. Go in, take a seat, and ask the people at the table next to you :-)
author: Thinman M.

description: The food was really good. But they seated all over 55 persons in the back room by the bathrooms and the kitchen.  They had 12 open tables in the the front of the place. Thinking.......maybe they wanted to close early and didn't want people to see all the people in the window, or maybe, they were saving tables for all the hip young hipsters that may show up on a Sunday night at 7pm?  Or maybe, they were expecting a terror attack on their cafe.  Who knows?
author: Ann J.

description:
Love this place so much....I won't even tell you about it.    neener, neener, stay away.  More for me!!!!!

Seriously great North Beach food. The entire menu. Period.
author: Kirt V.

description:
Hands down the worst Italian food I have eaten at a restaurant. The calamari was good for appetizers, but the pasta dishes and sauces were gross. 
The pesto especially was this creamy green sauce that looked like guacamole and tasted like it too. 
If you find yourself here don't be afraid of filling up on bread, you won't want to eat much else.
author: Brendan D.

description: My favorite Italian food ever!! I love the sauce that they bring out with the bread. It's addicting and easy to eat too much before your food comes out. Salads are really tasty as well, but the real star is the pasta. Omfg the pasta with meat and mushrooms is the best ever. The portions are very large and the food isn't very expensive. I've been there with a bunch of different people and every dish ordered has been fantastic. I took my father-in-law from out of state there a few years ago and he still raves about it when we mention Italian food or San Francisco. Just make sure you check when they are open because they close for lunch and are closed certain days of the week.
author: Jennifer D.

description: Been coming here for nearly 20yrs and have ordered the same things everytime:  crab insalata, penne pasta, clams, house salad and scampi....SAME DEELISH taste everytime. Consistent with their service, servings and taste.  Owners finally sold to another company and hope that they will retain every bit of work that Mr Latoni put into this masterpiece!  You will not be disappointed!!  Parking is pricey across the street, but then again, you're in the city!
author: M C.

description:
Rude Servers, with Attitude
"I can't keep going back and forth to the kitchen because you keep adding to your order!"  "We are only two of us serving this restaurant, can't you see?"
An uncomfortable experience, with a group.  Wanted a relaxed dinner but didn't work out that way--planned to start with a first round of pastas and then intended to add to it depending on how hungry we were and what we liked.  Aggressive, brow beating attitude from servers.  Would not recommend for a group.
author: P S.

description: As a college student, I can honestly say that the Funghi e carne pasta was better than the stuff I cook when drunk in my  dorm but just barely. Overpriced and very basic, I cannot recommend this place.
author: Matthieu F.

description: Great atmospheric joint. Has.family style tables and a row of tables for two. The decor is funky cool. And the food.fantastic. Had the cipino in the clear garlic broth and the homemade squid ink crab stuffed raviolis. They may have been the best raviolis we've ever had.
author: Andrew G.

description:
Had their seafood pasta and my friend had gnocci, we both got sick from something, not sure which dish it was.  We didn't eat anything else so we're not sure.
Service is great, atmosphere is like I'm back in Sicily.
author: Valerie C.

description:
I love this charming restaurant in North Beach, the decor is unique and fun. We went for lunch and we ordered:

1. Seafood stew
2. Pasta with mushroom and meat
3. Fried calamari

The stew was amazing! The seafood was fresh and was a good quality. The stew consisted of calamari, mussels, crab legs and jumbo prawns. The pasta was delicious and I love the sauce. This is one of the best pastas I have tasted in north beach. The calamari was huge and the dipping sauce was amazing:) I want to come back for dinner.
author: Rosanna T.

description:
Waiters who know what you want better than you do, "I'll have the blah, blah, blah..."  "No! I bring you the la,la, la," delivered with an accent straight off the boat.  The setting has a fun-house feel to it with centerpieces that range from aquariums  to hubcaps;  There will be enough garlic in your system to float back to your hotel...and lasts for three days after you've flown home.

An imperious San Fran socialite I shared an elevator ride with in Atlanta put the crown on it when I mentioned what a great time we had had in the arms of Caffe Sport, "No one FROM San Francisco goes to Cafe Sport!"  

I smiled and paused to savor the moment before asking, "Can I count on that?"

Cafe Sport.  See you in February, 2014!
Maura C.
author: Maura C.

description:
This is a real deal Italian joint with really home style, friendly service. 

Not super cheap, but you'll get a delicious dinner and likely leftovers for tomorrow. Go for the pasta with shrimp.
author: Kristina C.

description:
BEST PASTA/SEAFOOD COMBOS EVER!!! So it gets 3.5 stars. 

Loses the 1.5 stars because it is superrrrr cramped inside the restaurant and there's never any parking ):
author: Nicole H.

description:
After taking in a Beach Blanket Babylon show at Club Fugazi last night, my friend Kent, his parents, and myself were a bit peckish, so headed into North Beach for some good Italian food. On their suggestion, we decided to eat at Caffe Sport. 

We were quickly seated near the front door, and water, bread and some sort of spicy red sauce in a small dish were brought to our table. Decor is over the top and turned out to be more interesting than the food. The service throughout the meal was adequate, but a bit slow, assuming they were just having a really busy night as the place was packed. 

Food is served family style, and the menu is not lengthy, with typical Italian and pasta dishes. The eggplant parmesan was tasty, but the skin was overdone and could have been better. Shrimp and scallop pasta was ok, too, but with such high prices, I could have stayed home and had better. My sole with lemon and butter served with zucchini ($20) was fine, but again, didn't knock my socks off. 

Really wanted to like this place, and perhaps if I went back again the food and service might be better, but not really sure. It was just ok.
author: David G.

description: Kind of awesome. The salad, dipping sauce, pastas and especially the eggplant parm - oh yeah the carafes of cheapie red wine too - rocked. YAY!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Was taken here last weekend while visiting SF on vacation. WOW!!!!!!
From the moment we sat down the experience was MOLTO BENE!!
The vino was superb, the staff were like family, the food portions were HUGE, the flavor of everything was perfecto fantastico.......I couldnt think of anything bad to say about this place if I tried. 
Can't wait to go back!!!!!
author: M o.

description: The bread and the dipping sauce were fantastic!!! I had the 4 cheese penne pasta with scallops and shrimp in a marinara sauce and it was FANTASTIC!!! The crab ravioli in a white sauce was AMAZING!! The Scampi in white sauce and zucchini was very good. Large prawns. Dessert was the Tiramisu and it was fantastic too!! Service very fast and friendly. Everything served family style so be sure to share!!! And enjoy!!! Oh, and the atmosphere and decor is very nice. Feels like you are sitting at a restaurant in Italy!!!
author: Frank C.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place out, but never got around to it until this past Tuesday. With family in town and the sister wanting seafood, I first chose North Beach as a location since it's a fun area to walk around at night, then Caffe Sport as one of the choices since I knew they offer seafood and have great reviews.

I've read about the decor of this place, but after visiting, I definitely find the decor interesting, yet fun! Although it's kind of crazy and all over the place, nothing about it feels uncomfortable. Very cozy and inviting restaurant.

The food here is also very good - first off, the sauce they bring you with the fresh bread is excellent. Although their pasta options are limited and only serve over Penne, the dishes are good - I ordered the Pasta Vongole (clams), and it comes with their pink sauce (or as the server described, a mixture of cheese sauce and red sauce). The sauce is great and seafood was fresh.

The only gripe I had during our visit was the order that our dishes were brought to us. We had a party of six and two of our orders came out, then another 10-15 minutes later, the other four came out. By the time everyone else's orders came out, we were already done (usually of course I would wait for everyone else's food to come out to start, but we began waiting so long that it was better to eat it than let it all go cold).

Service is friendly, beer & wine only.
author: Tiffany K.

description: I went to Caffe Sport because a girl I met while on vacation recommended it and i would recommend it to everyone. Not only is the food delicious but the people who work there along with the family that is related to the owner are super sweet and cheerful. They are a sweet Italian family who know how to run a nice little business. The food, atmosphere and people are amazing, this place is a must when visiting San Francisco!
author: Alesha C.

description: The wife and went for dinner last night and it was amazing from the wait staff to the Italian wine to the unbelievable food.  How they can take a simple spaghetti & meatball dish and make it so amazing is beyond me.  Its small and festive I recommend reservations, we had a 45 min wait without one.  This is a must stop when visiting NorthBeach...
author: Richard R.

description: The food was fine and the service was okay. We wouldn't go again - not because it was bad, but because there are so many other options and nothing was really memorable.
author: Theresa G.

description: Came here with a big group, Luis was our server.  We didnt know what to get, he asked us what we liked, and then took care of the ordering... Everything was on point, food was great, service attentive and friendly... I would highly recommend coming especially if you are with a group.
author: Peter L.

description: We've been going here for the past 16 years and they continue to provide us with amazing food and friendly service.  Family style restaurant.  The Rustica and Petrale sole are a MUST!!!
author: Maile V.

description:
Came here for a friends birthday party. It was a nice little place. The problem was that this place has no vents so it was like a sauna inside. They also have problems filling the water glasses from time to time. 

Food was good.
author: M C.

description:
This place was really bad. Don't know if it was because we came in with a party of 6 or what but was definitely one of the worst dining experiences here in the city. 

First of all the service was delayed and flat out rude. When we were deciding on a bottle of wine for the meal the waiter choose a couple of bottles which were not up to par so we asked for some more selections. 10 minutes later the waiter brought back a few more bottles which were somewhat better. 

The food was probably the single worst portion of the experience on top of it being my girlfriends birthday. Sauces were very bland, the plate of uncut lettuce which was their version of a house salad was bland and had little taste to their sysco based dressing. All the dishes we had were pretty much shit and that's coming from a non snobby very easy to please individual. The "chef" kept coming out with different plates of shit and basically threw them on our table without a single gesture of hospitality or asking our meal was going. 

By the end of the experience everyone was pretty annoyed with how shitty the service as well as the food was. On the brighter hand the setting of the place was really legit and the family style menu was a good concept expecially since we were in a group but do yourselves a favor and get better chefs not just your average Mexican from the mission. 

Only giving this place 2 stars because of the decor but besides that save your money and go somewhere else.
author: Mike T.

description:
Best pesto pasta ever. Even Martha Stewart agrees and did a story about it a few years back. The eggplant parm is also fabulous. 

This place is filled with North Beach history. The food is really good, but it's not a fancy pants chef type of place. Very family style, not going for the sophisticated crowd. The service can be a bit erratic, but I've been coming here for years and I still say it's a wonderful experience.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Garlic Shrimp (not the prawns dish) was creamy and garlicky. I expected pasta, didn't get, but the almost 1/2 lb of shrimp with fresh veggies (zucchini) was more than enough. Didn't miss it. Especially with the complimentary crusty bread with spicy dipping sauce. A nice treat. 

A very large potion at $20-well worth it. I stay at the bar and Luis tendered with great service, filling my water and checking on me just often enough. The interior is cozy and small, quaintly decorated. A bit loud due to its size and a birthday party of 10 right the middle, but nonetheless a fine time for a party of one.
author: Debra C.

description: I don't understand the negative reviews here.  The place is kitschy, sure, but this is the kind of place where that works.  I've only been there a couple of times, but both were excellent food.  Maybe it was the fact they weren't busy, but the food is just hearty central-Italian cuisine.  I've not been disappointed.
author: John S.

description:
Love Love Love this place! Everything we ordered was absolutely fabulous. 
Service was good. the atmosphere was very eclectic and fun. We ordered the cioppino and a seafood pasta. Both were delicious. We will definitely be back.
author: Jenn C.

description:
I ve been there with my Girlfriend 1 week ago and we just had very good time in the there.
The place is located in the heart of little italy,and the decoration of the restaurant they r  fantastic.
The food it's very good, real italian food,my favorite is the Pasta Pesto,and the sauce with bread..Fantastic.
Hope to be back soon at Caffe Sport
author: Luca L.

description: The food was amazing and they have a great Barbera!  This is not our first time here and will not be our last.  The food is always great and it never matters what you get!  The service was pretty slow (maybe they were shorthanded) but I was with my love so it did not cause too much of a disruption!  A wonderful choice for great food and wine in North Beach!
author: Walnut Creek Last W.

description: I have been going to this place since 1972 and it has never let me down, Tony is a great guy and always makes us feel like family, would have given 5 stars but no cocktails.
author: Kirk B.

description: Puzzled by the positive reviews. Simply put, everything about this restaurant reeks of poor management. I feel sorry for the hardworking people trying to cover up this mess.
author: Francine V.

description: The sauces were unusually delicious for North Beach.  A Gorgonzola, anchovies dip for our Italian bread was outstanding and creative.  An original approach to appetizers, Eggplant Involtini, was outstanding.  The eggplant wrapped in prosciutto, accompanied by a perfect tomato based sauce was beyond great.  Our pasta, homemade ravioli stuffed with ricotta and spices, covered with a phenomenal pesto sauce was equally great.  Not just mainland Italian wines on the menu, but also Sicilian. Finally, homemade, freshly stuffed cannoli for dessert -- with bits of amazingly intense chocolate drizzles on the side.  One of the best meals we have had in North Beach in a long time.
author: Al M.

description:
Update: they do magic plastic here now.

last night was incredible (again), thank you dear chef.
author: Athena S.

description: This place makes you feel like your in Italy with all the decorations. The food is delicious and rich with flavor. You can guarantee you will be completely satisfied. The waiters are very friendly and attentive. The pasta Rustica is probably the best I've ever had!
author: Florinda P.

description:
The decor is very nice and the service was good too. I definitely give the QUALITY of food 5 stars, but the QUANTITY of food 0-1 star. It is pricey - at least 20 bucks a plate because it is family style. 

The only bad thing about this place is the quantity of food for the price. 3 of my friends and I ordered a the special that night among other things which was a ravioli plate. For $22 we got 6 raviolis. We all looked at each other stunned and basically said "ARE YOU FREAKIN KIDDING ME?"
author: Tony G.

description: If your in San Francisco and want the best pasta and Italian style sea food this is the place to go.  And Antonio's mom's Cannoli is just the best you will ever eat.  Great food, drinks, service, desert and service.  Antonio's is just the best and his families history in the San Francisco restaurant business is legendary.  We have been going here since the 70's and always eat hear at least 1-2 times per month and always bring our friends from out of town here.
author: David B.

description:
Not sure why the other reviewers rated this restaurant so low, but my experience at this place was very good.  I came here in early October with a party of five.  We actually came here by "accident" because the restaurant next door (Sotto Mare) wasn't taking any reservations and their owner had a horrible attitude.  We ordered five pasta dishes -- all were excellent.  Service was courteous, friendly, and prompt.  Restaurant decor  is unique and interesting (although restaurant is a bit small).  Moderate, reasonable prices.  Will gladly return to this place.

*** Parking is a nightmare in this area -- come early or be ready to park a little further from the restaurant.
author: Nancy W.

description:
OK-I have been going here since college - 1981...you HAVE to order the pesto and the prawns....both are to die for and the best I have ever had.

Warning - you will smell like garlic for days!
author: Tamara W.

description:
This place is awesome!

Great pasta, pesto is amazing!!!

Ordered Shrimp Penne, and Meat/Mushroom Penne. (don't recall the actual names)

Great friendly service, great italian food, can't ask for more!
author: Grace C.

description: Haven't been here in ages and the interior looks the same. Really crazy looking and eclectic! Food was okay, but no more white sauce pasta with calamari on the menu. Really sad about that...
author: Missy X.

description:
It makes me sad to give Caffe Sport only 2 stars.  The 2 stars are based on my second visit just this past weekend.  My first visit to Caffe Sport last November was wonderful (4.5 stars).  However, this last visit came very short of that first time wonderful.  

The service was the worst service I have ever received at any restaurant I have ever been to.  I seriously think the server was trying to get a bad tip.  Never once checked up on our table to see if we needed more drinks, never asked how the food was, never asked if we needed anything else, had a horrible attitude... and the worst thing he did was tell us, "I'm sorry, we don't have any more bread."  Are you kidding me?!  I came with 4 (very hungry) guys and we had three baskets of bread before we asked for another one.  The server brought back a basket with only three slices in it!  I asked why this was and was given that BS reply.  He could of at least told us that they have a limit on the amount of bread they can serve.  They should be prepared to serve tons of bread with that amazing sauce they serve!

I will not be returning due to this unfortunate experience.  :-/
author: Andrea M.

description:
Overrated and overpriced. 
The atmosphere is nice, but the food has no taste. I use to fish and cook calamari and crabs. The ones I had there were without taste as if it had been frozen. 
To pay 20$ for some pasta and a simple classical impersonal pistou sauce on it..... Well if you have money, good for you. 
You have much better in SF for the same price.
author: JB J.

description: Clam pasta is great! Will def want to try scampy, pesto n eggplant parm next time. Cioppino sauce is great but clams were undercook n calamari is a lil fishy. I swear the portin used tp be much bigger.
author: Wendy T.

description:
First off I want to preface this review by saying that I have been coming to Caffe Sport sine something like 1978 ! My mom first brought me here back then when we lived in Mill Valley. I was blown away by it then and it still remains the same even more than 30 years later !!!! Who else can say that honestly these days ? Every single time I am in the Bay Area I make a trip over to Green street for some of the best scampi ever conceived ! Anything A'l Antonio ( RIP ) is simply amazing. The ambiance and decor inside still remain the same and are exquisite and uber charming. The staff are incredible and always remember my face when I pop in whenever I return. My favorite 
Italian seafood spot on the globe....I'm so glad they're still in full effect.
I've even gone so far as to have friends get me an order and fly it to me in la ,,,I'm crazy for that garlic sauce and veggies....bam !!!
Thanks Caffe Sport for all of the good years.
author: David B.

description: I have eaten here several times. The food is great,  I love seafood so that is what I Usually have, Have not been disappointed yet. The ambiance and staff are great here, it feels like you are on the Mediterranean.
author: Ed D.

description: The food was good and the dining area is warm and comfortable; decorated with unique Italian antiques.  The service was above average as well.  The menu is filled with Italian American staples -- pastas and scampi that are well prepared, but unfortunately lack originality.  Also, "restaurant-style" seemed to mean the food was served with a larger spoon for sharing.  This was fine with us and we had plenty to eat, but don't expect huge portions.
author: Patricia G.

description: This is an awesome place for groups.  One of my good friends loves it, so I've been here a couple of times.  I really like the atmosphere - it's decorated with some of the coolest art.  The food is incredibly fresh/delicious with huge portions, and the service is always great.
author: Lawree S.

description:
We were all in the mood for some pasta and dropped in to see what they had.

We all ordered different pastas: mushroom, eggplant, clams. tomatoes,etc.  I like the mushroom and meat the best but all were good.

Add some cheap wine,  too much fun and a great waiter and you have a great night out!!
author: Stevenson P.

description:
Can't say I'm truly impressed by Caffe Sport.  It's an old N.B. restaurant with lots of regulars and come backers but I'm a long time area visitor and there are lots of better places nearby.
I met with a large party and we tried many dishes but it seemed to me that lots of them were the same sauce.  True there were a few favorites, like the shrimp pasta.  Big, tender shrimp in lots of sauce and pasta.  The bread is OK but it's not sourdough.  The seating is very cramped and can be uncomfortable for lengthy seating.  Overall, the place is OK but I wouldn't put it at the top of my list of Italian joints.
author: Pablo R.

description:
I am absolutely in love with Caffe Sport.. I came here for the second time with my boyfriend Friday night and boy was it perfect! The Cioppino is a must.. duh. And the dipping sauce they serve with the bread is DELECTABLE. We were the last ones in finishing up our bottle of wine when suddenly they changed the music  to some Love Jams and brought out a piece of Tiramusu on the house, which by the way was PERFECT (so hard to find good Tiramasu) it was really cute and just made our night that much better. 
I will definitely be bringing more of my family here when they come visit to get a taste of our Sicilian roots. YUM.
author: Danielle G.

description: Went here awhile back and thank heavens they tell you that the food is served family style or man  would we have ordered to much. We shared the seafood Alfredo and it was delicious.  I loved that ot was so fresh and seemed like a old homemade recipe. The service was great and the alfredo sauce was amazing! !!!! Im so glad we went because it was perfect and ended up being less than 25 dollars for the whole dinner for 2. And you certainly cant beat that in the city
author: Tabitha O.

description:
Caffe. Sport. Is a place that I keep coming back because of the best sea food in San. Francisco I love it.
The dishes on the Menu are pass on from second. Generation 
The service is great I have lots fun with them and give a great service
If you like sea food try it. You will love it
author: Giovanni L.

description:
I just visited Caffé Sport for the first time since the mid 80's (I often referred to this as my favorite restaurant in the US).  WHAT A DISAPPOINTMENT!

The lobster with pasta and cream sauce just missed the mark - lobster was tough, and the sauce did not have the richness that a good cream and garlic sauce demands.  The once proud desert choices now feature a frozen tiramisu.  In the "old days" they served deserts from local Italian bakeries.

The service was "enthusiastic" but untrained. The main course came too close to the salad and the wait staff reached across my plate to clear a dish several times.

I know all things change over time but this case the change was not favorable.  This will be my final visit.  Antonio the kitchen needs you back!
author: Martin S.

description:
The search was on for a good seafood restaurant, and while Sotto Mare had a long wait time, yelp reviews listed Caffe Sport pretty high on the list, so on we went next door to explore some good food. The ambience was INTENSE. A whole lot going on all over, from the ceiling to the walls.

The menu was sparse and our options limited, but we decided on the filet of sole, steamed mussels and tomato cioppino. The mussels were FANTASTIC! the filet of sole was great as well... But that cioppino, despite having a fantastic tase, was a bit overcooked. A bit upsetting, but despite the overcooked cioppino we left satisfied.
author: Angelic S.

description:
The best Italian restaurant ever!

My friend from LA actually recommended this place to me a couple months back (yes, this place is famous - even in SoCal), and I'm SO happy I came here! This place is located in the heart of Little Italy (on Green, I believe), so it's perfect to stop by for dinner after a long day of strolling around SF.

Everything was served family style, and our food literally came out in less than five minutes! We ordered Pasta with clams (Vongoles), and some creamy shrimp dish (I really with I knew Italian, sorry), and they were both DELICIOUS! My mouth is watering up just thinking about the clams... ohhh man the clams. So good. And the sauce was goooood too.

And they have an amazing staff! They seem to have thick Italian accents, but it actually makes everything sound better.. haha! Service was great. Our server was really attentive and friendly, plus he knew exactly when/how long to leave us alone, so we can enjoy our food without being disturbed. Everything was delightful, and we left him a fat tip!

If anyone's looking for some awesome authentic Italian food, I'd definitely recommend Caffe Sport.
author: Dee W.

description:
So, admittedly, I don't have much to claim when it comes to experience with finer(ish) Italian cuisine- even Olive Garden is a bit too fancy for me.  (unless I get my nails done, hair done & errrrrrything) But this place would get a thumbs up from even the bay areas self proclaimed reigning guido kings & guidette queens. 

This is not a pseudo Italian chain place. To my extreme surprise, when the waiter came, it was not one of my fellow Mexican paisas, but a nice young Italian guy who I could barely understand (in any case, almost a paisa since they both no speak pa-pa-pa-americano)

They start you automatically off with some bread and dipping sauce- apparently laced with heroine because it is so damn good, you'll be trying to sell yourself in exchange for more. 

Don't sell yourself too cheap though, because the actual entree sizes are HUGE and DELICIOUS. We got a seafood pasta plate and a spinach veggie plate, but ended up leaving with plenty of leftovers. Though food is delicious, be aware that it is rich and heavy with cream, fat, calories, and butter, so you'll end up leaving the place looking more like Fat Tony than Sofia Loren. 

Place has a great homey-family-feel and really nice decorating, despite a bit of an unoriginal name for the place. Definitely worth checking out again.
author: Veronica G.

description: The food was fantastic and fresh (garlic, garlic, I was in garlic heaven).  The portions were large and sharable for two.  Our server was ultra polite and accommodating to our questions and offered recommendations.   Visiting from San Diego, we inquired about a good Italian joint and the bartender two doors down recommended this place.    We were not disappointed.  The decor leaves your eyes entertained throughout the entire meal.  We tried the Shrimp Al Antonio with the house salad.  The house salad was delightful, unlike some house salads that use only iceberg, a few lonely tomatoes, and perhaps some shredded carrots.  The meal was perfectly paired with a wine that our server topped our glasses off with toward the end of the night.  What a fun place.
author: nicolette l.

description: I came here on a date and was really impressed by the atmosphere, service and especially the food! We ordered eggplant involtini and mussels. I liked it so much that I took my parents here when they came to visit, and they loved it too.
author: Corinne G.

description:
Came here to celebrate a friend's 30th and was pleasantly surprised! I'm usually not a fan of North Beach because of how crowded it is and how difficult it is to find parking and despite the fact that the parking was still nowhere close to being easy, the restaurant made me forget it all! The service was good, the waiter was attentive and nice. They have a simple menu and everything on there is basically meal size, no appetizer sizes! So for those of you with light appetites, you're either bringing home leftovers or you'll be wasting a lot of food!

The plates that come out are pretty much family style because of the size. It's not as big as Bucca di Beppo but for an Italian restaurant it's pretty big -- I'd share one dish would feed 2-3 people. Beware though if the menu says that it has garlic in it, whether it's a garlic cream sauce, or it's just a garlic dressing, they are not kidding. They load on the garlic, this place should be known as the Stinking Rose. I can taste the garlic much more than at Stinking Rose, and it's in a good way even if everyone else I talk to that night doesn't think so. 

So if you're looking for a family style restaurant then this is the place. But beware the garlic and if you have a larger group, they don't have much space to accommodate. I think they have maybe 2 or 3 spots for larger groups and past that you'll have to break your group up unless you want to wait, even with reservations. Bon appetit!
author: Ellen C.

description: My family's go-to italian restaurant. If you're going to have italian food in north beach, you MUST try caffe sport. Their mussels are amazing! We always get two orders of them! And the meat pasta and pesto pasta are delicious! And the service is always great! They always treat us like family!
author: Sharon N.

description:
Super duper small, but comfortable atmosphere. The staff is extremely friendly!

We had a party of 16, and ordered many dishes. It was disappointing that they opted to put two orders on one plate. We had to pass it down the entire table, as well as bring it to the bar.

The pesto is really out of this world. It was SOOOO yummy. The bread and dipping sauce at the beginning of the meal is also very delicious. If you want more bread, just ask!

We had some fish dish that was really good but I don't remember the name. It had zucchinis.. :)
author: Erica A.

description: If you can catch it when its open this Sicilian-American restaurant has a Cioppino that is rather ambrosial and perfumes one in garlic! The cramped interior is decorated with colorful murals. The server was quite a character.
author: Elias E.

description: Amazing food, great service will definitely go back!  The steamed clams and pesto were my favorites.
author: janie g.

description: 5 stars all the way. Good service, great food, good wine and family dining. Shrimp scampi was wonderful, chicken parm was epic.!pesto was a+ and then there was the rustico. Scallops and shrimp galore...
author: Tim S.

description: Great atmosphere, wonderful staff, and by far some of the best chicken parm I've ever had!
author: Jennifer N.

description:
Apparently one of the other Italian restaurants is upset at how well this place is doing....pretty obvious when the one-star reviews come from question mark heads. 

This place is amazing. We accidentally ended up here for dinner before Beach Blanket Babylon. A local pointed us in the direction of Caffe Sport which was a huge selling point. I really wasn't too excited about it when we saw the outside, it looks like an old sports bar and I didn't want bar food, but we went in anyway because we were in a bit of a time crunch. 

The second we stepped inside, I know it was going to be greatness. 

We ordered a salad and the pasta rustica to split and I could have bathed in the dressing and sauce. I can't even explain to you how awesome this meal was...so I won't even attempt to. Just know that you WILL NOT be disappointed if you eat here. 

One of the waiters told us that the restaurant had been there for 41 years and that the menu had never changed...that's saying something!

The service was impeccable. Everyone in the place stopped by to say hello to us...even the man who cooked our dinner! I don't have a bad thing to say about this place and I figure the people who do...haven't actually eaten here...or their brains have been taken over by aliens because you'd have to be crazy to think this wasn't amazing food.
author: Emily P.

description: Very good food That's all that needs to be said you won't be disappointed. We had a party of five and ordered three p
author: Kim L.

description:
All I can say is sauce.  The red sauce superb, the sauce on the crab salad, which isn't a salad, outstanding, but the best sauce was the sauce for the shrimp and penne.
I had the house salad, my only complaint for the evening was that they used the beginnings of the romaine which are inedible, too bitter.  I then had the Petrale Sole which knocked my socks off!  
If you don't like garlic, do not come here, everything was loaded with perfectly cooked garlic.
Don't eat the bread at the beginning of the meal, save it for mopping up the sauce from the shrimp pasta dish.
author: Pam M.

description:
Dinner here with a group of 14...my first visit but most of the group comes in often from Walnut Creek for dinner. We had made a reservation for the large table across from the bar- which was great for our group.
The food was great - the pesto was to DIE for. I would have filled up a bath tub and bathed in it. A great texture...I could feel the chunks of garlic when I took a bite, and the left over sauce on the plate was quickly sopped up with bread...nearly fights breaking out to get the last few dips.
The meat eaters in the group raved about the meat sauce and some prawns and vegetable dish. The eggplant parm was enjoyed by several people. Started with a giant salad and LOTS of bread and their house dipping sauce. Everything we ordered we ordered double orders and we had empty plates. A couple of pieces of shared tiramisu around the table, which was tasty, not really my thing though.
The negative comments below about quick food is a little surprising...cooking pasta really shouldn't take all night.
author: Megan T.

description: I haven't gone in for over 20 years! last week I went in and the food is still as I remember it! The Scampi All' Antonio is out of this world! If you love garlic, try this dish!  It is smothered in a white sauce with zucchini strips.
author: Bing S.

description:
Just had to post a follow-up review...
We came here again this past weekend for a birthday celebration; there were 7 of us in our party.  We arrived at approx. 7:30pm on a Saturday, the place was extremely busy but no reservations were needed. It was only a 20 minute wait before  we were seated.  Once we were seated our server came right over and introduced himself - extremely friendly and personable.  We ended up getting the Con Pesto, Scampi All' Antonio and the Eggplant parmigiana with a house salad.  The dishes are served family style so everybody helps themselves.  The food was fabulous!  Yes, there is a lot of garlic and the sauce's are rich, but it is soooo good!!!  The white garlic sauce over the scampi and zucchini was so rich and creamy - and the pesto dish was outstanding, best pesto I have tasted.  Can't wait to get back out to North Beach!! :)
author: Brandy A.

description:
A pathetic excuse for Italian food.  I'm stunned by the positive remarks on here.  Does SF understand good Italian?

The Pesto sauce was a bland, mushy cream-based mess (who puts cream in pesto?).  You're supposed to see and taste the garlic, olive oil, and basil.  I tasted and saw none of those ingredients.  What was I served?  It wasn't Pesto.

Another member of my party tried the fish.  It was a leathery, old specimen of fish that fortunately was drenched in heavy sauce to mask it's flaws.

And the place looks filthy.
author: Mike B.

description: CIOPPINO = a plate of seafood, no soup. AND ITS YUM.
author: Emily D.

description: The decorations will definitely give you something to chat over dinner. The dip that comes with the bread is different but in a good way. Save some of the bread, you will need it to soak up the sauce. The portions are good for the price you for. I would definitely say wear your comfy pants because this meal is definitely heavy but yummy. The sauces could be considered greasy by some but it's still good. Bring a toothbrush or some gum because you will be burping up garlic for sometime after dinner. The sole is so flavorful and tender but again will definitely take a toll on the waistline. It's a no frill restaurant that serves up a hearty meal and they do it well.
author: Eve C.

description: USED TO BE a 5, now it's a 1:(  Took visitors there last night and service was not only minimal but rude, orange garlic sauce was not nearly as good as the original - what happened???  Same experience 2 years ago...used to love it before that.  Never again...lost favorite in SF.
author: Lori L.

description:
Near and dear to my heart, this is another place I've been going to since I was a kid.  Four things to remember at Caffe Sport.

1) Pesto
2) Shrimp Al' Antonio
3) Cioppino
4) The bread Sauce

Caffe Sport is down home cooking for real, it's a small place, it's eclectic looking, great service and by far the best pasta sauces, bread dipping sauce, and cioppino in San Francisco.  So keyword here is SAUCE.

So don't ask for butter with your bread or something lame like olive oil and balsamic vinegar because one they don't have it and two their orange colored dipping sauce is so deliciously out of this world that you will forget that olive oil and balsamic vinegar even existed.
author: Terrine B.

description:
I first went to Caffe Sport in 1984. A company recruiting me to come work in San Francisco took me there for dinner. Up until then I was not sure I wanted to make the move from Phoenix. That clinched the deal (seriously). The ambiance, setting, staff and the FOOD!! Other reviewers have hit it on the head. The Con Pesto and Scampi are signature dishes and incredible. Don't expect some sort of foodie light and subtle faire here. It is real, substantive and spicy (as in garlic and basil). When I lived there in the 80's you could not think of going without reservations made the Tuesday of the week you were going, so I was surprised to hear someone say reservations aren't necessary.

The staff is great. Once I took a friend from the East. The waiter asked if we wanted to order any wine. My friend broke out his sommelier act and began talking about his preferences by label and vintage. The waiter just rolled his eyes, tapped him gently on the shoulder and said "no no no, red or white".  If you want warmth, sensory stimulation, a little humor and great traditional Italian, this is the best in my experience, I haven't been back in a number of years, but good to hear it is still going strong. Is Antonio still there?
author: Crabby K.

description:
I debated about giving this place 3 stars:

- The atmosphere is great and the interior decorating has homey, old-world kind of feel to it. Aside from the wooden seats, I was really impressed with the place.
- The staff was super friendly and helpful. More so than a lot of other places I've eaten at.

The reason I gave it 2 stars:

- The food was so average. The pesto was a plate of noodles with some green sauce. The carne and funghi wasn't much more. I felt like, given 30 minutes in the kitchen, I could have made something way more tasty. This holds true for the six or seven dishes I tried.
- And there's nothing worse than paying through the nose for average food. Plates start at $15 and only go up.

In the end, I was just really disappointed. I wouldn't recommend it or go back.
author: Car C.

description:
This Place is Awesome!
ALL TIME CLASSIC Sicilian Mecca & Shrine.
Buca di Beppo tried to Copy THIS Place.
This is Way, Way, Way better than Buca di Beppo. 
this place makes Buca di Beppo look like a Olive Garden.

Best Dishes
Penne Con Pesto * (Best Dish) (This is A MUST ORDER!)
With basil, garlic, and parmesan cheese sauce
This is the Best Pesto Sauce I have EVER Had in America.

Chianti Classico

Cioppino All' Antonio
Seafood stew in a white garlic sauce 

Insalata Verde
Mixed greens salad

Scampi All' Antonio
Prawns in white garlic sauce with zucchini 

Aragosta All' Antonio
Lobster in white garlic sauce with zucchini

The Penne with Pesto is Off the Hook Here!

Special note:
For other Yelper's reviews with butter mentioned.
We actually asked them
Is there butter in the pesto sauce here?
They said No.
They Do Not use butter in the Pesto Sauce or 
anywhere else here.

Abnormally Low Prices for the Very high Quality Cuisine & Healthy Portions here.
(Each Dish Should Feed 2 Easy)
5 Stars for Food
5 stars For Atmosphere
Bonus Points: Very VERY 
Short menu. only 9 dishes on the whole menu here !
Double Bonus Points: They have braids of garilc hanging from the rafters here.
Pic = http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/3523gS3FWpFdGFR7vjvhnA?select=AzXTBkVqP-jFjy9FDpFuzQ
Highest ever reccomendation!
author: Tommy T.

description: Not the best service at all.  When I asked the waiter to refill the bread, it takes him hours to comply.  Also, the food is not like it used to be years ago.  The steam clams used to be big and juicy, now it looks like something they got from Chinatown.  Also, it looks like they are saving a lot on portions.  The Crab salad is wayy over priced.  It used to be like two portions of crab, now it's like 1/2 portion.  They are really making a buck...All in all the taste is still ok, but they are making it like japanese portions.
author: Jeffy C.

description:
almost as good as Nonna's!
big family portions, great menu, accommodating servers, and the ambiance is fantastic too!
author: Litz L.

description: Our group of 17 ppl made a reservation in mid-July to eat dinner here on Friday, July 25.  My brother even called to confirm the reservation on Wed, July 23.  It was very important to meet here because we came from all over the country.  When we arrived, we were told that they could not serve us because there was an electrical blackout.  Blackouts happen, of course.  What was inexcusable was that they did not take the time to call us to let us know the status.  That was really inconsiderate.  Luckily, one of the local cousins knew of another place  to dine.   Food taste is an important part of the dining experience, but so is courtesy and hospitality.
author: eddie c.

description:
Ever watch the movie: Howl's Moving Castle? 
The interior looks so interesting, not in the way that it's all hip and sassy, but it was cozy with all the walls filled with trinklets and bottles. I wante dto sit there and read a book, it made me so cozy.

On top of that, my friend and I ordered the Pasta con Vongole, clam pasta with the most apettizing sauce. Sort of like a tomato alfredo sauce.. it didn't get boring at all. We chowed to the bottom of the plate without speaking a word!!
author: Yuki A.

description:
Worst dining experience we've ever had in North Beach. Service was horrible and slow, waiter very inattentive and forgetful. Place was not very busy when we arrived, which was strange because we couldn't get an OT reservation time until 8:00 on a Sunday night. Many open tables in the place. Took over 20 minutes after we were seated to even get bread or offered of a drink.
Ordered meals and were served about 20 minutes or so after, so that wasn't too bad at all. Waiter dropped off our food, and did not come back to check on the meal for at least another 20 - 30 min +. When he came back I had to ask for Parmesan cheese and S&P (because my Linguine with clams was so bland), He went off without letting us finish telling him about the rest of the meal.  My wife was not happy with her "World Famous" Pesto Gnocchi. It was way overboard on the garlic. Yes, we know Pesto is supposed to be Garlicky, but this was way over the top. Waiter finally came over again at the end of our meal and asked how it was. My wife had only eaten a few bites of her dish, and we mentioned that it had way too much garlic. Waiter told us they were a Garlic restaurant and they were famous for the dish. I explained that we both love garlic, but this was way too strong. Funny that the Linguine with clams was supposed to have garlic in it, but I could hardly taste any garlic in it. They must have used it all on the WF Pesto. He said we should have told him earlier and he would have brought her something else, but I mentioned that this was the first time he came by our table to ask about the meal, (40 minutes later)and he stated that they were really busy, and there were only two waiters working....He didn't apologize or offer to reduce the meal pricing or anything to make it right. We will never return, and will make sure everyone we know never goes to this establishment. The waiter was pretty much the same to the table next to ours too. Sure didn't take him long to bring our bill though...
author: D M.

description:
The place is cute and the waiter was very nice.  The wine was good.  

If there is no limit to your love of cheese and garlic and salt and oil then this is your place.  

They grated cheese over the clams (I'm not kidding).  The shrimp dish was smothered in cheesey bechamel sauce.  Everything was overwhelmed by garlic.  The salad was so salty and garlicky it was "hot".  

If you're not bothered by rich, heavy, creamy, oily dishes and you think cheese has a place on seafood and you don't mind waking up three times in the night to brush your teeth to try to beat back the garlic and you feel more salt = more better, then you will love Caffe Sport! 

I would not eat here again under any circumstances.  I'm still shuddering.
author: Mookie M.

description: This place is awesome! Went here for my friend's goodbye dinner and we got seated at one of the semi private tables. Food was great (ordered the Rustica, house salad, ravioli, and the seafood platter.. although the bread is a bit stale in my opinion) and our server was really nice and helpful. Definitely would come back again.
author: Millie C.

description:
if you are one of those jerk-offs that needs the chef to come out and ask how your meal was, this ain't the place for you... 

if you are one of those dillweeds that deduct a star cuz water refills don't come quick enough, this ain't the place for you...

if you just like to have a feast, than give this place a shot.  portion's great, tastes is definitely great, service is great if you ain't a puss and just ask the waiter for what you need.
author: Anthony W.

description: My daughter and her fiancée have been raving about Caffe sport for years. She planned a birthday dinner for both myself and her fiancée last night at this adorable little place for 13 of us. Despite the small space they accommodated our large group all at one table and the service was phenomenal. Now let's talk about the food. One word, AMAZING!!!!!! If you love garlic this is the spot to go!!! The crab, the penne with meat sauce , pesto ... Everything was worth raving about!!!! This is most definitely a new favorite for our large family. We will be back sooner than later.
author: Coleen R.

description:
Last Friday night we decided that we wanted to break out of our rut a little bit but didn't want to venture beyond walking distance from home. So we stumbled upon Caffe Sport and were able to not only be seated but to grab some sort of canopy booth thing at 8 pm on a Friday night. Score! 

The inside of this place is like a circus come to life. I loved it. My only suggestion is to turn the wattage down a tad in the back of the restaurant. It is a straight up halogen bulb back there. 

But the food was awesome and family style is so much fun. Between 4 we split the house salad and 4 entrees. WAY TOO MUCH food. The salad was awesome. So was the dipping sauce for the bread. It is some sort of creamy tomato garlicky fabulousness. And the pasta with mussels is always a fave. 

I also was way impressed when we ordered a bottle of wine and our waiter told us that a cheaper one of the same variety was actually much better. Brownie points for sure. 

We will definitely be back, and with these portion sizes - the more the merrier!
author: Meagan C.

description: I miss this place because I miss good Italian food. Since moving away from CA it's one of two cuisines I miss the most. I love Caffe Sport. My family has been going there for years. It's always consistently good. There is no bad seat in the restaurant because there's always something to look at. I adore all the dishes here. Even the bread dip is amazing! My two favorite dishes I can think of off the top of my head are the pesto and the calamari. The calamari is perfectly cooked where it's not rubbery in any way and the cream sauce compliments is superbly. Remembering the dishes makes me want to fly down and take a friend to dinner there. I loved sitting in the back when I was little and watching Antonio's head peek out through the kitchen. It's such a great family atmosphere here!
author: Josie V.

description: Want to go to the best hole in the wall Italian place in the city?  Check this place out.  By far my favorite Italian rest.  If you walk by and look in you probably will just keep walking.  It doesn't look like much.  A friend insisted I try and glad I did.  The meat mushroom pasta is out of this world.  Its small, you might have to wait.  This isn't fine dining so don't expect to be pampered.  Try it, you will love it
author: T J.

description: If you're thinking about going here - go here. This is a great place for groups and first dates - there's a lot of room and a lot to look at. It's family style food, so you can try a bunch of dishes, share with your date/family, get really full and take things home. The decorations in here is enough to make you want to stay, but the service will also make you smile. If it's not totally family owned, it's close; making for a very genuine experience here. Corking fees were pretty cheap, too, so it's a win, win place!
author: Emily R.

description: The staff is the best. Antonio, Luis, and Gustavo, you guys rock! I had some delicious food that even fit my strictly paleo diet! I highly recommend this place to everyone!
author: Dan H.

description: Great vibe and good service. Food was pricey for simple meals. But they give you decent portions. And the complimentary bread and dipping sauce was great. We went five minutes before the kitchen closed, so maybe that'd why I wasn't extremely impressed. Overall it was an enjoyable meal. Not impressive so I don't think id go again.
author: Sydney S.

description:
OMG! I totally love these small restaurants that are full of character!  Had dinner last night with my dear bf and his family after watching Beach Blanket Babylon (another must see) and I fell in love with this restaurant. 

I love garlic and our dishes definitely had that. We started with the Salad.  Oooh la la! So uber yummy! Then we shared all the dishes family style - pesto pasta, steamed mussles, pasta with clams, spinach ravioli.  Everything was delicious!! Even the bread with the spicy tomato bisque type sauce.  Service was warm and friendly, too!

I'd go back in heartbeat.  Props to Christine T. for picking the restaurant last night! She always picks the good ones!
author: Dawn D.

description:
Food - 5 stars. Favorite dish - I think it's the con pesto. 

Ok, Ok. Time to be a bit more forgiving on my review of this place. 
I LOVE the food here and luckily I have not experienced the same snooty-ness and unwelcoming attitude that I encountered in my earlier review. I've been here a few more times since the original review and every time the food has always been excellent. Service has been good. But the attitude varies. All in all, my tummy wins the battle I have with this place and I must give in occasionally.
author: Nhi T.

description:
Excellent food, great service, and a wonderful atmosphere! Definitely recommend for a nice dinner with friends or a date!

I wasn't able to order it when I was there, but apparently the pesto is amazing!
author: Ernest T.

description:
A very charming gem of North Beach, this Italian Cafe has nothing to do with sports. But it does have something to do with good eatin'.

Myriad of hung artwork surrounds you on all dimensions excluding the floor. I have no clue how they're hung on the ceiling. Tables and benches are hand-carved and hand-painted. Everything is truly ornate.

Vongole is delightful with wine sauce and freshly baked bread is perfect for sopping it. Pasta arrived almost soupy. The point here isn't to be authentic. I would call it "North Beach twist" to a Sicilian cuisine. The penne is soft, shrimps plumped, beef is tender, and the sauce is a well-balanced combination of tangy tomato and creamy roux in the French style. It works so well I decided they have a winning recipe I wish I had.

The restaurant is small and reservation is suggested. We came early when tables were open, but don't always count on that.
author: Trung N.

description:
We came here with some family visiting us from Pittsburgh, PA.  They had been to Caffe Sport in the 1980s and remember it as a great meal, so while in the city we all stopped in for an early dinner.

Lord have mercy!  It was a heavenly experience!  The place is decorated wildly with colorful artwork, pottery, and tiles and it put us in the mood to relax and enjoy our time.

Our servers were fantastic - very knowledgeable and happy to share the history of the place as well as guide us in selecting the dishes and wine for the table.  Our main server and the busser were very personable, and they were very attentive and responsiv.

The food is magnificient, if you are a fan of garlic... and, thankfully, we all are!  Scampi All' Antonio, Cioppino All' Antonio, Pesto Pasta, the Green Salad, and Bread were some of the dishes we tried and they were incredible.  

Fun place to go!
author: Casey N.

description:
Caffe Sport is a bit disappointing to be honest.  They only give you 2 baskets for free bread, and then start charging for every basket after that.  I went with a relatively large group, and the bread basket should be proportionate for the size of the group.  Plus, it would've been good to have more for the sauces from the entrees.  

The main dishes come in small-ish serving sizes, not worth the price.  Also, the only pasta they seem to use is penne, regardless of what you order.  The food comes out really quick.  Suspiciously quick, which leads me to believe the food is all premade.  Furthermore, the eggplant dish we order came out tasty, but barely warm. 

On a more positive note, the decor is interesting with a lot of things to look at. Servers were also quite attentive, but in terms of food...not my favorite.
author: K C.

description:
So, I'm going to try my best to judge the quality of the food and the service, while throwing in a few caveats about my own possible mistakes.  This is the second time my group of friends made reservations here for a birthday.  The first time I couldn't go, but had to hear from all my friends about how DELICIOUS everything was.  So I was VERY excited about getting the chance to go to Caffe Sport.  I used to live in the 'hood, and Columbus Cafe is one of my fave bars to hang out and watch sports at, so finding another good spot on the block (aside from the tiny pizza joint that sells square pizza out the window) was very welcome.

Do yourself a favor, and just order the eggplant parmagiana as soon as you are seated (maybe two or three, depending on how large the group is).  Top some of the melanzane on some bread, as a proper warning to your stomach that the food will be coming out, sauced up, cheesed up, and fast!  From there, my friends and I ordered like 4 dishes at one time (all pasta) and about 10 minutes later, they all came out.  Hmm, pre-made sauce & heatlamp?  Anywho, the dishes were decent, nothing fantastic.  Pluses:
*  Cioppino in salsa rossA was good, although this really should be a soup
*  Salsa Verda was good, with a good dressing. (highly suggest getting a salad as all the dishes were a bit heavy)
*  Sopping up the remaining sauces with bread was super fun and yummy.

Negatives:
*  What was the melted cheese on the lobster shell all about?
*  Violation of the Italian cardinal rule re: parmesan on a fish pasta - Mamma would be quite disappointed (Cazzo!)
*  No  homemade pasta

Why the A-ok instead of the Meh?  It's a good place for groups, intimate atmosphere, and each dish is family style, so there's a lot of interaction. The food is decent enough to share, and the price isn't too bad.  I guess you can also go to Bocce Cafe just up the street.
author: Ria D.

description: Everything about this place was horrible. Service was bad, food worse. Wish we had gone to the pizza place down the block. Really disappointing.
author: robin l.

description:
Oh my goodness!  If you come to San Francisco, come here please.  This food is so good, that I still talk about it, and I haven't been there in a minute.  Go there please, and find out for yourself.

The food is so good, that honestly, it makes up for any lapses in the service, and I think the waiters know that!  LoL
author: Rosalina Q.

description:
Four stars if go as a group of six or more. Been here 3 times in large groups and the food is tastey with huge portions. I'm told it's not real italian food but I like it.  
Several times, I have attended with another person and for small parties of two, the food is not a bargain and, in my experience usually not well prepared;  I'm not sure why. Ton's of found stuff placed everywhere.Do not go here drunk, you will get visual overload. If you dig Kitsch, then go!!
author: Bert K.

description:
I love Caffe Sport! This is where I bring out of town folks for a great family style meal in North Beach. i also will go here with friends before a wild night on the town.
  It just feels right at home. But I had a noisy upbringing with lots of other people eating from the same plate and decorating allover the walls. 
 Cash only and parking is a real pain (it is North Beach!)
author: Emily L.

description:
4.5 Stars

Went there based off of YELP reviews, and you Yelpers didn't let us down.  A simple Italian restaurant, we liked the authentic rural Italian ambiance, our waiter, and the fantastic family-style food.    My favorite was the item at the top of the menu, a pasta with scallops and shrimp and multiple cheeses (mmm).   The calamari w/ marinara sauce was great as well.   My girlfriend and a friend of ours enjoyed the third dish, the Garlic Prawns (and man, were they ever garlicky), the best.  That was my least favorite, but each to their own.  We will defnitely go back.

They took reservations, which is a plus.   The minus: CASH ONLY
author: Marc P.

description:
This place is friggin' awesome.  Its got lots of character and the waitstaff is friendly, helpful, and funny.  Dont miss this place..make a point to go there.  Its pretty much family style, with some decent but not great wines...but the prices are low and the quality of the food is high.  
It is garlicy..so if you cant handle the garlic...dont go.  The sauce with the bread is fantastic...but go easy....you got lots more to eat.  A+++
author: Christopher C.

description:
While roaming around North Beach late at night for a restaurant, D, his friends, and I stumbled upon this joyous little place. Though the restaurant itself is a bit small, it makes up for itself in different ways. For one, the inside is simply amazing, It's lively and there are trinkets all over the place, and pictures all over the walls. The food itself was delicious. We ordered the Pasta with Eggplant, Pasta with Clams, Pasta with Meat and Mushrooms, Calamari, and Steamed Muscles. They were all delicious, even the bread and dipping sauce that was provided.

However, beware! The portions may look a bit small, but they are the right size. Additionally, if garlic is not your thing, it's best avoid this place, as not only is the restaurant decked out in garlic, but also your food. However, Caffe Sport is definitely homey, and the service is super sweet.

Hehehehe. I'm excited to go back and snap some photos.
author: Jessica H.

description:
WHAT a bunch of characters! A very Italian restaurant with great cooking and a very festive atmosphere. Every time I visit, a waiter or bartender or cook (!) says something that I will remember for weeks. I mean, in a good way.

The only downside for me is that I kick myself for not going more often.
author: David A.

description: This is a must go to spot when I'm in SF!  They start you with a spicy creamy tomato based sauce for dipping.... with homemade bread.... don't eat too much of this!  You gotta save room for the entrees!  We ordered the Eggplant Parmesan and the Scampi.  Everything was SO damn good especially the Scampi which is just savory and tasty with huge pieces of shrimp.  I  told them I had food allergies to find out the ingredients for the sauce hehe.
author: Joyce T.

description:
Great authentic Italian food.  Had ciopinni, clam in garlic butter sauce, fish with steamed zuccini, and a few of their pasta dishes.  Delish!

You will be devouring bread and dipping sauce before your meal.  

Eccentric decor, perfect for the hole in the wall spot atmosphere.

Parking is a little horrible tho. Overall great spot for Italian cravings.
author: kate b.

description: The last time I was here was probably in 1999...it's nice to see and taste that nothing has changed. Although people may disagree, I use the food here as a benchmark to compare pastas and other Italian food...a bit pricey but your tatse buds will thank you. The Pesto pasta, shrimp sampii...are the bomb.
author: Orlando J.

description: Cafe Sport is THE BEST Italian food in SF. So amazing! In North Beach there are of course several places to go and a place called "Cafe Sport" would not immediately attract my attention if I'm looking for food. However- The atmosphere is great filled with a lot of history thru the family who has owned it. The menu does not have millions of options like other places but what they do have they make really really well. Highly recommend going with a group and trying a red, green and white sauce. You will not be disappointed.
author: Michelle B.

description:
Ergh when pasta comes out faster than pho something is wrong. Especially when there's a ton of seafood  Comments from the table weren't all that positive from the 8 dishes we ordered.

Perhaps the place works as a last ditch quick eat for lunch, but given the number of better options in the neighborhood I'd recommend going someplace else.
author: Stephen W.

description:
My co-workers and I will occasionally go here for lunch to indulge in rich Italian pasta.  We consider it a treat and always find ourselves satisfied (except we come back to the office with super duper garlic breath.  Ha! ) 

They serve you bread with this tomato-anchovy dipping sauce.  I believe it's anchovies?? At least that what I recall the waiter told me.  Somebody correct me if I'm wrong!  I know it sounds kinda gross right?  But not at all, it tastes really good.  The anchovies must be blended very finely with the tomato sauce that you don't taste any anchovies and we eat enough of it that by the time the food comes, we're kind of full already.  We always get the pesto pasta (to die for!)....but beware it is very rich!  By far this is the best pesto I've tasted.  Items that I've tried is the calamari salad, rustica (seafood pasta) and the prawns with cream sauce.   All very good and very tasty.  From what I recall, they are open for lunch on Fridays only, so that's we hit the place.   

It's a fun little place to go to and the waiters are ummm a little flirty with the females, but I guess that's how Italian men behave..hahaha
author: Lucky M.

description:
I can't believe someone would say Bucca is better!!    Bucca is vile "ketchup and egg noddles". I  may be sentimental, I came here for my High School Graduation dinner (and I'm in my lateish 40'ies), but the food IS good.  I love the Shrimp Scampi, soooo lemony and garlicky!  The pasta with eggplant is great too.   Haven't ordered a lot of variety, I don't go often, and tend to stick with my favorites.  

If you want good, hardy, Southern Italian, its the place to go.  More delicate, sophisticated Northern Italian is a totally different ballgame.  Definitely the best Southern Italian in North Beach!
author: Erin C.

description:
Hold it. Have you had your Italian food cravings fulfilled today? 

If not, stop by 'Caffe Sport' for some delicious Italian pasta that'll make your senses go numb (in a good way)! 

This is truly one of the best places for pasta in San Francisco! The interior is insane, with artsy & crafty things hanging on top the ceiling to paintings hung throughout the restaurant. Though I wouldn't categorize all the dishes on their menu as "authentic," the flavors are still fantastically mouth-watering and will make you wanting to swim in their amazing pasta sauces! 

I had the Pasta Rustica with Shrimp and it was just soooo good! With yummy little shrimp pieces and a kick-arse tomato sauce, it was an awesome meal! The portions are also really huge here, so prepare yourself for some take home!  I also got to sample some beef pasta and it was also just as yummy! 

Do note that 'Caffe Sport' does get busy in the evenings, so either make a reservation first OR drop by for an early dinner before 6pm. You'll be more likely to find a table then.
author: Melinda L.

description:
My wife and I stopped here this evening because the place we were going to was closed. Serendipity was very kind to us this evening.
 
I had the sole my wife had the eggplant parmesan and the tiramisu. All the grub and the wine were excellent. The service was attentive and knowledgable.
author: Thomas M.

description:
Before heading here, I made sure to stop at the nearby Bank of America to take out cash for my dinner. But when I went in, I saw on the menu that they accept credit cards now! My life is complete! 

OK, enough hyperbole. You're hear to read about food, right? Service begins bread and delightful, spicy tomato sauce. Ask for the wines by the glass that they're offering that evening--usually it's a pretty small selection, though. Then, order the house salad to share--it's loaded with yummyness like fresh green olives and is only $7. 

On my most recent visit, I ordered the shrimp scampi, pesto and eggplant parm for my out-of-state tourist parents. As I was ordering, they said "But we just ate at the Wharf--there is no way we can eat all of that. We'll have to take it home." I smiled indulgently, knowing that they'd eat it all. Not a bite was left at the end.

Food here is served family style, so be sure to bring a big group and share everything. Yum yum yum!
author: Gina D.

description:
Decent Italian food in North Beach -yes it is.  Charming - sure.

Something changed over the past year and I am just not sure what it is....after a recent visit I left feeling less than satiated.

Perhaps it was the fact that we ordered some mussels yet received clams - when we brought this to our waiter's attention he said we are all out of mussels.  Really?  So ....hmmmm -maybe it was just too much effort to tell us that from the get go.  Maybe he thought we would never notice?

Regardless, the food is decent ....but I wouldn't go so far to say excellent -not anymore.  I may have a change of heart if the hot pasta is no longer served on plastic dishes.
author: Molly M.

description: Loved it from the start to finish.  Bread dip with a little kick was awesome. Salad was fresh with perfect dressing.  Pasta with shrimp was incredible.  Nice walk back to the wharf helped ease the more than ample dinner.
author: Jim C.

description: Best italian restaurant in the US. Period. Antonio passed away but his son runs the place now. Been going there since '87. As good as always. That pesto dish should be bronzed. Anything ala Antonio is pure magic. Peace.
author: Tom M.

description: Yuki K. Has it right. Totally reminds me of Howl's moving castle... This place is great. Unless you're some D bag tool that NEEDS to find shit to bitch about on yelp. They got some Italian beer that's pretty good if you're into that. Prolly got wine too, but I don't drink the stuff... All in all it's a good place to go with friends, if you actually like them. Best Italian restaurant in S.F. for sure. Not going into specifics, I'm not a fan of  Italian food. This stuff is a-ok in my book though.
author: Arturo R.

description:
This is my first Yelp review, and the whole reason I decided to even start an account was the amazing dinner I had at Caffe Sport this evening. 

The red sauce they serve you before the meal is the tastiest thing I've ever had!!! Even if they didn't serve anything other than that sauce I would still go back to this restaurant. I also tasted the pasta with pesto and the pasta with eggplant; both super tasty and served family style on big dishes so it's easy to share.

On top of the great food, the artwork on the walls and ceiling is really interesting and charming, there's just a million details to look at. AND the service was good! Our waiter was attentive and funny; he took the time to chat with us enough to make us feel very welcome, but he was also effective and brought us everything we asked for quickly. 

All in all this was the best dinner out I've had in a long time. (and I'm still full because I couldn't stop eating the bread and sauce.) 
I will definitely be coming back to Caffe Sport soon!
author: Thea T.

description: This is my favorite Italian restaurant. The pastas are amazing and the bread dipping sauce is to die for. The staff is so friendly and the vibe is just unbelievable. You feel like you are in Italy when you are there. It's a perfect spot for a romantic date or a small family gathering!
author: Natasha G.

description:
Another San Francisco institution. Thick creamy sauces upon mountains of pasta- all served family style. Is it the most authentic Italian in the city? No way! Is it tasty? Indeed it is! The Rustica all' Antonio- 4 cheese pasta in a creamy tomato sauce with shrimp is delicious. Their pesto with mussels is also great.

I see a lot of bad reviews about the service. The service I've received there is always fairly fast and friendly. Granted my family has been friends with the owner for 30 years though.
author: David D.

description: Went while in San Francisco for a girls weekend. Loved the dipping sauce and the family style service. We loved the pesto sauce! Service was great, wine list small but well chosen. And best yet, very reasonable for a great meal in a pricey town.
author: Pam R.

description:
We enjoyed a wonderful meal here... the House salad was better than I expected with olives, peppers and cheese over Romaine lettuce and tossed with a homemade dressing.  The calamari salad was equally as good.  Tender morsels of fresh calamari in that same dressing.  The Rustica pasta was topped with a simple tomato basil sauce and complemented with four cheeses that blew our socks off.  And their steamed shellfish dish was simply fresh and garlicky.  Our waiter Gustavo was great.  He made these great menu recommendations and was friendly and attentive.

Bravo, Caffe Sport!
author: Carol H.

description: Great atmosphere and service.  Salad, bread and dipping sauce were fantastic.  Had pesto with gnocchi which was very good.  We also had the scampi a la Antonio which was pretty good but came out cold and the shrimp was overdone.  Would definitely come back!
author: Scott A.

description:
I love this place. The peole are friendly, it's a total Italian place, only men working there. They kiss on the ladies and flirt with the men. The food is great, served family style. They tell you if you are ordering too much since it's not your normal Italian restaurant; really you can split a plate and have left overs. I love the spaghetti, boring... NO. It's yum. The wine they have, house red you can get a carafe or half.. so cheap. Dinner for two you can leave full and have lunch the next day for under $50 including tip.
They do take reservations, and I recommend calling ahead since they fill up fast, there is always a wait. I always use my Italian alias, they like.. they even favor your table a little more.
author: Jess P.

description:
I'm not sure if this place was over-hyped for me between a coworker and all the yelpers, but I thought it was...good/okay.  I was totally excited about the orange sauce after yelpers raved about it, only to taste the first bite and and look at my friend to see if they agree...is it just me or does the sauce taste like indian/pakistani chicken tikka masala gravy with a little more tomato sauce? Being pakistani myself, the taste was a bit too familiar, so I wasn't as crazy about the sauce as everyone else...but it was definitely an interesting addition to the table bread :)

I order the Rustica Al Antonio, which was penne pasta in a white cream sauce with the same orange sauce that accompanied the bread on it.  It also had shrimp and scallops (which I'll be honest, were a bit....frugal in portion).  It tasted good, it was fresh.. however I didn't feel like it was restaurant quality or too different from something I could whip up at home.  Nevertheless, it was still good.  I'm still willing to give the place another chance, possibly trying the pesto pasta tonight.  Before I completely rule away the place, I think I'll need to try a couple other pastas there...

I'll update if I try anything spectacular... if nothing else, give it a chance and try it out.  Oh and the portions ARE a good size! Great for family style since you can try a variety of food and it'll be cheap!
author: Shafaq C.

description: Excellent food served with a masculine heart. Awesome as always. Unique interior design. Lots of italy on the walls......
author: Pinky F.

description:
My fellow Yelpers you lead me astray.  I was very hopeful but this is not good Italian food.  How could you even say that?  I have learned that not only do I have to take into consideration all reviews for a place but when someone gives 5 stars I should investigate the types of eating establishments they have been going to.  That is a tell all! 

This place just needs to close it's doors.  You call that an antipasto?  No meatballs on the menu?  Shrimp scampi that may as well be frozen from Trader Joes.  Terrible place!  I don't understand why they get 4 stars.  Really people think twice before you enter.  The only reason I can think that this place gets high marks is because the location.  I envision a bunch of drunk out of towners or drunk Marina people loud and obnoxious eating crap!  

You can keep it over in North Beach but a better location would be out of business.
author: Scott P.

description:
First Italian restaurant that came up on Yelp when we were searching for a place in NoBe before heading to Cobb's.  They were gracious and took our lardy tardies in stride.

We ordered six dishes to share amongst eight people (because the waiter definitely shook his head when we only wanted five).

+ Rustica all' Antonio with four cheeses, shrimps and scallops.  The shrimp and scallop were fresh and mighty tasty.
