+ Petrale Sole baked with garlic, butter, lemon and olive oil.  My only complate is that the portion could stand to be bigger, and they could give more veggies.
+ Vongole Al Vapore - steamed clams in garlic, lemon and white wine sauce.  Best dish of the night.  Also first dish to disappear.
+ Cioppino All' Antonio - seafood stew in a white garlic sauce.

Con carne e funghi with meat and mushrooms.  I had high expectations for this dish, but it was very so-so.  Ragu could have made this better.

- Con Pesto with basil, garlic, and parmesan cheese sauce.  But maybe because I'm not a big pesto fan.

The bread sauce was really, really good.  They need to give us more.  More!
author: Jenny L.

description: They have the best seafood stew! Its fresh and and good quality seafood. I have been here a few times, it gradually gets better and better each time I visit.
author: Jamie C.

description: I would love to say that my experience here stacked up to the hype.  I loved the ambiance and the staff was attentive and friendly.  The food, though good, wasn't quite the mouthful of Italian amazing I was expecting.  I even had the pesto that everyone raves about and found it a bit bland.  Maybe I went on an off night?
author: Liss D.

description:
A solid spot... if you like Italian seafood, this is your place. Everything we ordered was good, the restaurant itself has a ton of charm and the service is good. 

Cash only...
author: Blake W.

description: My sister introduced me to Caffe Sport 20 years ago when I was a teenager. It ruined all Italian food for me. Nothing since has measured to the standard of quality. It has become a must stop destination for anyone in my family. The pesto is heavenly.
author: Big B.

description: Great decor and service is good - friendly and helpful staff. I had the cioppino and thus I received a big plate full of good seafood (there was everything, including crab), the sauce was watery and tasteless practically see people are praising the pasta, have tried out one several years ago and I remember it was good (that is why I decided to return) but the cioppino was disappointing....
author: VIORICA C.

description: Cute, kitschy place. My sister picked this place out, as she had a friend recommend it, and they wanted to eat in North beach. Our table wasn't quite ready, so the waiter told us to go have a drink next door & he'd let us know when it was. And sure enough, he actually walked over to the bar next door, told us when it was ready & even brought our glasses back for us, so we could finish our drink in the restaurant - nice. The food is family style & large portions so definately a share place. I thought the food was pretty good. Not the most outstanding flavors, but very fresh and it was reasonably priced. We had the crab filled ravioli's , the house salad, the red sauce ciopinot & an eggplant appetizer. All were very tasty. I would say its one of the better italian restaurants in NB for the price, & quainter than a touristy place like Stinking Rose & about on par with Francino's. The funky decor makes the place.
author: Jen S.

description:
what a weird name for this little place.  we didnt quite know what to expect at a place with sport in the name but upon entering it really has an eclectic feel.  the walls and ceiling are adorned with trinkets.  we were seated in a pretty cramped area for our sicilian meal but the food here is pretty awesome.  

we chose the burgundy wine which he let us taste.  when we tasted it, it was sweet.  when drinking it with food, it was a little harsher.

they serve their bread with a spicy sundried tomato bisque sauce thing.  a little weird but very appropriate since you dont have to use a knife to spread it on the bread.  just dip.  very yummy.  we ordered everything family stype and it all came out really quickly.  a salad -romaine with olives and tomatoes.  the dressing was a caesar style with a lot of horseradish which made it very spicy.  we then had a shrimp scampi and also just a Pizzaiola pasta(with fresh tomatoes, garlic, and basil).  the shrimp were very good.  fresh and perfectly cooked.  i guess i wasnt too familiar with scampi but it was a very thick cream sauce on top.  lots of zuchinni underneath.  the pasta was perfectly cooked.  sooooo good. tiramisu was excellent

i would definitely come back. probably not on a night when i have to go out after and talk to people because of stinky garlic breath.  gum does not help
author: claudia y.

description:
My mind boggles that this place receives so many positive reviews. The food reminded me mostly of cafeteria food. It was uninspired and, really, throwing a mass of garlic and cream on penne (their ONLY pasta type) does not make a good dish. 

I guess if you're not one for fancy pants Italian restaurants but still want to be a big spender, go here! Also if you want some food that reminds you of your first experience with pasta sauce and the microwave you may like this place. My waiter was really clueless too.... ugh I could go on for too long.

Also, 8 dollars for a glass of that wine served in a water glass??? I wouldn't be posting a review like this if I didn't feel so ripped off. Is this place trying to be a dive bar of restaurants? If so they need to slash their prices at least in half.

p.s. I went home and breathed my garlic breath on my cat and she tried to claw me.
author: Adam B.

description: This restaurant reminds me of a cramped version of Buca Di Beppo with its gaudy decorations.  I felt like I was going to plan a Mafia style hit but decided to have something good to eat and I did!!  The price of the seafood is above average.  I am very critical of seafood dishes around the $25 range per plate.    In this case I was very pleased with what was in front of me.  The shrimp scampi had large prawns that took more than half the plate along with tender vegetables.  The prawns were cooked right which also had a cold sauce on top.  This was rich and delicious.  The calamari dish with the red sauce was awesome as well.  The squid wasn't at all tough and the pasta was cooked al dente.  I hate mushy pasta which really pisses me off.  The family style portions make up for the price tag.  Come over with a group of people and come hungry.  Finally, try the tiramisu, it has just the right amount of liquor to top off your meal.  You won't regret spending the money.  This made my trip to SF memorable!!   :o)
author: Anthony R.

description: Caffe Sport to me has lost its soul. Never a good sign when there is no Italian working in the place. I've been coming once a year or so since the late 70's and I've never had anything but a great family style Sicilian meal until this summer of 2014. Maybe the owners are in Italy who knows or maybe they sold out. But for me the meal I had was drab & dull.  Sad for me because I'm a Sicilian American and I really looked forward to my visits here. On the bright side the waiters were very nice.
author: Joseph P.

description:
I was going to give this place one star...but I added one for the atmosphere and service. The server wasn't out of this world, but meh...it was good enough for an extra star.

YELPERS, C'Mon!! This place should not be getting 4 stars for food...I've had MUCH MUCH MUCH better Italian food. The bread that came out was dry and cold, the dipping sauce was also cold and gross, and the food was super greasy! I mean, I understand Italian is not the healthiest food out there, but my pasta was drenched in oil. No Bueno!!

The menu doesn't really describe exactly what you're getting. We ordered the pasta with meat and mushrooms. I figured it would be sae to get a standard meatsauce...I was wrong. It was covered in a layer or cheese and there were 2 slivers of mushrooms that were visible. I am visiting the city expecting great food in North Beach and kind of bummed we came here. Hopefully, the next place won't be so bad.
author: Tram P.

description: My family, coming from Florida, Illinois, and Southern California, decided to make dinner reservations here for our a weekend family reunion dinner. The reservation was made weeks in advance and was confirmed up to the night before.  When our party arrived, we were informed that due to a black-out we needed to make reservations elsewhere. Okay, I get it... $*&t happens but we would have expected at least a phone call in advance informing us of the situation. We were left trying to decide what to do next and where to make reservations in such short notice to accommodate the number of people.  Luckily, someone in our party is from San Francisco and through her quick thinking she was able to make reservations at Caps Corner (Nice place, btw...look for my excellent review on this one).  Bottom  line.... we should have been notified by phone sooner by management instead of being left out on the street without a paddle.  Will I give it another chance ? maybe not...first impressions matter. I wasn't impressed.
author: Tony G.

description: I work just a few stores away from Cafe Sport, yet had not eaten there... until last night.  The food was amazing!  All of the sauces ware fresh, creamy rich, and garlic filled, just how I like them, and the waiters were some of the most polite people I've encountered so far, explaining the dishes and filling us in on the history of the restaurant, and all of the hand carved furniture.  On top of having great service and amazing food, it was delivered to our table in under five minutes and was more than affordable.  I will certainly be back!
author: Deanna W.

description: Yum yum yum! I loved their food! We ordered the penne pasta with beef and lots of cheese I must say for the most simplest pasta that was the most flavored pasta dish I've ever had ! Now for the extra extra good stuff... We also ordered white sauce cioppino :) omg!! Sooo efffing delish! it looks plain and simple, but the dish was epic!! I savored that lemony garlic white sauce it was great!! I shall return, I shall return and the location is great because there is a gelato gem next door :)
author: April m.

description: Awesome family restaurant with amazing garlic dishes, salads, bread and dipping sauce. I love the waiters too since their all very friendly and personal. The location is awesome too and on a Friday night dinner here is amazing with a walk around North Beach afterwards. :) LOVE IT!
author: Pascale D.

description: This place is great!  It's a quirky, cozy Italian place with great food, large portions, and good service.  It's a tad garlicky so make sure that's ok with you.  The cioppino blanco was excellent and the seafood was unbelievably fresh.  The caponata was amazing.   We will definitely be back!
author: Becky T.

description: Always a great meal but they out-did themselves this last visit! We had the seafood stew and prawns in garlic sauce with zucchini. The service was outstanding and the atmosphere charming.
author: Carrie F.

description:
Tourist-centric, over-the-top, fun, good, and slightly expensive,  Caffe Sport is the quintessential  North Beach Italian restaurant, a remnant of the day when North Beach restaurants were more about families and groups boisterously enjoying themselves then couples seeking a predictable and low-cost romantic atmosphere. 

I though the wildly over-done nautical theme was charming and thoroughly enjoyed  my  heart attack on a plate (uh, I mean four cheese shrimp and scallops pasta) as my lovely wife did her Ciopinni in fresh tomatoes. And I can say with confidence we both enjoyed the Tiramisu we split.  The food showed  no hint of culinary genus but it was quickly served and very satisfying, as it should have been for  about thirty dollars a person (with tip). I must admit a twinge of pride in noting that just about every table around me was speaking a different language but all were enjoying our city.  

A special note to the Spanish speaking table to my right, the guys hitting on my wife when I went to the bathroom: Nice try and I don't blame you, she's hot.  But North Beach is Master Pick Up Artist territory. I'd polish my game a little before chasing the high value targets if I were you.
author: Bill S.

description: The ambiance is very cool and unique. The service is good to excellent, depending on who's helping you. The food was very average and it's a bit misleading that they say they serve "family style." The dishes aren't that big. Each plate will serve 1-2 people, depending their appetite.
author: Paul O.

description:
One of my best gastronomic experiences ever.
I have to thank my friends for taking me there.
We need one of these back in Boston.
Amazing.
author: george k.

description:
When I was a kid growing up and got to choose where to go on my birthday, this is where I always chose, and it continues to be my favorite Italian food and place to take (certain deserving!) out of towners for dinner.  The bread is weak, but the sauces are phenomenal, just so flavorful and authentic, very fresh, tomatoey and garlicky.  I've been incredulous to hear some people comment that they prefer other places, like Sodini's further up the block on Green or North Beach Restaurant on Stockton, and I've been to these and others just to verify --- there is no comparison, or as they say in Spanish, NADA QUE VER! One of those friends is British, so maybe that explains it, but why does it seem like "good taste" is sometimes so elusive to people's palettes???  If there's a better place, I definitely want to know about it! 

It's more kitsch than romantic, with wacky and colorful trinkets, hams, fishing nets, and other doodads all over the walls and each booth looks like it was decorated by pre-schoolers with access to a paint set, a garage sale, and a glue gun. The joking, good natured, casual, energetic, attentive waiters will sit down at your table, flirt with your date and, it's true, they'll sometimes even tell you what to order, but you don't regret it!  They used to try to seat you with strangers when it was crowded, but have backed off on that -- thankfully, 'cause that can be a very hit-or-miss affair!  But it's brimming with unique character. 

There's one Italian waiter left, but most of the staff is from El Salvador and Guatemala, and when the Sicilian owner Tony La Tona passed away a couple of years ago, the Guatemalan assistant of 17 years took over in the kitchen. Tony never shared his recipes with ANYone, not even the other chefs, but after 17 years they got the gist, and it's still an exquisite gustatory experience. One time there we ran into the soccer star El Magico --- the Pele of El Salvador --- and he was humble, chatty and said he eats there every time he comes to SF.

I recommend the eggplant parmesan and the calamari Ala' Antonio (in garlic white sauce). Plates are generous and about $15 bucks, which I consider very reasonable for what you get, almost always enough for tomorrow's lunch or dinner too. Tony's archetypal Sicilian wife (who's lived here forever but still doesn't speak much English) and rotund son are still there many nights and will enjoy your comments and feedback.
author: David H.

description:
A while back, a small posse of 5 of us went here for someone's birthday, ordered family style and had a good time trying everything. It was good. One of the sauces had a flavor that was strangely familiar, yet hard to pinpoint. Suddenly, someone nailed it-Miracle Whip! 

After that, the $$$bill seemed a bit high.
author: Andy R.

description:
I haven't been here for at least 20 years.  We wanted to indulge in lots of flavors before starting our diet.  We arrived shortly after 5:30PM on Sunday evening, no customers, yet.

Ordered family style; pasta with four cheese and scallop/shrimp, and scampi with vegetables (asparagus).  Lots of garlic, plenty tasty.  Service was polite and attentive.

It was great getting reacquainted with Caffe Sport.  We'll be sure to bring friends.
author: Collin W.

description:
LOVE this place!  the eggplant dish, the garlic shrimp and the pesto pasta are my favorites!   
We are usually a group of 8 but have had up to 16 so we order family style.
author: Lisa E.

description:
But I don't even like Italian food!   I do like me some Caffe Sport.  The decor is noisy -- funky (weirdo meets eclectic and they get wasted).

I can't stand pretentious Italian joints.  Really, hold the snooty.  Caffe Sport doesn't serve an ounce of snooty with their savory dishes.  The mussels were orgasmic.  I thought about swallowing the mussel shells whole because the sauce was so divine and garlic-ky and I just couldn't get enough.  The calamari came unfried in a red sauce (awesome for those who are wheat-allergic).  

The prices are pretty thrifty for Italian food in North Beach.  I'm not saying it was cheap, the price just didn't hurt my soul.  They serve it up family style with large portions!  

Great for groups of noisy people.  Bring your friends and do it family style.  The entertainment is the wall decor and all the fun peeps.
author: Ani P.

description:
Here's the thing about Italian cooking that people forget:  It's NOT about fusion, foams, mousses, etc. It is about the BEST ingredients being put to use in a relatively simple arrangement.  It can be pretty, but you can probably look at a dish and be able to tell what most of the ingredients are.

This is what Caffe Sport does well.  They have a fairly basic menu. They serve food either by individual plates or family style.  The place has a bunch of old pictures and old stuff tacked to the wall.  I'm not a huge fan of the knick knack style of decorating, but I am a fan of the food.  It's not supposed to be fancy.  It's supposed to be good.

My last visit was in a party of 16.  We had kids, adults, grandparents, the whole thing.  There were soft drinks, beers, glasses of wine, etc.  It was a great time for everyone.  The pasta was great.  The mussels were tasty.    Great family food.

Er, um, the dipping sauce is definitely very tasty.
author: Nelson W.

description:
Reasons I can think of to go back:

If I was high and I wanted to trip out for hours looking at all the crap on the walls

If I was a pyro and I wanted to see all those tczotchkes go up in flames

If I was high and I couldnt taste what I was eating

If I wanted to lose 5 lbs from getting food poisoning

If I wanted to repel strippers with my garlic stench

If I was high and lost

If I liked my eggplant marinated in, boiled in, baked in, and inspired by oil

If I was high and decided I wanted to marry an old loud hairy italian man

If I wanted cream sauce, and by cream sauce I mean mayonnaise that tastes like foot
author: Miss K.

description:
Went to Cafe sport on a recommendation from a friend - found the food to be pretty good, but not as good as some of the other restaurants in the North Beach area.  Went on a Thursday night - no crowds and no wait.  Service was good & fast, but food was rather bland.  I had the pasta with shrimp and scallops... 
If you are looking for a quick decent meal in a very casual environment this isn't a bad place.  If you are looking for better food, and a nicer environment I'd pick another spot.
author: Pete D.

description: Love this place and the awesome pasta plates they can come up with. Been coming here sporatically for years, and always get some kind of seafood pasta(cannot remember a specific plate right now). Not sure if this is a tourist place or more for locals...
author: Jim B.

description: People who give this restaurant a poor review just don't get it. This is a whimsical gregarious family style gastronomic experience that has stood the test of time. I defy you to tell me where you can get better pesto pasta or garlic infused seafood pasta. The salad and the dipping sauce for the bread is sublime also. I am delighted every time I go in there and have the pleasure of missing the wannabes who will never learn to appreciate authenticity because they are too busy chasing trends.
author: bruce t.

description:
I haven't left a restaurant with such a confidence boost in a long time. The wait staff and owner were not shy with the compliments and affection, but it was genuine and very old skool Italian of them. Loved the creamy sauces and the fresh seafood dishes.  Great family style restaurant!

I had a great birthday song that included tiramasu and kisses on the hand and cheek. I loved it!
author: Sherry C.

description: Love this place!  Pesto is insanely good, ambiance cannot be beat - it feels like my idealized Italian home.
author: Mary Jo M.

description:
italian family dinner restaurant to the rescue.

the decor here is utter chaos, the place feels like it's seen a fair share of sf history.

the food is solid, my favorite were the clams and the 4cheese pasta.  great for groups but towards the end of the meal i was ready to get some fresh air as the place felt a bit stuffy.
author: Ameer N.

description:
A very tasty pesto, adorable Italian service, and a very fun, beauitful interior. This is a good spot to get filling food with comfortable, interesting atmosphere. 

Cash only and family style -- these guys are old school (accents and all--even grabbed my hand and kissed it when I asked if they had a table). They quickly accommodated our party of 8 at 9PM-ish on a Saturday night. I would definitely go back and recommend this for anyone wanting to try some good Italian when they are hanging out in the area.
author: Catt G.

description:
Tourist trap. I went here to humor a friend who loves this place and didn't have high expectations. Knowing I probably missed their heyday by 10 or more years, I was expecting to drop $40 and be disappointed. 

A quirky atmosphere and the cool benches were interesting. The service was fine but the food was truly disappointing. 

The bread was stale and had no taste unless you doused it in the spicy dipping sauce. The $20 Petrale Sole was overdone, smothered in garlic sauce and placed atop a bed of bitter zucchini. My sweetheart splurged on lobster and.. surprise- it was tasteless and bathed in sauce too. 

This city is full of wonderful restaurants, so there really is no reason to bother eating at  this place. 

I recommend simply taking a peak inside to satisfy your curiosity about the decor instead of paying to eat there.
author: katt a.

description:
People ask me, "You live in  North Beach, where is the best Italian food?" Caffe Sport. HANDS DOWN. Simple ingredients prepared perfectly. Every dish is amazing. Friendly efficient service (plates come out in minutes!), huge family style platters, and great food make for a wonderful North Beach experience. It can be a little touristy in the summer, but hey, I say it's popular for a reason. Go on a weeknight in the winter, and feel like a local who knows whats up. You will thank me. Just bring plenty of cash.

I only wish I had a magic faucet in my house that poured out the dipping sauce they have for bread. It is one of the most amazingly delicious condiments I've ever tasted.
author: Ben R.

description:
I was tasked to pick a restaurant in North Beach for 5 people, I turned to Yelp and decided to try Caffe Sport based on reviews. I wasn't disappointed. 3 of our party were European and they absolutely loved it, and we were told the pasta was very authentic, coz they weren't overcooked like most restaurants out here... Our lobster pasta was delicious! We also ordered 3 other seafood dishes and they were all amazingly good. With a bottle of wine the bill ended up to be no more than $120, for 5 people that is more than reasonable. I will def eat here again...

oh I forgot, they are cash only, so if you're like me who usually only carry your amex and very little cash, make sure you hit the ATM before you go there. :)
author: Andrew N.

description:
Me: What is a good place for dinner tonight?
Bartender: Sodini's
Me: We wanted seafood
Bartender (orgasmically): Caffe Sport is soooooo good

done and done.
author: Rachel O.

description: Been coming here off and on  for  over 30 yrs. Went last night to celebrate my son's big day! Food is wonderful, waiters are up beat and friendly, fun ( not snotty). Had gnocchi and Sicilian meatballs.... Swear the best I have had in a long time!!! Skip the latest trendy ones and stay with what I like!
author: Madeleine J.

description: Took a large skeptical group of 11 here. Ordered family style Pasta Pesto, Pasta Met., Sole, Scampi, salad and veggie sides. They are all fans. The eggplant (pasta Met) is my favorite and has a spectacular flavor. Pasta was cooked to perfection. Raves about the Scampi and Sole. Dinner total was only $22.25 pp with 20% tip (not counting wine) and we still had some leftovers. Place is eclectic with an old Italian vibe. Casual, friendly, delicious and fun! Best if you at least have a group of 4 (or want to take lots of food home). I love this place!
author: Jules T.

description:
Went in with a large group on a Friday night. First off the bread was stale, how hard is it to provide fresh bread at an Italian restaurant? If I can go into safeway and buy something half decent for 3 bucks, they shouldn't have much trouble.
We ordered about 6 dishes and most were pretty good, but for the price, the portions were pretty small. The sole was really well cooked, but the pasta dishes were just so-so. They came out with our dishes very quickly, as if the sauces were all sitting around in the back. 

The decor is really cool, but not good enough to make me want to go back.
author: Jonathan S.

description:
Well what do you know, it's a family style Italian restaurant and not a sports bar. I went here with some friends on friday night and got a table for the 3 of us pretty easily, I think it was pretty early evening, it certainly got busier later. 

Overall the atmos, decor and food in general is very good and everything you would expect from a family style Italian restaurant. It's great value and a salad and two pasta dishes will probably feed four people. I'm afraid I had to knock off a couple of stars for this particular evening due to the bread being stale (I hate that), and the sole (fish) being a bit more fishy  and not quite as fresh as I would like. Personally i think if you stick with the pasta dishes and avoid the fish you'll be alright. I am certainly going back here again as I get the feeling that as you get to know the menu the better things get. Service was great, oh, and they only take cash.
author: Karl L.

description:
I am not a tourist.  I do not usually enjoy tourist destinations or tourist prices.  This may be why I was amazed to walk through North Beach on a Saturday night and happily decide to eat at one of the seemingly hundreds of cheesy Italian restaurants.

I was pleasantly surprised by both the quality and the the atmosphere.  The family style servings were a fun treat for my party of six - it was a little difficult to manage the many different dietary needs- one wheat allergy, one seafood allergy and a vegetarian.  (What the hell does that leave you at an Italian restaurant?!)

The meat dish - cheesy and delicious.

The sauted calamari was covered with a simple marinara sauce - almost like I can make at home.  So simple, but utterly yum!

I save the best for last  - the mussels were fantastic - who can deny  mussels covered with some concoction of garlic / butter / olive oil / cheese?

I left feeling full, but not overly stuffed and terribly pleased at the reasonable price we all paid.
author: Krissy M.

description:
My old boss introduced me to this place one year when we had our company Christmas party there.  Mind you our company only consisted of he and I and our party included our dates.

Family style Italian food!!!  Everything is heavy on the garlic!!  Love it!

If you aren't familiar or aren't sure the staff will help you pick out food.  They also will tell you if you have enough for the number of people in your party.  I always tend to over order but they are quick to tell me so.

My absolute all time favorite dishes are the shrimp scampi which are huge prawns with this creamy super garlicky sauce.  There is also a vegetable served with it but I can't remember what that was I just remember that it was green.  Also they have a pasta with a red sauce that has seafood in it as well.

The staff are charming (sometimes hard to understand) and the atmosphere is eclectic.

They do take reservations.  the only thing that kinda sucks is they only take cash.

I was on a date here and some how they got the impression that my date was an Oakland Raider (he's a big dude and he had on an authentic raiders jersey) .  Because we didn't understand everything they were saying, when they asked questions we thought they were talking to us in general about football.  They paid a lot of attention to us and would kinda linger and chat.  Toward the end of the night we had finally figured out why they were giving us so much attention.  When we left they asked him for an autograph and he signed the name of some guy that had just signed for the raiders.  He didn't want to disappoint them after all that.  I kinda felt bad but it was very entertaining.
author: Shelley S.

description:
Bring CASH!!  and make a reservation.

Fast, friendly service.  This please is unique in it's decor and limited menu, but the food is fantastic.   We were there last Saturday (for about our 6th visit)  and  four people ordered 2-orders steamed clams (because I can eat one by myself no problem) 1 - Pasta dish 1 - Calamari dish.  We were all hungry and there was just enough food.  Family style yes, but you devour every bite!  After dinner take a hike over to Coit Tower to work off the meal and for the views...you won't be sorry :-)
author: Caryn L.

description:
Feeling annoyed by those that perpetuate "class struggle", I decided that dinner in North Beach was in order.  A friend read several reviews of restaurants that she found on citysearch.com and we decided to check out the crowds at each of them.  The deciding factor would be overall wait time.  

Caffe Sport was our third stop.  While there was a long line, I didn't see a host, so I pushed through the crowd and ventured to the back.  I stopped a server and asked how one goes about achieving a table.  He looked around and pointed to a table.  Victory! - It was now ours.  I still don't understand if this is correct protocol, but I had a warrant, and I was serving it.  

They serve large glasses of wine, large portions of pasta, and large salads.  The two of us split a salad and ordered pasta and clams (YAY!), and pasta marinara (BOO!).  One would have been plenty for two, considering the amount of cheese, cream and pasta.  

It is comfort food, and doesn't turn out better than homemade.  However, it was very reasonably priced considering the number of clams in my dish.  The decor was entertaining and the staff speak to each other in Italian.  I was very satisfied with the wait for a Saturday night, but I do think I skipped in front of a few parties amid my confusion.  

I will go back.
author: JR A.

description: I lived in SF from 1987-1999. Granted, I haven't eaten here in many years, but I still have wet dreams thinking about their "Scampi All'Antionio" (which was $16.50 some eight years ago, it's now $23.00 and probably still well worth it. Best Italian food I know of in the city. Decor is funky-fresh-cool. Service can be a bit hectic, but it's what you have to put up with if you want the best. Somewhat like I imagine being married to super model must be like.
author: Jeffrey S.

description:
my Pop told me about his visit to this place years ago...
in his story, there was a crowd outside, waiting to be seated, and the owner came out, and selected the heads who he decided were lucky enough to dine in the joint.
Pop was asking questions about the menu, and the owner (also the waiter), grabbed the menu, saying, "I don't have time for this; I'll bring you something good."
and it was great.

so we hit the spot on a Tuesday evening.  there were empty tables, so we got in without any problem.

the wine is inexpensive and appropriate.  the menu is straight forward.  the food is amazing.

C.S. is going to enter its 40th year, and with good reason.  the owner and creator crafts not only the food, but has carved, built, painted, and designed the entire room, from the floorboards to the furniture, up the walls and to the ceiling.
Pop and I reminisced of our visits to San Fran while we discussed and fused business and art, logic and emotion, instinct and thought.  the restaurant was THAT inviting and comfortable.

we left with satisfied delight.
author: Jaime D.

description:
All F's for Caffe Sport - Fun atmosphere, Funky decor, Funny staff, Fabulous food, Fair prices - Fantastic!

When we asked the waiter how the mussels were, he said great and showed us his!  The food is served family style.  The mussels (18$?) were great, in a red sauce heavy on the garlic, with a green salad (7$) this was more than enough for two with one of the best Chianti's I've ever had (28$).

CASH ONLY
author: Sheri C.

description:
I had been here a few times several years ago and went again for my boyfriend (and his sister's) birthday last night.  It was as good as I remembered.

I brought a bottle of wine, which they immediately corked and poured for us (I'm not sure if there's a corkage, though, but if there is, it isn't much).

We ordered Rustica all' Antonio (penne with cheese, shrimp, and scallops), Pesto, Scampi All' Antonio (prawns in white sauce), and Pasta con Carne e Funghi (meat and mushrooms).  All of the dishes (except the scampi) are penne and DELICIOUS.  I especially love their pasta.  And it's family-style, so the dishes are huge.

OMW.  I almost forgot.  They start your meal with bread and this delicious spicy creamy tomato dip.  Heaven.  Heaven.

Service last night was a little slow, but in the past it's been super attentive.

We also got another bottle of wine (Chianti, I think -- decent).

The whole meal (which fed 6 adults and 2 kids with leftovers) was $127!!  Usually this place turns out to be rather pricey, but somehow it was totally reasonable last night.

Oh, and it's cash only (I do hate that!).
author: S J.

description:
Thank You!  We had a marvelous evening at the Caffe Sport, in North Beach.  
We parked across the street in a fairly priced private lot, and then had a super birthday party with 20 people!.  The food and service was excellent, as the staff had perfect timing.  All the dishes were excellent, starting with a salad with an perfect dressing.
I highly recommend the Caffe Sport for a great evening out, or a private party.
  Thanks to all.  
David and Jennifer Austin
author: David A.

description:
While I lived in the Bay area from 1994-1996, I frequented this place as much as possible...though I was trying to eat at the other 10,000 restaurants before I departed back east! 

LOVE THIS PLACE. Although I have never had a less than superb meal or service..one particular night there was something going on with the seating...cant really remember the details ...but the staff and the chef always make it fun and a memorable evening!! That is... if you like funny flirtatious Italians! My first visit there when they informed my brother in law that they didn't except credit cards he was sure that something must be up...his suspicions increased when he went to order a bottle of wine...there only one bottle only one price and if I recall...there was only one type of pasta that night rigatoni...our group got a kick out of watching the interactions of my suspicious and skeptical brother inlaw...however after the food arrived we were so busy eating, laughing and drinking that my brother in law finally relaxed. We went there several times after that. And every time Ive visit SF I make sure I go there. Its not just a great restaurant with sauces to die for ...but its an experience!!
author: Betty W.

description:
This was my Grandpa's favorite back in the day, my dad's favorite to this day, and my favorite to this day as well for this neighborhood.

Why pay for the schwanky italian food, where you can come here and have a casual, funky, DELICIOUS meal around a big tiled table?  Eggplant parmigiana a must- all seafood is fantastic.  

The owner used to remember my g-pa, I think his son holds down the fort now and it's easy to see he runs a tight ship.  

BRING CASH
author: Gabrielle J.

description: My parents have been going to this place for over 20 years and we're keeping the tradition in the family!  It's my favorite Italian spot in the city;  I had a bunch of my friends and family for dinner there on my 21st birthday.  Wine and pasta anddd antipaste!  It may look a little old from the outside but it is a gem of SF
author: Danielle B.

description:
Great Italian food served up family style. Not cheap, but not overly priced either. 

My all time fave dish here is their sauted calamari in white sauce. Also good is their pesto, and the dipping sauce they bring you with bread is fabulous!

Make sure you call them before you make the trek out here; they often leave on vacation during the holidays and close for weeks at a time.
author: Ericka A.

description:
My friend talke about this restaurant for years - raving about the food.  After all that hype, I was very dissapointed.  It has been a year since I was there and all I remember was that my pasta came swimming in oil.  Now, I know my sauce was pesto, but my pasta should not be swimming in the oil.  it was pretty disgusting to look at.

I gave it 2 stars, not 1 because the service was fun and friendly.
author: Ingrid P.

description:
This is OK food.  Often crowded.  The fish is good.  

One word of warning:  This is a cash only place so be sure you come in with enough!
author: Stitch H.

description: I really enjoyed the petrole sole with zucchini, and the special eggplant lasagna was fabulous. Cash-only. Family style, and nice Japanese-restaurant style booths. Eclectic art, made by the owner, everywhere (see photo uploaded). Very nice, a bit expensive but the usual for North Beach, and surprisingly interesting sauces and dishes. The pesto yummy.
author: Anna B.

description: Yummy Italian food and you can never go wrong to Caffe Sport. Authentic food and staff are nice.
author: One Of The Many L.

description:
I would say this spot has lost a little of its quality when it comes to the menu. Staff is still fun and outgoing, but I think the food was better a few years back when I last visited. After a couple nights hangin' in North Beach, I'd have to say this was one of the less flavorful meals we had. The wait was long, and overall I was hoping for a knock out dinner experience as I've had there int he past. Not this time. Not bad, just not what I had remembered it to be.
I will try again in a year or two, next time I make it to the area.
Unfortunately, there are probably more than a couple Italian spots I'd hit up before Sport.
author: Brian D.

description:
We came here with some family visiting us from Pittsburgh, PA.  They had been to Caffe Sport in the 1980s and remember one of the best meals they've ever had, so while in the city we all stopped in for an early dinner.

Lord have mercy!  It was a heavenly experience!  The place is decorated wildly with colorful artwork, pottery and tiles and it put us in the mood to relax and enjoy our time.

Our servers were fantastic - very knowledgeable and happy to share the history of the place as well as guide us in selecting the dishes and wine for the table.  He and the busser were very personable.

The food is magnificient, if you are a fan of garlic!  And, thankfully, we all are!  Scampi All' Antonio, Cioppino All' Antonio, Pesto Pasta, the Green Salad and Bread were some of the dishes we tried and they were incredible.  

Fun place to go!
author: Casey N.

description:
I have been going to this place since I was a kid, so we are talking the 70's... ok consistency definite 5, food a 10, just sad to see my favorite host has left... he has a new place though... Bella Venezia in the Mission.. 
I love the family atmosphere of this place and the location is prime North Beach..
author: Karen E.

description: This is food at its best! Wonderful tastes, big portions. Atmosphere is unique. They also accept credit cards now! Which is a plus. The waiters here are welcoming and fast. You won't find a better italian/sicilian food anywhere.
author: Timothy W.

description:
Prices were way too large.

Service was mediocre.

Nothing to write home about.
author: Nicole W.

description:
First,

I found this by myself on a day vacation to the area.  I walked up to the top of the hill and there it was.  It reminded me a little of Emmit Watsons in Seattle with a flavor that was not of the usual.  It is a very unique environment and the decor had me snapping photos for 30-minutes.

The Ups^^^

Atmosphere
Bread and Dipping Sauce
Top of the hill so it is down any direction you choose after you eat!

The Downsvvvvv

I did not consider it a down but some would..the service is slow and snotty.  The waiter was cool but the owner was not very happy as a person.

The food was good and I would eat there again just for the dipping sauce.  I was not hungry for the rest of the day.
author: Mark P.

description: I have lived in San Francisco for 2 years and I had never been to Caffe Sport.  What was I thinking?!?  This place was amazing!  The pasta was fresh and perfectly cooked and don't even get me started on the bread w/ some type of fish sauce, don't even ask for BUTTER.  I'm pretty sure they put crack in the sauce because when I had a taste, I couldn't get enough...I was addicted.  This place is great for a group, although it is not the largest restaurant , but the atmosphere is just perfect.  Decently priced as well, I am so glad that I finally got to try ONE of the best restaurants in NB!
author: Natalie L.

description: The pasta here is pretty good, and it came out pretty fast. The place is pretty small, and super cluttered with strange nic nacs galore, but it just adds to it's touch. Servers were pretty nice, checking in on us often. Kind of hurrying us a little bit, because we couldn't dig in right away, because we were waiting for people. But I guess they were just looking out for our best interests, because their food taste better hot? Or they wanted to get us out, so that they could have more business? Either way, I must say that I really digged the bread dip. That dip was bomb.
author: April D.

description:
The atmosphere was nice, it was very old school with a lot of fitting Italian art. However, the food just wasn't what I expected based on other yelp reviewers. I was excited to try the pesto dish and bread/dipping sauce and BOTH were not very appetizing. The pesto was just okay --- it didn't taste fresh and didn't have much flavor -- it didn't even look like a pesto sauce. The dipping sauce was good but a little salty and tasted like there was some kind of seafood in it. It is a small place and can get crowded quickly.

In all, I wouldn't come back here. It's a bit overrated and overpriced.
author: Helen M.

description: Friday night.  We stopped in around 8 and luckily a table had opened up just then.  Unbelievable.  We had the eggplant parmigiana - tasty, melty eggplant, good sauce.  And we had the mushroom and meat pasta - good though a little short on both meat and mushrooms.  The dipping sauce with the bread was outstanding.  A star short as the wait staff was too overwhelmed by the larger groups to be more than perfunctory with us.  We had to request water, request the bread.  But overall would go again.
author: Ash A.

description: So im a big food guy, i like goin out and checking out new restaurants, etc. Cafe Sport is hands down my favorite restaurant in SF (as of right now). its got a very authentic vibe to it, and the ambiance is excellent for relaxing and having a nice dinner. i highly recommend the pesto plate, and the sauce for the bread is amazing as well.
author: Sean M.

description: oh my GOD!!  from the friendly bartender (who let me try the fresh made sangria) to the tiramisu...everything was out of this world!!  We started with the salad, the dressing was to die.  Then shared the pesto pasta (believe the hype) and the sole.  For two people, 3 drinks, salad, 2 main courses and dessert, only $70-WOW!  Service was incredible, we will be back FOR SURE!  Make a ressie or be prepared to eat at the bar.  Easy parking between 5p-6p, or if you need to park in a lot, we parked at the North Beach garage on Vallejo and Stockton, only $6 for 2 hours...a bargain!!!
author: Lauraine E.

description:
I didn't have an orgasm when I popped the steamed mussels into my mouth.  Despite that, I still think the food is pretty good.  But it's the heavy fat-old-italian-grandma kind of Italian food.  So if you're in the mood for that, great.  If you want something lighter and more exotic, try something else.

I would take my friends here again, even if it was just for the crazy circus atmosphere.  Somebody at that restaurant was an amateur artist who apparently couldn't sell anything because EVERYTHING he made is still there.
author: Adam R.

description:
It wasn't too difficult to convince a bunch of incredibly hungry (albeit somewhat hung over), fatigued and enthusiastic (because it's friday and a three day weekend at that!) law students to take the modest walk to the bus stop that would load us up like cattle and bring us to North Beach.  After another week passing at a snail's pace, nothing sounded better than plates and plates of hearty, delicious pasta.

We offloaded at Columbus and Green and Stockton and headed here.  I'd called on the way there to make sure it was open and sure enough it was just rolling up the curtains for business.  

The four of us sat at the front table and quickly finished off the pitcher of water brought before us.  I ordered the Pasta with meat and mushrooms, Jalen had the pasta with cream sauce (apparently equivalent to a cheesesteak sandwich), Shadee got the calamari in cream sauce and Christie got her favorite pesto pasta.  We split a plate of fried calamari between the 4.  

Let me tell you a little about Jalen.  He's from a big family of farmers.  They work really hard out in the fields all morning and when lunch time rolls around, they're more than ready for Jalen's grandmother's food.  He's learned to eat quickly and heartily.  I mean it as a compliment to Caffe Sport when I say that Jalen could only just finish his portion of pasta, none of us could finish the calamari and my bowl of pasta was exactly what I'd been thinking of.  

The pesto was delicious as other people have said.

The highlight was the calamari dish that Shadee ordered.  But I can't remember what it's called!!  It was tons and tons of calamari in this garlic sauce.  No, to put it more accurately, it was garlic sauce with some calamari.  The garlic was so fresh and pungent that it was spicy.  I loved it.  I'm going to have to get this next time as long as I don't have to be among people after eating.  

This place was so good, I'm thinking of having my BF's birthday dinner here.

Word of warning, CASH ONLY.

Dinner is prolly different fare, and I've heard LOTS BIGGER.
author: Christina C.

description:
According to our cabbie, this is a pretty well known place for good italian food in the city.

Came here with a bunch of friends - it was a party of 9. My friend called about 3 hours ahead of time and we were able to make a reservation - sweet.

So we get there and we are pretty much right on the dot for our reservation. They tell us that it'll just be a couple minutes because they are waiting on a table to leave. Then they asked us to wait outside in the cold. Ummmm...okay. So we wait. And wait. And wait. And wait. And 30 minutes goes by. And we're cold. And hungry. So finally one of our friends goes in and asks the people to leave so we can have their table. That was pretty annoying.

But once we got in and got settled into our table, everything was great.

The food is served family style and it was very good. I think we got 5 or 6 entrees and the garden salad. We got a double order of salad but probably need a quadruple order for 9 people. I didn't have wine since I'm all prego but everyone else lapped it up and it was very inexpensive. The most expensive bottle was $40.

Overall 9 people ate for $360 and that included tip. That is awesome!

Good pasta, good wine and good cannolis = a good time for all.
author: Pamela M.

description: The ambience in this place was questionable. Almost didn't go in. But the food and wine and service were EXCELLENT! The Sicilian wine was delicious and $3 cheaper per glass than the Cali wines. The  sauces were the best I've had in an Italian restaurant and the seafood and pasta were as well.  Good food prepared with a deft hand.  A real sleeper. Plus no queue to get a table.
author: JoAnna H.

description: yum-a-licious to anything you order!!! parking sucks but worth any walk or valet!  Servers here have thick authentic Italian accents. I enjoy anything with pesto... mmm...
author: Chris L.

description: Jeffry c- don't be hating just because the owner refused to do business with you! You really are shady!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
I LOVE this place. For sure one of the best Italian spots in the Bay Area! I grew up coming here with my parents and they would always talk about wild nights they had there in their 20's and now I'm living it :-)

Great place, I'd recommend you take your friends from out of town here when they come to visit!

I'll keep going back, time and time again!
author: Morgan P.

description: We liked it but weren't blown out of our seats.  Kind of expensive for the quality and amount.  I wasn't disappointed, but I probably won't make a special trip to go again.
author: Melissa H.

description:
Greasy, simple food. The whole time I was eating there, I kept saying to myself, "I could cook this."

The sauce for the bread was good, but the food was just average. The prices should be lower to reflect that.
author: Brooks S.

description: Fresh seafood and homemade pastrami was very good. Eclectic ambiance.  The sause tasted like my italian mother's.  The service was spotty. You have to be aggressive with the wait staff to get their attention. Prices were very reasonable.  I will come back.
author: Bob B.

description: How does this place have 4 stars?!?  The food is bad.  The is no other way to say it.  My dish was basically pasta, frozen shrimp microwaved, and a cream sauce that did not not even taste good drenching the whole dish.  No creativity in the recipes, no quality ingredients, no presentation on the plate- serves me right for giving North Beach tourist traps a chance.  Strike two in North Beach.
author: Kari P.

description:
Spent last Saturday evening with my boyfriend and his frat brothers at this quaint restaurant in North Beach. As soon as i entered the place, I knew it was a winner. The smell of garlic wafts the air, the decor is Italian kitsch, and everything is served family style...like the old country. 
I would highly recommend the penne in pesto sauce....and don't forget to dip your bread in the sauce at the end. Clean that plate up! The pizzaiola is might yummy too, simple and tasty.
This is a great little spot to enjoy food and drinks with friends. The atmosphere is inviting , staff is friendly, and above all things, the food is good. I didn't give it five stars mainly because they only take cash at this joint. So be prepared, and there is an ATM outside if you're tapped out.
author: Cecilia B.

description: Probably the best sauces I've ever eaten. If the spinach ravioli had been as tasty as the shrimp and scallop pasta I would have rated 5 stars. Friendly fast service and a great atmosphere.
author: Carrie A.

description:
I am so happy a friend introduced me to Caffe Sport.

This place is, as you've probably already read, is the quintessential North Beach Italian joint. Walk in and relish the insanely noisy decor. About my only complaint with the extremely loud decor was the top 40 adult contemporary music playing. Can I get a mandolin up in here for cripe's sake?

I came here with a group from work and we ordered several different things off the menu, three of which I, the vegetarian, could try. My dish, the Pizzaiola, was a basic red sauce that was fresh and tasty as a good red sauce should be. The Aglio e Basilico was a dream of garlic, fresh basil and olive oil even with the Parmesean left off for my dietary-restricted co-worker. And the Alla Panna was sinfully creamy.

The atmosphere here is absolutely perfect, with the server wandering around the restaurant chatting up patrons and each other. "Perfect atmosphere" may well mean you don't get your check for 15 minutes after they cleared your table, but have a conversation with the people you ate with and flag down that server when he does come by like you mean it. This is North Beach, not Olive Garden.
author: Kit K.

description:
So good! I've been here twice: The first time was about 8 or 9 years ago when I was a new comer to the city. I didn't know where I was, or how to get back, or even really the name of the place, but I do remember that the family style dishes they served were fan-fricken-tastic! Finally years later I went back and holy shit - how could I have been gone so long? Caffe Sport is great because of the location, the decor, certainly the waiters (who are either hilariously funny or such assholes its hilarious!), but really its the food that will get you going back. I went with a party of 9 - ordered 7 dishes and a couple bottles of wine and everyone walked out the door much happier, and only $24 poorer, than when they walked in.

By the way - We got Luciano (Sp?) as our Waiter and he definitely falls into the hilariously funny category. He was awesome.

UPDATE: Been here WAY more than twice now, and still loving it!
author: Jeff S.

description:
We stumbled onto this place while strolling through North Beach about 12 years ago. Someone was leaving, the door opened and we were embraced in a cloud of GARLIC!!!

Since then, I have been back two times when I visit SF. It is absolutely fabulous!! It is fun, authentic and they use lots of GARLIC!!!

This is a destination restuarant for anyone visiting SF!!
author: S N.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to take out of town visitors(especially Spanish speakers) that aren't vegan or lactose intolerant (every dish has some cheese). It's straight forward simple Italian food--heavy on the garlic, cheese and tomatoes--all served on plastic plates.

 I don't think the portions are that big, they look bigger than they really are. Two pastas and one seafood dish is sufficient for 3-4. Try the mussels (cozze). The white wine/garlic sauce is straightforward and delicious as is the Pasta w/funghi and meat and Rustica All Antonio (seafood).

As for the sauce that a few novice palates have referred to as mayonnaise, it's an Italian bechamel (becciamel or something like that). Essentially, bechamel with garlic. And the joker that said the pesto was greasy--what do you think is one of the 3 main ingredients in any pesto? Olive oil--hmm wonder why it's greasy? 

Also, the no credit cards is very common in "Family Style" Italian restaurants. It's a lot easier to launder money when there isn't a paper trail. I lived in South Philly, and many of the real  joints don't take cards. If you find that unusual, you have probably never been to the real authentic joints in So. Philly or New York. These are run by gumbahs(hard to define), not Culinary Institute grads with backings by Pat Kuleto. 

The staff is very friendly and most have been there for years. Also it's good for Spanish speaking visitors--most of the staff either speaks Spanish or understands enough to alter their Italian to an understandable Spatalian.
author: Hank S.

description:
Great spot in the North Beach district.  Amazing, flavorful Italian food but you better like garlic because your food's gonna be swimming in it.    Yuuummmmiii.  

Crowded, noisy but lots of good energy and always fun.  Don't miss it.... Check it out!
author: Rich n Nancy C.

description: This is my first review on YELP, so I hope this is as special to you when you read it, as it was for me writing.  After my experience as this delightful establishment, I could never again tilt my hat to the Gods of Cuisine, unless I first paid my due homage to the Caffe Sport.  My Aunt who has lived in San Francisco since the 1960's, said this was the best Italian restaurant in town - where the "locals" go.  The Caffe has a very modest outside façade, and is located in the North Beach district.  Last night my family and I dined here, and couldn't believe the relentlessly fantastic level of food, service and atmosphere.  The decor is wickedly amazing - it's a floor to (and on) ceiling decoration of, well, everything.  Every square foot contains something wild and different.  You won't get bored looking around this place.  We were ushered in to a side booth that was almost a semi-private room, bordered only by the entrance and carved wooden slats.  After my Aunt confirmed they still served "family style," we ordered lobster and a number of pasta dishes including shrimp/scampi, eggplant, and cheese spinach ravioli.  The wine list (I wanted a red) mostly (exclusively?) consisted of Italian wines I'd never heard of.  I asked the waiter which of a couple of choices I selected he'd recommend.  He asked if I liked full or medium bodied reds and I replied, "either."  He said something about seeing what he had.  A few moments later he came back with opened bottles of both wines - and two glasses.  He poured tasting samples (almost full glasses, actually) and invited me to take a moment and decide.  My wife and I tasted both which were incredible (both bottles were priced at $44.).  Our waiter returned and we selected the "Gergenti."  He promptly brought and opened a full bottle.  We'd never experienced this extremely generous treatment in over 30 years of fine dining through much of the USA, and I myself am a national recognized wine maker (I own and operate the Lynn Abigail Winery).  By this point in our experience, I was deeply in love with this place.  It appeared we had not one, but three waiters devoted to our care.  We never had to ask, and never wanted for anything at any time.  It was like you were "their" family and they badly wanted you to feel at home and have a great experience.  The food - all of the food - simply made the experience absolutely orgasmic.  Everything seemed to be the best of "that" thing we'd ever had.  I rarely get to San Francisco.  I will never do so again without dining at the Caffe.  Why should you dine here as well?  Why indeed!
author: Dinko W.

description: Went on a Saturday night-only a 20 minute wait. Scampi  was great- lots of garlic in a white sauce that was egg based. Salad was terrific, sole was great, pizzaiola was good too. Friendly, funky and filling.
author: joann d.

description: Been here twice.  Both times were excellent.  Best chiopinno is SF plain and simple.  I cant get enough of the sauce they give you with your bread while you wait.  The house chianti is pretty decent as well.  The atmosphere is fun and all the stuff on the walls is good for us with ADD haha!.   What more can i say other than going here will not dissapoint.
author: Adamandcarmelita K.

description:
This place is a very cozy place with bold statements made through the decor.  The decor in itself is a conversational piece before your meal comes to your table.  If you want good Sicilian food, come here!  The portions are generous and definitely family style loaded with lots of flavor and GARLIC...YUMMY!  My favorite dishes are as follows:
-Rustica All'Antonio 
-Scampi All'Antionio
-Con Vongole
The animated and cheerful servers get two thumbs up.  It's a very family oriented restaurant and they go out of their way to talk to all the patrons that visit, which to me is a must.  You really feel like family here.  This restaurant is good for a large group or if you're on a double date.  It's a bit pricey, but for generous amounts of seafood and good service, it's worth it!
author: Margarita M.

description:
So I'm not sure if I came here on an off night or what...I brought my Dad n his wife here cuz they were visiting from Seattle and I read and heard awesome things about Caffe Sport. They thought the food was great. I on the other hand, didn't totally agree

Our waiter was fun, outgoing, and playful. Decorations were fun to look at. Menu was smaller than expected. 

We ordered several dishes all of which came out very promptly. It seemed as though the noodles were premade and somewhat mushy...the different sauces were premade and not a lot of flavor...i was also surprised that there was no option of pasta, they were all rigatoni. So I wonder if their pasta was handmade or not...

I will probably come back here another time to give it a chance to prove my first review wrong...
author: Kimberly P.

description:
Great family style Italian food. Showed up on a Friday night around 8pm and only had to wait a few minutes for a table for 3 (they don't take reservations for groups smaller than 4). This place is a little off of Columbus so it's not packed with tourists.

Staff was friendly and helpful. The food was really good. I especially liked the prawns in white garlic sauce. I didn't think the cannoli was that great however. You can definitely find better at any nearby bakery.
author: Bruce D.

description:
Cash only. That's the only 2nd thought about this place, if you even want to call that a reservation...  

The food is spectacular. The calamari and pesto dishes in particular are superb and the wait staff has the best sense of humor. This place is definitely the spot for a nice birthday dinner, impressive second date, or maybe family visiting from across the country.  

College students beware: This place will set you back a few, so make sure the occasion is a good one. Regardless of price tag though, you must visit this place! 

Oh don't forget to call for reservations, none of this open seating nonsense...
author: Collin S.

description:
It seems like a popular place for locals and somehow we scored a table.  The food was kinda middle of the road but I only had one dish, pasta with eggplant.  Of course, begging them to not put cheese on it meant only a little cheese got into my dish which they hid with more sauce.  I thought the prices were a bit high for not spectacular food but they are located in the touristy part of town so high prices are to be expected.

Otherwise, the service was friendly and the decor was fun, bright, quaint,  and very amusing.
author: shannone e.

description:
Best Italian restaurant in the Bay Area. Have gone there for over 30 years now and absolutely love the food. Being that I am from Italy I might be slightly biased, but the food is absolutely superb, 

The only problem is that in order to truly enjoy the rich flavors you have to continuously cleans your palate with copious amounts of wine ;-)
author: G P.

description: Went to Caffe Sport yesterday based on the recommendation of a friend, and the excellent Yelp reviews. Simply outstanding food, excellent service, unique and pleasnt decor. Their policy now is to accept credit cards as well as cash.  The "Rustica with seafood" and the "Pesto Penne" were delicious, and the portions very generous. We will certainly be back.
author: Richard T.

description: Funky?  Yes.  Even weird?  A little.  I've never seen such an eclectic interior.  The atmosphere evokes found objects from a flee market mixed with photos of your grandfather and his friends.  It's not the spot to propose.  However, for some solidly fun Italian under $15 Caffe Sport is a total no-brainer.  The plentiful food dishes are served family-style, so get ready to share.  They are large servings too.  Several times I've enjoyed it in conjuction with the Beach Blanket performance just up the street.  You could do much worse in far fancier restaurants.  Besides, they'd be too predictable in comparison.  For it's genre this is a find.
author: Patrick B.

description: In Michael Tolliver Lives Armisted Maupin describes Caffe Sport as "a gaudy Sicilian cavern that dishes up hugh creamy mounds of seafood and pasta."
author: Dale M.

description: Someone please direct me to an Italian restaurant with better seafood and pasta in San Francisco and  I'll try it.
author: Karl H.

description:
Hmmm? 
I'm not too sure about this place.
Seems very Americano-Italiano.
Granted the dipping sauce is stellar - creamy, garlicy, orange coloured yuminess. The dishes themselves are Ok, but are loaded with WAAAAAAYYYYYY TOOOO MUUUCCCHHHH creamy cheese and garlic. Drowning is an undersatement. Also seems a bit dodgey to me, the way the dishes come out so fast. But maybe they kitchen crew are just on the ball. Who knows.
I do love the decor, like being in a crazy Sicilian fisherman's shack. That is, if  fisherman's shacks were draped in Christmas lights, with menus, and lots of tables and chairs.
Why is it that touristy restaurants always equal questionable food. It is insulting to the poor tourists.
author: MissSkip Z.

description:
I have to admit I don't get the facination with this place.

The best way to describe this place is that it was ok.  Not good, not bad, but ok.  Not sure I'd put up with the parking mess and whatnot to get here though.  If you're dying for Italian, there's better places that are better to get to.
author: Michael D.

description:
I wish I had better things to say. Unfortunately, I was soooo hyped with all the reviews that I was only let down by the reality of the situation.

-Pro(s)-
Straight to the point menu
Sauce for bread IS YUMMY as everyone states
Portions are HUGE
Decor is entertaining

-Con(s)-
The bread for the yummy sauce was cold...heat it up please!
The sauces were EVERYWHERE AND OIL GALORE
Wine glasses were older than my mom
Lobster didnt come with any utensils...I had to ask the server 
GARLIC. GARLIC. GARLIC. 

The End.
author: Morgan G.

description: By Far the most Authentic Italian food in North Beach. My family has gone to this place for YEARS- as well as my boyfriend's family. Anthony and his mother are amazing and have taken over ownership when their dad passed away awhile back. My boyfriend and I come here at least twice a month on the weekends and are always greeted with a smile and leave with full belly's and a little tipsy from the wine. :) The bread and dip you get when you sit down is addicting- be ware!
author: Michelle S.

description:
Cafe sport is a really special treat.  We have not gone to Italy, yet, but this place makes me want to go even more.  The bread and dipping sauce alone is worth going, and the pesto pasta is to die for.  I almost always have enough food left over for a doggy bag no matter how hungry I am, but tonights meal of pesto pasta and Cioppino All' Antonio(seafood stew of nothing but steamed crab legs, prawns, squid and mussels in a light lemon garlic sauce) kept me eating until all the food disseapered.  Along with all the bread on the table.  We still had room to share a delicious tiramsu dessert.
You taste all the true flavors in every bite.  
The service is excellent.  Our meal was served in less then ten minutes after ordering.  You'll savor the taste, hours after your meal.
author: Tonia R.

description: I've eaten here a few times when visiting San Francisco. It's always been good.  This time the food was very mediocre.  And mediocre food should not be this expensive.  But really, what prompted me to write this review (and to actually join yelp) was the terrible and rude service.  I will not go back.  There are too many great places, just doors away.
author: Nacho S.

description:
Easily the most disappointing Italian restaurant in the City!
The food was over-priced; pasta from a box and sauce from a jar. Definitely not worth $20 a plate.

While the wait staff was friendly and the decor was interesting, the cash only prices and over-priced food put this on my "never go again" list
author: Nichole S.

description: My family has been going to this restaurant for as long as I can remember... And it is still WONDERFUL!  Our absolute favorite is the dipping sauce that comes out first with the fresh bread.  I crave it and wish I could have some of that with my dinner every night!  The shrimp in white sauce is also a family fave!  The unique decor and warm friendly service is also a huge plus!  5 STARS and if you have never been, you are missing out!
author: Jennifer R.

description: Great place to come for loads of food, not a great place for "groups" in that its a VERY small joint. About 8 tables MAX. not hoity toity at all, good "downhome" italian cooking and portions. Go to experience it, and get there early. expect to wait because its small. but worth it!
author: Senorita V.

description:
Delicious Italian in a whimsical space.  If you're looking for a merry meal with friends in a relaxed atmosphere in Little Italy, check this place out.  

The seafood pasta as well as different ravioli and penne pasta are the best I've tasted in town.  It's hard to beat good food, great service and the atmosphere.
author: Jenny K.

description:
i've eaten in north beach so many times and never knew this place existed and even if i did i probably never would of gone in just based on the cheesy sign out front (it looks like a tourist trap) but based on a friend's recommendation we came and it was a hit.

everything is meant to be shared family style and the dishes come out within minutes of ordering and just beware that it is all very garlicky.

my favorites were the steamed clams in white wine sauce and the meat/mushroom pasta (e funghi) and the salad is a definite must also. i didn't think the bread dipping sauce was a great as the reviews made it out to seem but overall all the dishes we tried were very good, prices are very reasonable and you feel as if you've been transported somewhere else with all of the decorations and xmas lights hanging everywhere.

my only complaint is that it can get a bit stuffy inside so just remember not to go in wearing a wool sweater or anything and you should be fine.
author: georgette y.

description:
This is a restaurant unlike any other.

The decor is extremely bizarre and colorful in a good way.

The waiters hand you menus, but sometimes they decide what you're going to have. Don't worry -- it will be good.

I've never seen pasta dishes like these in any other Italian restaurant. They are truly colorful, unique and delicious.

I haven't been here in a long time, but I'm glad that the restaurant still exists, and I hope it hasn't changed.

It's places like this that make San Francisco -- along with New York and New Orleans -- a true culinary capital.
author: andrew t.

description: Originally I was going to go to Sodini's, but it's a dinner place, so I went a few doors down to Caffe Sport, and boy I'm glad I did! The decor is really unique; it's more spanish to me, save for a few posters of scenes from The Godfather and Italian football fliers. It's a feast for the eyes as well the mouth. Simple but excellent menu with garlic, tomato or alfredo-based dishes. Calamari, mussels and shrimp were excellent. I needed a caffeine boost, and the cappucino hit the spot and I finished with a wonderful slice of tiramisu (maybe some of the best tiramisu I've ever had). North Beach is a wonderful little piece of Italy, and you should come to Caffe Sport. Cash only.
author: Becca C.

description: This place is great. I've been going here since i was a kid. The food and service is excellent and the staff know how to make the dining experience fun. Very nice people. If you're a big fan of garlic then this place is definitely for you. Mainly because they don't season their food with garlic, they season their garlic with food.
author: Anthony L.

description:
If you like seafood,
If you like garlic,
If you are really hungry,
this is a place to go!
We ordered their shrimp pasta, egg plant with tomato souce,
seafood stew with garlic.. and all of them were amazing!

The interior is so fun, colorful, and lovely.
I heard from the owner that this guy name Antonio who passed away 4 years ago made all the inteior decorations, table and chairs by himselves.
You can feel the passion from his art work.

Owner is so friendly that makes you want to go back there.
First, I was a little upset because they didn't have seats when we arrived even though we had a reservation, but later on, i understood that they take time to take care all the customers equally.

This place is good for group, i think more than 3 people who you can have fun with.
This is more like casual friendly place, so don't expect them to be so nice and professional.

Price is great for that amount and quality.
Don't forget to bring a cash with you.

I will difenately go back there and bring more friends to go with!
author: Chihiro O.

description:
BEST of north beach! 

this is as OG as it gets! i've eaten at many italian spots in north beach, but nothing has topped Caffe Sport yet! TINY narrow whole-in-the-wall joint, but its a local favorite nonetheless. theres a strong aroma of pasta right when you step in. feels really cozy too. every table is unique. last time we came we sat at this one table in this gate sorta thing? pretty cool. you can see the history of the place with all the amazing decors everywhere including the ceiling!. soo sickk.  the owner of the place seems coo and strikes up a convo with customers. classic chubby, blond italian dude behind the counter lol. 

the menu is small but "QUALITY OVER QUANTITY"!! its like one page double sided. but anyway, best bread and dipping sauce ever! hands down this place has the most AMAZING seafood pasta around. lobster ravioli is a MUST!
author: Dennis C.

description: Caffe Sport's meat and mushroom pasta is my favorite and I get it all the time. I am always fascinated by the garlic decorations all over the restaurant. The staff is very friendly and the service is exceptional. Family style is the way to go. I am giving it 4 stars and not 5 because they only accept cash.
author: Rejina S.

description: It is amazing how this place makes simple recipes taste so good.  It is hard to write a lot about this place be cause it is so simple and for a lack of a better term simply perfect.  I'll let the 5 stars speak for themselves.  This is a great place for medium size groups because everything comes family style, the only down side is that it is cash only.
author: Ryan S.

description:
Food here is good.  The prices are good for what you're getting.  Definitely order family style.  The clams are good.  I enjoy most of the pastas, and LOVE the Crab Ensalada (cold crab drenched in garlic flavored sauce).  The Crab Ensalada is really what pulls me back to this place once in a while.  The sauce is finger-licking good (if you like garlic).  I can't eat here too often, as I can feel the garlic sauce in my arteries as soon as I leave.  To be fair, I'd probably give this place more like a 3 1/2 stars because of the cleanliness.  The decor on the ceiling is cool, but kind of old and dusty. 

Also, come early b/c parking is a b*tch!
author: farmta s.

description: The best shrimp scampi and seafood you'll ever have! Scampi al a Antonio.  Garlicky and fresh. It's the best italian.
author: Allie M.

description: OK - here's the deal . . . Caffe Sport is not an Italian restaurant  . . . it's a SICILIAN restaurant!! It's peasant food. It's peasant decor. We've been going to Caffe Sport for 25 years. There was a little glitch when Antonio Sr passed on and Antonio Jr took over but  we were there this past weekend and it's back to the greatness we remember. Antonio Jr.(young !!) is in charge and has come out of his shell. He was a great host and the food was FABULOUS. The pesto is to DIE FOR!! If you want to linger over hoity toity expensive Italian food in an upscale sterile atmoshphere - don't go here!!! This place is fast, fun,fabulous and resonable priced. BTW - as I write this we are trying to duplicate the bread dipping sauce - with little success. You know those Sicilians . . . they give you MOST of the recipe :)
author: Tony P.

description: After decades of hearing great things about Caffe Sport we finally got a chance to try it out due to a birthday dinner invite.  First of all, getting to this restaurant is challenging like all others in the North Beach area.  Well, we finally figured out there is a parking lot a couple of blocks away.  However, as to the restaurant itself it is in a word I suppose 'eclectic'.  I understand that the owner made and collected the knick knacks that are posted all over the walls.  But the décor was not the problem.  The food was.  Firstly the menu is terribly limited and the prices are very expensive.  The wine list is also limited, but we settled on a bottle of pinot grigio.  It was terrible tasting and did not taste like any pinot grigio I've ever tasted.  It was very brash and horrid.  The food itself was not anything spectacular nor tasted too good.  For one thing the cioppino was overpowered by too much garlic that was still raw.  The other dishes like the pasta con vongole were just ok but overpriced for what was served.  I am sorry to say that the desserts are really nothing but two choices:  House made tiramisu and cannoli.  And if you are unlucky like our table was all of the tiramisu sold out leaving the only choice of cannoli. The problem with the cannoli is that it's not fresh.  The guy just took some from a cardboard box and filled them with some sort of cream and dried fruit.  It just did not taste good.  And it's not cheap either at $8/each.  In short, it was a very disappointing meal from beginning to end including wine.
author: Luisa T.

description: This place has the best italian food in San Francisco.  I loved the pastas and the clams are to die for.  The restaurant is a tad bit cramped, but it really made you feel like you're in Europe.  The service was pretty good.  Overall, the food was excellent and it's just one of those cute restaurants that you'll keep going back to.
author: Annie S.

description:
Caffe Sport in North Beach - I tried to love it, really. Most people seem to, given the reviews. My opinion is there's really nothing special about the food. The decor is the only thing that  makes this place unique,  and it's worth one visit.

My husband and I stopped in on a Thursday night and got a table with no wait. The menu looked like its been in print for years, which might explain why, when my husband asked about making a slight substitution (he does this everywhere, and no one has ever said no), he was told absolutely not. The dishes were traditional and couldn't be changed, as if the cooks were programmed to cook these recipes only, which made me suspicious... why can't you throw in a few clams instead of a lobster tail?  We also saw cauliflower being served a few tables away that looked sooo good but were told that it wasn't available to the public (meaning us).

The meal was good enough, We started with the green salad for two, which was absolutely drenched in dressing. The pasta with tomatoes, garlic, and olive oil was tasty, although I had expected actual tomatoes tossed with pasta. instead was served pasta with red sauce.  Okay, the tomatoes were there, but why not just call it red sauce? The prawns would have been fine except for the thick white sauce on top that was uninteresting and, well, thick. We both loved the bread and slightly spicy dipping sauce.
